oD-_gg2_qZUmS73Y2lpOTA.text: Breakfast is good! Selection is great! Purchased the Buffet of Buffets 24 hour pass last night so can't be bad right!? This is buffet #2. The lighting is right enough to see your food and not too busy this morning. The only downside is that the restrooms are not in the restaurant but out in the casino. Other than that good buffet to eat at!

J0wT141g88-MOIHsenbCIw.text: I was there a couple weeks ago for the 1st time. I've been 2 vegas tons of times but never to this buffet. I was sssoooo dissapointed. The selection is miniscule & it pretty much sucked sh%&. Come on the place didn't even have pizza & for the lunch price of about $17 it was not worth it. I actually only paid about $12 cause I used some total rewards points & a coupon I got frm ballys, but not even worth that. Peeps, when u go to vegas & want a good buffet with a huge selection for a cheap price, take the free shuttle frm harrahs or ballys to the rio, walk next door to the gold coast. Gold coast has a good lunch buffet for about $8. Or go to the [rleans buffet, they have pretty much the same huge & awesome buffet for about the same price. The strip buffets are way overpriced. Even the excalibur has a better buffet! Save some $, if uw want awesome pizza ck out a little walk up place in the paris walkway to ballys. I 4got what its clld but its right across frm the paris buffet & its $10 for 2 big slices (the artichoke & margherite were fab) & a drink.

WRZMB0r3TOBvUJTUwZd3Fg.text: I was staying at Harrah's so opted to give Flavors a try.  All in all, not bad for the price.  Not the best buffet in Vegas, but not anywhere near the worst either.  The food was very acceptable and would go again if it was convenient.

xx2jWQPakRxTpIwnyU2c-g.text: Absolutely horrible...don't waste your time or money.     As another reviewer said, this place has gone way  downhill!   The food was horrible and the ambiance is depressing...

OUcMIw6zGtzYjcJxjla1bw.text: My hubby seems to think this was one of his favorites.. I remember the selection was pretty huge, but average tasting.

VoSHGLid_Z6IkDIVRQa-gA.text: I am local when I do go on the strip I go to harrahs for the buffet, it's clean and the service is always excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sbcj28mPoUdDX8QSYY_Ojg.text: I'm sorry to say that this is one of the worst buffets I have been to in Las Vegas. I came because I had a discount from one of the discount show ticket places. The salad bar was almost nothing. Some of hot food looked like it had been sitting out to long. What I did eat was either to salty or no flavor at all. When I was getting food, I could hear kitchen staff talking about someone and they were being referred to as a prostitute. Nope. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone.

ZJZyq5U_7UXhZFnUwbLAVQ.text: Great buffet. Huge selection and worth the price. So many meats and different ethnic sections. They also have the Pepsi machines that make a million combinations of sodas

RimoZQ5O8pRY7cWDkc4XlQ.text: There is variety, that is for sure. There were a lot of vegetable options, not sure if they were vegetarian or vegan, but it looked like a plant-based effort. What wasn't there was seasoning or appeal. I wasted 2 plates tasting only one bite of each thing looking for a winner. Even the desserts were oddly flavorless. There was an ice cream and sorbet section that seemed interesting if you like ice cream....lots of flavors. Not sure why I tipped as the only thing they did was bus plates, you have to get your own drinks, so remember that when you pay. I way overtipped.

z2QSTk8yUo81ahd4lc2Fng.text: This was our first time and I saw the promo ad that said buffet includes Prime Rib and Snow Crab Legs for the lunch menu. I asked the hotel concierge if the menu for lunch really included the Prime Rib & Crab Legs and she checked on their system and later confirmed that it did.   But to our dismay, we found out after paying that it did not! When asked the chef, we were told it was only for dinner menu. Bad advertising and deceiving concierge info! We had visitors from out of the country that were disappointed who were looking forward to it since we were even given the assurance outside! Sorry that we came! Dishonesty is not a good business practice...

mmRQkpTzdHCu_SPsXrEKVQ.text: Amazing lunch here with crab legs, shrimp, omelette, Asian, and Tex Mex! Lots of salad and dessert options also. Loved the special food as it was warm and good quality. Service polite. Would return in a moment and recommend to all! Wish they had Orange chicken and Chicken Marsala on Buffett but otherwise happy as a clam to dine here

Fl87xJPLBWuCBNL2L2PWdA.text: Food is okay. Self serve beverages. Not too many selections. I like the prime rib it's soft and flavorful. Crabs okay , desserts okay too, not to many selections.

3D89OvC4LYAs_tU4HCMX_w.text: I visited Flavors during dinner time.   The service was excellent. Susan the cashier had a very Las Vegas greeting which I thought was creative and cute: "have a lucky day." On top of that, the server/busses Adrian was also friendly  and without even me asking, he knew I had food that would be messy, so he placed some wet tissues for me. Quick and friendly service with a smile is very refreshing to see, and nothing less than the Caesar standard.  Now to the food: Not too often do I see a food that I want to try right away. Actually, what I usually do when I'm at a buffet is walk up and down the line and preselect my food before I get my plate. I do this because I expect the basic essentials of a buffet and I look at presentation and what's in the food before I select.  Not with Flavors.   As I did my walk, I found two items that caught my attention right away: Tilapia Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Marsala.   The Chicken Marsala was good: meat has enough juice and the flavors were there. The only semi-bad thing I can say is that the chicken pieces were a little too large. But overall, it was a good Bite.  On to the Tilapia: it was cooked just right. The only comment I have is that the butter flavor was a little overwhelming, even overpowering the pepper. I had hoped to taste a little bit more spices.   There are other items that I have tried that I won't comment on because I think this review is already long winded. Overall, the quality of this buffet is very good, with the potential of being excellent. The service is definitely there, it's just the food that needs a small amount of tweaking to reach that potential of excellence. Despite that, I would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tilapia shrimp scampi
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala

HZmq4TsWrRiSm0Dq6LSUpw.text: Meh.  I had 3 buffets while I was in town and this was my least fave.  Huge wait in a short line for them to up breakfast over to lunch and yet when we got in most of lunch wasn't put out yet.  Selections weren't enormous.  The pasta sauce was too sweet - if you liked seafood then sure, fill your boots, but otherwise your selections were limited.  Rotisserie pork was delicious with the rosemary potatoes.   Creme brulee was more like crime brulee it was a sorry excuse.    $25++ and grumpy ass service? Go elsewhere!

RZ_4N17eKrMTh2w-B3DCrg.text: I managed to find a Groupon deal for flavors. Before the Groupon, I was told to go to try places like the Wicked Spoon, The Buffet at the Wynn, and Bacchanal Buffet. Even though they had great ratings and reviews, I was still in Vegas on a budget and dinner buffet prices are steep. Flavors is pricey as well but buying the Groupon, we still made out better than the regular price because AYCD alcoholic beverages were included.  The Groupon allowed us to jump in the reward member line and get special seating. It was great because the line to be seated was shorter. The service was very slow but the servers are very friendly. Maybe they were understaffed that night but we only were able to get 2 drinks a piece because the drink server pretty much had to serve our whole area alone. I guess it's good that we got two drinks a piece versus zero so the Groupon wasn't a total waste but I'm still not happy that I couldn't have more drinks.  The food was really good!!! There were so many options to choose from: Asian, Mexican, Italian, seafood, soul food. It was all delicious. I was so stuffed that I couldn't indulge in the desserts but my boyfriend let me try some of his ice cream and the strawberry ice cream was bomb!!  It would be great if they had a Groupon like this the next visit to Vegas because I would definitely come back. I would try to come to dinner early so I would have more time to indulge in food and drinks. Hopefully service speeds up as well.

cPIXdAuUsf8CsBrzsmfUJw.text: they are not accepting my voucher from groupon!  even that day was not christmas holiday and holiday weekend!  be aware of this place!

Ee20R7Ramm3wFhU-ZN8QTg.text: Flavors was a decent option for me as a gluten free traveler. It's usually challenging to find gluten free at a buffet. I wasn't left hungry here! Unlimited fresh brewed iced tea was great, too.

6hPV0q6oyRUqgdOUKQW9rg.text: I know we are in the desert but the food should not be dry. But I gambled and lost on this buffet.

8K5d-EZ2AB-PO4K88cX7pw.text: No vegan options. I ate fries and rice. The "vegan" labels are incorrect. Mostly meat and seafood at this buffet.

0CyE1IAZ0oP9weCAvc2D-Q.text: Waited in line 20 minutes. One cashiers. Platinum guests kept showing up. Making the "regular " line more backed up. Asked them if  they can get another cashier was told no. "Im  the only one here" we went and ate somewhere else

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MT3HCIrAJ_Hvp8qH-vFtTw.text: Considering that buffets aren't usually the highest quality of food, I was actually pleasantly surprised at the amount of, well, flavor at Flavors. I didn't taste a single thing that was bland and some of it was even actually quite good. Plus, there's something for everyone with stations ranging from seafood to meat carving and Italian, Mexican, Asian and more. It was a bit overwhelming at first trying to decide what to eat because there's so many choices.   I started with a bowl of clam chowder that was very thick and creamy and a plate full of pasta, fried chicken and potatoes. I don't usually care for pastas at buffets but these pastas tasted great. They even put a fresh serving of chicken alfredo pasta out while I was browsing and the chef recommended that I give it a try. He did not steer me wrong. It may have been my favorite overall. Plate two included a small salad from the "hidden" salad bar, which is past the desserts on the left side. There's not a ton of toppings and I noted that there were no hard boiled eggs, which are my favorite, but everything was fresh.   Then I moved over to the carving station, which was the biggest disappointment for me. At Friday lunch, there were three pork options and one turkey. Seeing as I don't eat pork, I was a bit bummed that there wasn't more variety. I tried a slice of turkey but it was a bit dried out. Adding some mashed potatoes and gravy did help some though. It would have been nice to see at least a beef option too.   But my disappointment quickly subsided when I saw the expansive dessert section. The gelato was a welcomed treat and the fruit tart was delicious!   The biggest draw for the buffet was the added all-you-can-drink special. After all, it is Vegas! Our waitress did a wonderful job of keeping our mimosa glasses full. I must have had four glasses over the course of the nearly three hours that we gorged ourselves at the buffet.   Check out Groupon to save some money. We got the lunch buffet option for about $23.50 per person, which is a good deal when you consider it includes alcohol. Honestly, the fact that it included alcohol was the biggest selling point for us. The fact that the food was better than decent was just an added bonus.

iwRxqEQqhKUSGUcjpuVsyg.text: I should've read some of the reviews before going to this particular buffet. Someone of a disappointment, paying about $39 for both fair that's probably worth only about $19.99 The food is the little mediocre the quantity they put out is great, the variety is great, but the quality is a bit pour. Especially for being a hotel on the strip in the middle of everything I would have expected the buffet to be of much more quality.  Granted the staff there is only two clear up plates and turn the tables over to the new patrons but the attitude they have is pitiful. If they don't like the job than they should leave their job because it seems like our particular person could care less slamming this is just being a horrible person at work. To give me an example the table next to us as they left a notice that they left their personal Shopping bag behind And when I went to advise the staff who I just was describing she said well I don't care I'm not gonna chase after them they can figure it out. Me and my friends looked at each other and we said, wow, really?!?!. Period. Perio and when I went to advise the staff who I just was describing she said well I don't care I'm not going to chase after them they can figure it out. Me and my friends looked at each other and we said, wow, really?!?!  Luckily one of my friends saw a girls by the desert area leaving and I caught up to them letting them know that the table that they sat on I think they left their personal shopping bag they thankful he went back and got their personal item and thank me, but it's disgusting to know that one of the staff at the restaurant could give a damn about anything. So because of her attitude and because of the way she was during our dining we did not tip her her added to suck and you know where the food wasn't as great either. I am sorry if you are in an industry where tips is part of your salary but with a horrible attitude you don't deserve even a dollar.  I will most likely not decide to come back to this particular book fair and not recommended, I'm sorry I apologize to the establishment but not a great experience.

zG0gZZxizbUFcr0iOOyA3A.text: Look, I eat Vegas Buffets all the time but I normally do the higher quality Aria, Bellagio, Wynn, Cosmo, Caesars and have zero digestive problems.  I had the Buffet of Buffets deal and went to Harrahs for Omelette and Oatmeal breakfast coffee and OJ.  Well minutes later I found myself clenching my buttocks and speed walking down to Venetian not wanting to shit my pants.     Don't do Buffet of Buffets deal especially if you don't have free comps.

58t_ZYNLCgSMuD5Qg6yahg.text: This was the biggest disappointment of the trip. In the past, regardless of where we were staying, we would eat here at least once per trip. This is not the fanciest buffet, or the most expensive, but Flavors used to provide a good value for the money. I recommended this place to friends, and the six of us went for dinner. We found that the price had gone from the low twenty dollar range up to $36! That puts this middle-of-the-road buffet up in the Paris and Bellagio price range. Well we were here and hungry, so we paid and went in.   After being shown our table, I went directly to the crab legs, the man reason I come here. There were no split crab legs on ice, just a bunch of small I-don't-know-where-these-came-from crabs the size of my fist in a bowl. I was extremely disappointed, but took a plate of them back to the table. The crab was horrible. So small, they were impossible to get any meat out of. Also for $36 I expect the shrimp to be bigger and peeled, but Harrah's has other, lazier ideas.  I went back and got some Italian food, Chinese food, and made a trip to the carving station. The carved turkey was ok, but both the Italian and Chinese offerings were sub-standard, and there were not many selections. The buffet was barely worth half the price.  As far as service is concerned, there is none. In the past, a server would bring glasses of ice water, ask what other drinks (soda, coffee, juice) they could bring, and would clear your plates promptly. In return, we would tip pretty generous for a buffet. In Harrah's brave new $36 world, there was a collection of room temperature bottles of water left haphazard on the table, and you can get you own damn drinks. Because they have installed a Pepsi machine, Harrah's has decided you can juggle that back to your table too. Look, I can get my own drink, but when I pay as much as I did I expect someone to bring it. I also expect someone to take the dirty plates away, but the staff has been cut so low, it's not possible for the overworked staff to do so.  The very worst part of this whole fiasco was the fact that I had recommended this nightmare to other people, based on past meals. I was so embarrassed, I apologized a number of times.  If you look back on my complaints, it's apparent that this was not a one-off bad meal, this is the way they it is all the time. I don't know if Harrah's thinks it's customers are stupid, or if they just want to get one meal out of you before they burn you, but I am not going back. On top of that, I will tell everyone I can what a rip-off this place has become. We are Harrah's/Caesars Total Rewards members, and have been staying exclusively at Harrah's Vegas properties at least once a year. When we are in Lake Tahoe, Reno, or New Orleans we gamble at Harrah's. I feel so burnt by this, the next time we go to Vegas, I will make a point at staying at a MGM/Mirage property, or SLS, or anything that is not Harrah's. And if their management wants to contact me, you can reply to this review.

LbGblj_deNK57VcgkDHH4Q.text: I had a very negative experience here. I had purchased a Groupon for the two person seafood brunch buffet, and when we got to the front counter, we were informed that they were not accepting any Groupons because of the holiday weekend. This was a little disappointing, but we understood and asked to use the face value without the discount, meaning we would just pay the extra on top of the voucher value. Instead of honoring the face value (which should never expire for any reason), the person at the front desk just kept loudly repeating BLACKOUT WEEKEND. Not only was this person rude to us, they also were speaking loudly and angrily at anyone who approached them with a question.   The service at the front was bad enough, but the quality of the buffet space was terrible. It looked like an old, beaten up cafeteria, and the drinks were all served in flimsy plastic cups that you would find at a frat party.   The only positives about this experience is that the (pre-frozen) crab was edible, and we had a wonderful server, Leo.   We will not be returning to this buffet and do not recommend it to anyone else.

otPNHOkBuXEjULPrJH3cSA.text: Our group of about 25 people came here for dinner after a day at the lake.  The price for a weekend dinner was high priced ($34) for low quality & limited selections.   Food is similar to cafeteria food but they did have king crabs. The salad selection was extremely limited as well as their sushi selection.   Everyone in our party left saying, "Never again."  There are much higher quality buffets for lower prices in the area. If you're wondering if paying a little more would be better than going to a cheaper buffet, go anywhere but Harrah's.

9EsIOw57KswbRzsyHnuXAg.text: This was the worst buffet I've ever been to in Las Vegas.  It was a combo purchase with a show in the same casino.  You could smell all the seafood dishes from 20 feet away they were so old & disgusting.  The normal price for dinner is $31 per adult.  Vegetables were either over cooked or too hard.  Salad bar was very small.  Prime rib was fatty.  It was disgusting.  Service also poor with bad attitudes.  SAVE YOUR MONEY & find a better one.

LZvFW35szF_V84eChQ44tw.text: It's okay, love the Canalis and icecream. The rest of the food was OKAY for a buffet. I got a Groupon for 2 for around 38 dollars so it was worth the price.

LbVuY6-mwXekeNJmgYu5Og.text: Edible but not enjoyable Don't waste your money paying full price. Find a $25 voucher from one of the many hagglers around the strip.

ae7Ek2XfpctgLoajRc0MpA.text: Amazing buffet! Great staff! Everyone was so friendly and efficient! After being denied entrance for lack of dress code at the Flamingos buffet my boyfriend and I decided to check out Flavors buffet and it was well worth it.

mifdh4nNpTfuvsYm1k3VIQ.text: The crab legs were decent more flavorful than the carnival buffet at Rio. Prime rib was good but not much else to choose from. Thee bread pudding was good.

ctitr_LtjhM2JwgykI38Yg.text: Not worth coming here if paying the single buffet price. Nothing spectacular about this place. I would skip it.

K66aV3nraeNPUpKksfNgXQ.text: Came with a party of 16 and our server was amazing! Probably the only reason why I would rate this buffet with 3 stars. Our drinks were never once empty, and we were constantly being asked if we needed anything.  As far as the food goes... eh...typical buffet food. Nothing great or mouth watering good, but it did the job.

0Lqs330vXNj5-Q5McTpofQ.text: Food was good, fried chicken not so great. The crab legs were delicious and so was the clam chowder! I suggest getting clam chowder putting a ton of crab in out and Tabasco then missing? Mixing it up, delicious! Save room for dessert! Homemade ice cream and waffle cones!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little cupcakes anyone?

KBiigJyhhwniDKwN6KUztw.text: This place is poorly run.  The people at register have two lines, one for platinum and one for regular customers. Both were empty so we thought it'd be fine to just ealk in through the platinum entrance because we didn't want to walk around the corner and have to follow some velvet rails, but apparently it isn't ok and we were told to go out and line up again anyways, a waste of everyone's time. Then they have a line for a waitress. What kind of buffet has seating waitresses? I've never had to be shown to a designated seat at any type of AYCA and this place isn't even busy. There's seating EVERYWHERE. Lastly for ll that, utensils are managed by the waiters. I couldn't get a new fork for this second dish that had vastly different food. I dont want my meat forks in my salads because it's greasy.  Foodwise, it's definitely not as good as it looks. Rhe selection is also really small for the price we payed, but it's Vegas so I expected as much. At least it looks nice here.

PHyn8PxUHWpSbeMv41SRMw.text: Came here for dinner on a saturday night. Food is horrible and way overpriced. Payed 36 per person for dinner and food is not even appetizing. The meat station had prime rib and ny steak ( it felt like i was chewing on rubber). I lost my appetite just walking around the food station. Seriously screw this place. I would have been more satisfied from eating at burger king. I find it ironic this place is called flavors! Ass and feet is more appropriate bc thats what their food tastes like!

NAsCOGwJKLB9g6MFfNI3Qw.text: Service was awful. We paid for "all you can drink" but our server never came around to bring us more drinks, therefore we left full but thirsty. They never came and got our empty plates. We had to pile them on the table next to us. Fortunately, the food was good.

xQ15t0qyGGN4Z_TVv9X9Ew.text: I would give it 0 stars if possible. Food selection is mediocre but the service is even worse. Paid for open bar, Vip seating but we were placed in the non-vip section, been 2 hours and 3 request and we're waiting for our first drinks. Called floor manager to discuss, wonder if he'll arrive before our drinks. DO NOT GO HERE!!!

V3tAiOB_9Nqfs6NQEqbypQ.text: Service at counter is quick to seat. Drink and wait staff are somewhat slow. Had to ask for things throughout the meal.  The selections are somewhat more on the seafood selections. The food was mediocre tasting at best. Some meats were over cooked or overly sauced. Some items got cold fast. Nothing was remarkable or different from other buffets. Dessert selections are decent but not great.   Some selections include crab legs (steamed or chilled), prime rib, ribs, fish, chicken, pizza, gelato, and cotton candy.  Staff was accommodating to find us candles for a birthday we were out celebrating.   Overall just three stars. Almost two stars had it not been for the candles. I would give another try. Not the worst and not the best of buffets.

jadbDMvn7DXIaJedxq1Ibg.text: Not the best buffet I have been to, and certainly not the worst. It was fair at best. The crab legs and shrimp were horribly overcooked and rubbery. The salad bar was minimal and the sushi rolls were dried out during Saturday Brunch. The roast beef was amazing and the chicken fried steak was good (which is very unusual in this part of the country). The lemon bar was horrible, but the creme brulee my husband had was great. Probably won't go back. It was pricy for the quality of the food.

Gcw5ckyDn6JqgzILclg_lQ.text: Flavors, the Buffet was a pretty standard buffet.  Not the widest selection, but good enough where you'll be full.  Really, do not come here for steakhouse quality stuff.  I had someone sitting at the table next to me critiquing the chicken.  Who critiques chicken at a buffet?  IT'S A BUFFET!  In addition, I got it at a discount through Tix4Tonight and so paid a total of 18 bucks for dinner.  I was impressed with that kind of pricing.  I got sat at the area where Marianne works!  Marianne is an amazing individual.  Checked up on me various times to make sure I was okay.  I would come back here just because she's awesome!    The high priced items were the crab legs and top sirloin.  Otherwise, everything else was pretty standard buffet items such as mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and sushi rolls.  It would be more worth the full cost if they had sashimi, but they didn't.  The dessert area was pretty good.    If you want something relatively economical, this would be the place to go.  Otherwise, if you're looking for the world, maybe check out another one.

1hfoJs9dCMelKT9Z4QpZrw.text: It's typical for a buffet with the typical variety for the selection but the crab legs cold/hot boy were they salty swimming in a pot of salt loaded water?  I wouldn't come here for the crab I would suggest Rio's carnival for their crab legs.  On the other end of the entrance the salad bar wasn't bad I think oddly that was my highlight of the evening.   I would say for about $30 the buffet was ok, we got there about 4:30 and missed the dinner rush on the way out we could see the long line trying to get in.

d28pxW_jNuSGv94hBTnQ3A.text: Surprisingly good:  Huge assortment including American, mexican, Asian, Italian  Food not salty - rare for buffets Good for the money - had great shrimp,  fantastic clam chowder and crab legs Dessert plentiful and not nauseating sweet Great location by high Roller  No drawback..don't expect $60 dinner buffet but for the money best money can buy on the strip!

awSC0Z_0j4WNL2OGXIh63Q.text: While no one should eat the amount of food available at this well priced, well placed and pleasant buffet, once a year when I am in Vegas, it is my first nights dinner stop. The food is varied and interesting. While certainly not gourmet quality, it is a taste of many different cuisines topped by many sweet desserts. Well worth a visit and the price is IMHO the best around.

WNC8nNip-9h0KzVPECmKgQ.text: Just had lunch here not as big as buffet at Caesar, but much better. Had great choices for lunch and food was presented at a health temperature. Service was very friendly all the way up to the head chef. I was impressed at seeing him checking buffet line several times during my lunch. He would offer to help customers standing at line as well. Will recommend good food without all the fluff.

dT28sXQF0oVuQCsNvt9xGA.text: I'd give it zero stars if I could! We went late on a Friday night, about 9 pm only because we did the Buffet of Buffets pass.  There was a short line but it moved quickly.  The food was disgusting!  Everything looked old.  There are hardly any items for vegetarians.  Going in to any Vegas buffet not eating meat you know you are at a disadvantage, even the pasta, pizza, etc had meat!  My husband said the meat was tough and tasted like Hometown Buffet.  I'd say the only plus was they have mini cannoils!  Even they weren't great though.  The service was top notch, that's about it.  Skip this one for sure!  It's not worth your time, especially on the Buffet of Buffets when you can go to Rio or Paris.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burned pie crust!

f5fgtwhz2RYOpK0lKn40aQ.text: ***2.5 stars*** I came in knowing that it wasn't the best buffet, but $27 seemed pretty cheap compared to other places on the strip.  I'm not a picky eater, just look at my previous reviews lol. I grew up poor so I know the struggle, and I wasn't looking for fine dining at $27. This place still disappointed me, though.  I was excited for the crab legs, but couldn't even eat them. They were too salty. Like a previous reviewer said, it's like they were soaked in salt water. On the other hand, the mussels were "marinated" but they were so bland! I'm a seafood lover, so this was upsetting for me that their seafood was not up to par.   Eating in Thailand, a third world country, was more delicious (not saying that the food in Thailand is supposed to be gross or anything, but cmon).   The rest of selection was okay, if a bit small. The Mac and cheese was creamy, the spaghetti was very flavorful, probably the most flavorful I've had! The tortillas were a little hard (not the hard shell ones but the ones that were supposed to be soft) so it seemed like they were left there for awhile. They only had chicken fajitas to fill them with also, which disappointed me. I love carne asada tacos haha.  The desserts were average. The ice cream was yummy and they had gelato as well. The chocolate mouse and mint mousse in the cups were plain, even according to my brother. The chocolate ecstasy was very delicious though if you're a chocolate lover.   Overall, it wasn't anything special really. I would give it 1.5 stars.  The service, like stated by previous reviewers is the reason why I gave the extra star. They were attentive and very friendly, though there was an elderly woman worker complaining about being tired within earshot. I know it was close to closing time, but you shouldn't act like that in front of customers. This is coming from a past manager in retail. Presence and attitude is key to a happy experience on the guest's behalf. That was the only person who wasn't very good with service. Special thank you to the Asian worker who was so funny and nice though!  I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly.

1utxzJ0kzHGAoVlr8JMcuA.text: Worst buffet for the money!! We spent $24 for the worst food I've had since we been in Vegas! Spend your money somewhere that you can actually enjoy the meal, so disappointed!!

H9vaK8ksXZ699equkPmyFQ.text: For the price I thought this was an very good breakfast buffet. Would come back and recommend. They have everything and the quality is good.

RYhzv84DlWsitY_FwL4Vlw.text: "They have mashed potatoes!!!" exclaimed a child to his grandparents as if it were Christmas morning.  I couldn't help but laugh.  Just a couple of minutes before that, my wife and I had our photo taken with a 5 foot spoon and fork that the resident buffet photographer then tried to sell to us for $25 during dinner.   I had a couple of comps for the "Buffet of Buffets" that were about to expire.  Even though we pretty much only do buffets when friends and family visit, we could not let these babies expire without using them.  The line for Paris and Planet Hollywood's buffets were over an hour long when I called so we ended up here.  No line!  No surprise.    We were last here 5 years ago and not much has changed.  The most significant thing was that they got rid of their chocolate fountain and now give out bags of cotton candy.  The best things were the crab legs which were larger and tastier than the ones at the Rio we had a day later.  I also liked the carving station and the dessert area so we mainly just filled up on those.  The salad, Mexican and Asian stations were all mixed bags.  I heard the mashed potatoes were great....  A family of 5 sitting next to us were already on dessert and as we were about to leave, the father got up to speak to the manager to complain about the pasta being cold.  He said it ruined their dinner so the manager fully refunded them!  They were already on dessert!!!  So for cheapos looking to take a shot, I guess you have a mark here.

dbh4tckrnrGRIp31BnQFaw.text: The prime rib good. Not many options for food. Salad bar nothing edible. Staff is nice. But not enough variety.

1zHWp1OIIZh4IGttzjvvKw.text: I don't understand all the negative reviews, especially the people complaining about the cold crab legs.......they are kept on ice and not kept hot because they will dry out.  While I was there they were warming the plates of crab legs up for those that wanted them hot, which I opted for and I had no issues with them being dried out.  I didn't even use the butter for them as it was not needed.  I did the same thing with the shrimp, I prefer them to be warm and they peeled very easily so again, no issues there. The only complaint I really had was that the taco meat was a bit salty, other than that everything was very good and I will definitely be coming back during my next trip.  Also, the service was great, very quick at clearing our plates and filling our champagne.

rcr0qJUHZvQtDFikEKACiA.text: What a waste, not to mention the B rating on the wall which I didn't see until after we paid. 2 for brunch with endless Mimosa came to $80. It was a total rip off. The person serving the mimosa's was super busy bussing tables and we had to keep reminding her when we were empty. Crab legs were the only thing that I slightly enjoyed even tho they serve them cold. Fried chicken, mashed potatoes, Chinese food, breakfast all nasty! My husband said he liked the prime rib but I didn't get any because I was just totally turned off. I had wasted two full plates of food already and I was just ready to go.

VWysEPNAJG6gT2JyMRXHDQ.text: The good... The prime rib, boiled shrimp, vanilla ice cream with bananas foster on top. My kids were impressed by the cookies and cotton candy. The rest... Meh. But that's okay because we had low expectations to start with.   Nothing special and we will not make a point to come back but we were here and ate for $55 tax incl for family of four which is cheap cheap in Vegas. Bogo buffet coupons w VIP tickets for the Mac King show. Otherwise the buffet is $24 each for dinner. So $55 for dinner for 4 was a great value for grub and go. It did the trick and we were out the door for more Vegas.

uCHAPcE8i2thtGqScpa3-w.text: If no stars was an option I would give it.  Listen this place is horrible. Almost awesomely bad, you have to laugh about it. 20 minutes just to get your "unlimited" champs. It's only unlimited if you have a few hours to wait between service. Hard to get a buzz it's so slow.  The food is barely edible. How do you mess up Mac and cheese or mash potatoes?   Picked up the Groupon for 35 bucks and figured how bad can it be? Save your money.

k3B80QBxbgCtTqpxpeaSwA.text: If you are looking for the worst buffet in Vegas, you found it! I went for lunch and was sorely disappointed. Overpriced for the selection and quality of choices. Food was mediocre AT BEST. Shrimp was poorly peeled, sushi was mostly hard rice and lacked any fish except fake crab, and nothing really stood out as savory. You'll also be asked for a tip on the receipt when you pay for entry, but don't expect any service with beverages.

KmkuTnMqASTT8PnGSJ-qiA.text: Super staff! Excellent waiters and waitresses.  Well this is Vegas and there are lots of buffets to choose from most are not cheap eats.  This one is convenient if you are staying near Harrahs.  We liked it better than The Flamingo buffet next door.  If you want a cheaper breakfast go to a diner.   What I liked -it was convenient.  Opened at 7am so I could get to the convention center early.  -it had lots of variations on egg choices (omelets, eggs Benedict, scrambled, Mexican, and an egg station) -the bacon was nice and crispy -the carving station had really good sliced ham  -offered waffles, French toast, pancakes,  -it had a good selection of fresh fruit. bananas.apples and oranges.  Lots of sweet things including crepes, flan, cheesecake, cupcakes, donuts.

w-4EyLXaD2pReRy9INPaXQ.text: The worst food experience we have had and unfortunately our last meal in Vegas!  Cold, over cooked crab legs that you have to wait in line to get steamed! Get your own damn drink and refills!

oteEAdC7vGZf-6gS3Kv_Xw.text: If you are in Vegas looking for a buffet, please do yourself a favor and spend a little bit more for a better quality buffet with better food on the Strip. I was staying upstairs at Harrah's and was hungry after a long flight flying in from San Francisco. I read the reviews on Yelp and the rating was fair when compared to the other buffets on the Strip. The Crab Legs and Mussels were overwhelmingly salty. I also go their Cocktail Shrimps and the sauce was just mediocre. Their Prime Rib was okay and edible. There were a few options of Chinese food such as Siu Mai, Fried Rice, and Chow Mein which looked very greasy. I also got their Linguine and Clams, this lack flavor. There was close to no service here, as they only cleared our table once from empty plates. Overall a huge disappointment from this visit, I felt that I could of used the $32 I spent here for a better meal. Food here was overwhelming salty and greasy. I would highly not recommend Flavors if you are looking for a buffet on the Strip.

3zyX6XJp2EhOsLUg8Pu5uQ.text: Best buffet I've had in a long time. We we there during champagne brunch and the food was amazing. King crab legs full of delicious meat and the best prime rib. Their prices are reasonable and the champagne was endless.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The good kind of crabs!
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I went back for thirds!

EychXsiHtMNEE-Ah0ekzGg.text: Definitely nothing to brag about. This Buffet would never make it on the Travel Channel. I had some free vouchers so it didn't cost me anything but if I had to pay the going price for that Buffet I would not have been very happy about it.

cKsWppLVLbCSgipgFIJ36Q.text: I ate here only because it came with the conference package. I had lunch on 2 separate days - Thurs and Friday.  The buffet didn't look appeasing. The offerings didn't look fresh and because of that I barely ate anything. The meat offered at the carving station was tough and hard to cut with butter knives. Sadly, one of the only things I enjoyed is the nachos - chips and cheese - which I can get anywhere really... The desserts were a disappointment. I took a cotton candy bag to go so I can stay up during my conference!   The only good thing here is the service. Everyone worked together as a team and were very attentive and friendly.

KaHJBzNs6TlwWVW5GMwJAQ.text: Alright,   This was a bad experience.   Poor service.  Tasteless food.  Terrible presentation.  Poor access.   Dark atmosphere.  All in all,  there are far far better buffets on the strip.

h04f5vP345hIwG_dmcB4Vw.text: I used to love Flavors buffet back around 2008/2009 but going in today's age Flavors has really lost it's touch. The quality wasn't that great. While the variety of options is amazing the flavor was not all that good. Flavors price for what you are getting isn't all that great. the decor and staff is lovely as always. For what you pay for I would skip flavors and go to one of the newer and more trendy buffets in vegas.

m5EuwuBeKzlpgEH-hr7-bg.text: We bought the 24 hr buffet pass and this was one of our stops. It was average and nothing special. It could've been cleaner for sure, that was the down fall. The layout was okay and decent variety. Drinks area was a little runned down.

ZMaEbtxN_nzAJAn1IDVYyw.text: SCAM ALERT - bottomless beer/mimosa/bloodymary offer is a scam. DONT FALL FOR IT. They conned my group into purchasing this, only to sit down and have the bitter waitress tell us they're out of everything and we're "lucky" to get A bud light and then she disappeared for 30min. Bottomless drinks turned into, "one round on us, then you beg".   For purposes of perspective, this was at lunch and we were one table of about 6 occupied in the entire buffet. There was no crowd.   $50pp for mediocre food, an unjustifiably rude waitress, and a SCAM alcohol deal...don't waste your time here at the bottom of the barrel. You can pay the same amount at Bellagio and they knock it out the park.   Betrayed by Harrahs... terrible F.

OURGUSTvvdy3saEokkdZCQ.text: I like this buffet it's in the Harrah Hotel and Casino. I bought the all you can eat for 24hr pass which is a steal for $59 I think. It's where you can hit up 4 or 5 different buffets. Definitely recommend!

ft29LS0biGtjbmmf_xQFkA.text: I found a Groupon coupon which included AYCD which made this buffet totally worth it.   I came here for the crab, shrimp, and desserts. I left completely satisfied. The crab legs were a great size! The shrimp is like all cocktail shrimp. The cioppino was amazing. All the other foods were okay, no bad but not "oh my god!". The prime rib was great! No complaints about the prime rib. The desserts were pretty good though the ice cream quality is comparable to that of a dollar ice cream shop (even though the presentations was visually appealing). I would come here again if there was a Groupon coupon available.   The waitress was amazing! She cleared the table at the right times. She kept the drinks coming. She was super friendly. She didn't disappoint when it came to taking care of us.    Overall great experience.

t7wDkgYQBuv1mCG6HY1i-w.text: This place exceeded expectations & was super convenient (was located in the hotel I was staying in !! ) ... there is yummy sushi & cute desserts . I went for the Aycd lunch special . My server was Santana & she was so sweet . She was quick with refilling my mimosas (which were strong , I had to mix mine with cranberry juice which they had ALOT  of n/a drink choices to choose from which was awesome ) & there was beers to choice from too  .  I would definitely come back !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

extSfVtHU5iMkd5cObhoeg.text: Never eat at Harrahs Flavor buffet if you expect all you can eat crab legs as advertised on their website. Diamond members get 1 plate with 4 ounces of meat. So disappointed. Will never eat there again. False advertising.  The buffet has a poor selection of food for $32.00 per person. When complained to management on duty I was told the limited crab legs was mandated by food and beverage manager Alyssa Mendez. Wait staff very slow.

5IdCUmIQLj3uU6JZHxcfgw.text: Nothing special this time... quality has dropped a bit..... very slow to get us in... 10 min for 3 family's to pay then wait 5 min for lady to sit us to a 10% full buffet.......I won't return

OWLWb1m6PAcMywrDsqX7dw.text: Used our 24 hour buffet of buffets pass to have dinner here in a Saturday night. Definitely no crab legs except stone crab legs. Peel and eat shrimp were small but still good. Otherwise a nice place and gave it 4 stars but I do not need to go back anytime soon. Lots of other choices to consider.

l8TPNKiJqbx6Y14WTTvPdw.text: Received  two vouchers  for free buffet .  I used one for breakfast buffet and used second for  dinner  buffet. Out of the two, I enjoyed the breakfast  buffet the most. Any buffet that has grits on the menu has my vote. My first plate was grits, bacon ,  scrambled eggs, hash brown potatoes ,  and the crossaint sandwich with ham and cheese, and orange juice. Everything was pretty good. I wanted a biscuit, but they were all hard, so I got slice wheat  toast.  The OJ was very fresh tasting and not watered down like some places. Also had fruit kabob which was good. Second plate was pancakes, french  toast  and bacon. The pancakes  were  good except  was hard, dried out around edges...guess because had been sitting out for a while. Did not like french toast at all...took one bite, and that was it for me.   As far as dinner, nothing  spectacular .  For me  the quality and taste  is nothing more than your traditional  buffet.  Doubt if I  would ever return.

P6HShajnKItyZVG7QmImGg.text: This is the worst restaurant/buffet I have ever been to! Do not come here!  I ordered a Groupon for this place for dec 23 but not before calling to confirm that the Groupon was valid for that day. I was told by an employee at the buffet that it was a blackout day. That was a LIE! The lady at the front desk was so rude. These were her exact words.  "Well you didn't speak to me"  I specifically called ahead of time to triple check the Groupon rules and was lied to by the staff.  My party of 9 not only had to pay full price for dinner but a few of us were not able to get our refund from Groupon because the buffet lied!  They would not seat us together and their food was crap. It gave my auntie stomach poisoning.  We came all the way from Sacramento just to have the worst experience ever on Christmas. I spent 2 days being transferred around because no one wanted to help me.  I wish I could give this place negative stars. McDonalds would've probably been a better choice that's how bad this was.  Rude service! Horrible food! Overpriced! Scam artists!  Avoid this place at all costs!

mGoZgBaKDIIRFNsD2xckTA.text: I am so disappointed. I have been coming for years here and today was just not satisfied. I like coming here for the crab legs and now they are cold and over cooked with no flavor. My husband was dissatisfied as well. Hats the point of paying so much money for something that was not good as before.  My teens said that the lack of customer service at the ice cream places lacked so much they didn't even want I get ice cream bcz the se bee seamed angry. We went to eat a great dinner and left hungry. Th macaroni and cheese had no flavor.  We will no be coming here again. Management please do something about it

Dd00-etWGpDEaqMIOj1ZTw.text: Worst buffet in town... avoid this place as much as you can. Even with discount from Groupon, it's not worth it. Alcoholic drinks served in plastic disposable cups; no fish in sushi -- they only have California and veggie rolls. Service is slow and RUDE. Waiter questioned why do we need real glasses for the drink... Food selections are way less than advertised: no crab legs, no steaks. (Tried both lunch and dinner buffet). Again, avoid this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l51pCIoFlocUeCnCbxYMnA.text: I have 2 parts to this review: the food and the service. I would rate each one completely different.  Food: The food was good. I mainly went in for the crab legs and other seafood and I enjoyed all that I had. I tried a few other non seafood things and wasn't that impressed with them. Then I got to my favorite part of the meal...dessert. I will say that they have some awesome desserts. They make their own gellato, but I wanted to try all the little desserts they had in the case. We tried one of everything and didn't find one we didn't like. I was especially happy to see that they had cannolis as they are one of my favorites. I also like that they have the soda machines where you can add different flavors because nobody has vanilla pepsi anymore and I can actually get it there.   Service: We had someone come to our table once, the whole time we were there to grab plates when she saw we had a bunch stacked up with crab shells on them and that was it. We had to go find where the napkins and stuff were and get them ourselves because nobody was coming around and we were eating crab legs and making a mess with nothing to help clean our hands. They make you get your own drinks so the servers I guess don't feel the need to check on you to see if you do actually need something.

umTtry8DywXT8LdRZA0d8A.text: We got the buffets of buffets for the 24 hour time period. We went to the buffet in Paris and in Planet Hollywood. Out of all the buffets, we have to say that Harrah's was our favorite of the three. We were a bit hesitant to go because of the reviews but glad we went. The food was great, it didn't taste like it was sitting out all day. They had many options and tasted fresh. Loved the cris cut fries & the fried shrimp!! I was surprised that they gave out crackers in a packet rather than self serve. They had a good pizza selection and they had a pho station!! That's a plus for us! That was cool. We would definitely go back again!

mJ4TBXNO2CbQq-wxS_7ecQ.text: Sorry guys but this 1 star only is written because of the horrible horrible horrible buffet. How do you name it "The Flavors" and the food is stale , old , sitting, and almost all the food was like this minus the sweets. That tells you something. Only 1 person serving the whole buffet, crazyness and lazy is in here. 1 star.

ORdt6KEZashx3W41kVGXFQ.text: Can you say "Bottomless Mimosas?"  Yep, Flavors was calling my name.  A fitting prelude to the show I saw afterward::  "Raiding the Rock Vault."      I raided the Seafood Buffet::  Crab Legs & Shrimp ~ then Chicken Picata, Pork Marsala, Prime Rib . . .   The assortment of Desserts was tempting, & I imbibed!  Hint::  You can fit about 6 tiny ones on a plate!   I was not tempted to snack through the next day!  ASK FOR PHILIP's SECTION!  HE WAS AWESOME!  Quality of the food did not justify the price, IMO.  But the rare opportunity to enjoy several Mimosas over a long Dinner added value.

Pe9JZMErsPpJltVoYIfHeA.text: Basically a Hometown Buffet with a "splash section" (crab legs) which were very underwhelming.  Typical mainstream Vegas buffet

UvKQFxQnKgxNZBcBRkLe0w.text: We went here for dinner, it was my least favorite of the 4 buffets we tried with the 'buffet of buffet's' pass. The food wasn't great, really just regular buffet food which is disappointing when paying a higher price. There was also no bathroom in the buffet area, you had to leave and find one in the casino. This wasn't a huge deal, but very inconvenient and annoying to have to search for a bathroom.

s04IS0chRAhVyqR1T4DRwg.text: I was expecting much worse when visiting for the Buffet of Buffets. The food is actually not bad with lots of choice. Since we came around 3, they had just put out some of the dinner items and they had a classic comfort foods as well as some Mexican, Japanese and Chinese choices! The fried chicken and waffle fries were done well, the salad bar was not bad and they had some interesting choices for dessert including cannolis and fruit tarts!

0zHlQHXiO3gg90B9sTgXwQ.text: Came here once few years ago , there are more kind of food and all look delicious., nowadays it's getting more expensive and less food but still look ok though and it's look clean , nice staff ., love here to give work to elderly., just see their happy friendly smile it's worst more than word could say ....
