Sc_fkvG1lqixDgvkmOSsfw.text: Harrah's Main Buffet Restaurant USED TO be a reasonably good value, but it is NO MORE.  During my visit today, I went to it based on convenience factor, but at 12 noon on a busy Saturday Brunch,  the restaurant  May have at most 20  percent capacity. Some of the food stations was not even open.  The crab legs had a frozen over salted taste,  the prime rib (a very thin slice) was tough as the sole of my leather flip flop,  the rice on my spicy crab role was dry as if eating dried out rice crispy.  All of this for $30.99 per person, was a total ripoff.  It needs to be shut down & refreshed if they even care.

irpB9pVu7_odKlNGIP4WWA.text: Located in the Harrah's hotel. We were here for the New Years week. Prices were significantly higher due to the holiday. We came for lunch but they were charging dinner prices. We didn't have to wait long to get seated. They had Dungeness crab claws and prime rib. They also offered turkey and Brazilian pork. I made my money's worth and had two plates of crab and a serving of prime rib. I will be back again!

6kXdM7EM_J88kz_6_flX8g.text: Buffets are just not my thing. I've experience them all from low end in cost to extremely expensive and rarely have i even made the solid choice to guarantee a return. Although the food was just "okay", this buffet deserves 5/5 stars solely thanks to Adrian and will ensure a 2nd visit.  Who doesn't love being helped by someone who is oober friendly, courteous, happy, and a super hard worker?? Adrian is all of the above and sooo much more!! Meeting him alone is more than enough of a reason to swing by Flavors The Buffet.   Located in Harrah's Casino, Flavors The Buffet is spacious, clean, and is a lot more affordable than other buffets offered on the strip. The breakfast buffet will cost you $19, lunch $23, brunch $26, and dinner $29+/per person. I highly recommend splurging a bit more for the AYCD [all you can drink].  Our party of 4 were bummed that we missed brunch mimosas by ten minutes the day before at another location and went on a hunt to find a good spot to overly indulge to make up for this.  With breakfast not being a meal we are overly excited for, we opted on just finding something affordable with an endless flow of alcohol...  The selection of food was good, the quality wasn't the greatest, but you get what you pay for.  We did accomplish our mission of freely indulging in drinks- our mimosa glasses never stayed empty for too long & my champagne flute stayed glued to my lips. Needless to say, I had the time of my life!!!!   **Thank you again Adrian for simply being you. Not only were you busting multiple tables on your own, you never once lost that smile on your face. YOU ABSOLUTELY ROCK MY SOCKS!! Hopefully I'll see you soon!**

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. striking a pose with THE ONE AND ONLY... Adrian
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon

opVTLnT8zdvk450Aj7WNxQ.text: Out of all of the buffets at the Caesar's properties in Vegas, this is one of my favorites.   The service is spectacular for a casino buffet, and the food is aplenty.   If you're Diamond or Seven Stars, this is the joint to be.  They will bend over backwards for you and make sure that your drinks are constantly filled and table cleared of discarded dishes.   Plus, you get to skip the dirty heathen line, so ain't that the pits!?!  The pits?  Is that a good thing?  If it isn't, I'm making it a good thing.  Make sure to tip!  They have all of the usual fixings and stations: prime rib, seafood, Italian, Mexican, Asian and dessert.  Can I talk to you about the dessert for a minute?  There are a few grab and go selections, and ten a few fancy ones behind the glass that you have to have help with.  Is it worth shouting over the counter in order to get said desserts?  You're darn tootin' it is!  Because behind that lovely glass sits the scooped to order ice cream and gelato.  The best flavor?  The coffee with chocolate covered coffee beans mixed in.  Hot damn!  This place is also reasonably priced, so I always make a point to check it out when I'm out in Vegas and need a buffet. Come on!  You need at least one buffet for every Vegas trip.  Flavor's at Harrah's is the pits!  There it is again.  I'm making it into a good thing!

OZkedevnu5ZSLhTBQ8pECw.text: This is a good buffet. The dessert choices are over the top and absolutely worth skimping on some of your earlier courses. It has all of the usual suspects: carving station, asian choices, make your own tacos-ish, fresh shell-fish. Everything I tasted was pretty good.  The desserts, though. Ooftah! Ice cream bar like a real parlour, pastries and cakes and trifles and truffles and fluff... Maybe worth it to pay for just a sweets overdose??? I dunno. Anyway, I'm kinda done with buffets for a while, not that that's Flavors' fault.  I'm just beginning a dialogue... I'll continue it on a few other reviews.

SJz_w9h7v6II1CNIjFyKWQ.text: My husband and I got a free buffet pass so who wouldn't say no to that. The crab was crab claws and they were just okay. The shrimp seemed like they were out too long And they were not buttery and easy to eat. The highlight of this buffet was the dessert bar. Gelato, mini cupcakes, banana pudding and oh my goodness the creme brulee was out of this world!

Tsk6oAQzrtTvuJ60FJa4Yg.text: Nice little spread they got going on here. Wide variety with a little somethin somethin for everybody. The guy working the ice cream area and the waitress were incredibly nice too. The Marsala pork was good and the grilled corn was to die for. The only complaint had by the table was my husband and his bread pudding. I told him it looked like regurgitated dog food from the get go but he munched on anyways. Well if apparently had no texture and was spongy.  Otherwise a great experience!

128D7YF1Mu62UyH_A6dJ0Q.text: I'm here right now at the buffet writing this review. I'm a registered guest at Harrah's. I waited on line for 30 minutes and it wasn't even busy!!!! There were not a lot of people in the restaurant. One cashier (poor lady)   which was the first line I waited on and then another line where I had to wait for super slow hostess who also had a bad attitude to walk me to my table!! This is ludicrous!!!  Where are the employees?????  And to boot the buffet is TERRIBLE!! I waited on line for THIS???? Never again!!!

zdsg64WprGH2MT8XPEkQ3w.text: Bland boring food. Paid $32 per person for the buffet. Four people at our table and we all agreed that the food was 'meh'.   Some items were dry, the crab legs were hideous, almost everything was bland.  The only decent items were the ribeye steak and the chocolate mousse.

np36uzojP6mWlFDr-MnY1A.text: Customer Service: they sweeping the floor  while dinning, totally rude and potentially may invert to health issues emanating from  airborne pathogen created by the dust.  Food Selection: Very poor for $30+ buffet for each person.  Food taste: I give them two stars however because, everything else that is wrong with this place is outweigh my rating and reverting it to zero.  Other reasons: I don't know why but they had to hand written the tip amount on receipt, plus place it on your table so all your guests know what you paid for them. Additionally they had to put a card on table indicating amount of customers like in this case five. Which I find it totally diswelcoming. This is by far my worse experience in any buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DDLvRpR8On_2ZIfnGhBe6w.text: Dropping in Flavors The Buffet is like visiting a favorite aunt's place. For my hubby and me, there's no other buffet we'd rather dine in. In fact, this has been our meal "headquarters" whenever we're in Vegas for trade conventions and conferences. During a span of 20+ years, we've witnessed changes in menus and prices, upgrades in decor, and shifts in staffing. Such happenings can be distressing, but we still come.   There are people who want an endless spread of food and drink selections. The more the merrier. Some want beautifully-appointed dining areas. The trendier the better. This is not Flavors. The Bacchanal at Caesars across Las Vegas Boulevard would be that place.   What draws us to dine here time and again? It's not all about the food. Nor is it about the latest color schemes or trendy upholstery. Then, what is it that holds our loyalty? Of course, we love that Flavors has our 3 basic requirements down pat: delicious food, efficient staff, and comfortable seating. Among these, the most important is staff. We've gotten to know some of them quite well.  Let's start with the entrance. We don't get the feeling of a cattle call like many other buffets on the strip. The cashiers are friendly and efficient. Notable are Carol and Cherrylyn, who can be cool and welcoming even on the hottest days in the city.  On to the hostesses. The one who makes us feel pampered the most is Olivia. Broad smiles and pleasantries as she leads us to our seats. It's like being welcomed to a friend's home.  Before I go any further, I want to apologize to individuals not mentioned. Please understand that my senior moments are quite real.  Rudy is our favorite server of all time. He remembers our preferences despite our infrequent visits. And that speed! Don't know how he can serve so many all at once.  Moving on to Chef Manny and Chef Johnny, an amazing duo who wow with occasional "chef's choices". Other Caesars Entertainment properties also have talented head chefs, but none more adorable than these two, I bet.   Tying all these together is the management team, We like James and Michelle the most. James is more familiar because Michelle often  is assigned to the Oyster Bar during our meal times. James comes by to check on diners periodically. We're impressed that he pitches in to help his team bus tables when there's a crowd. None of that "I am the manager" attitude. Nice!  By now you may be wondering: Is there anything we don't like about Flavors? Yes, there are two. First, the self-serve fountains. Spills from beverages make seniors like us feel unsafe. Second, not enough servers. Staff reduction may be necessary, but must we put up with used dishes piled on tables for extended periods?  In short, Flavors may not be perfect, but we love what it offers. It's truly a toss-up between 4-Stars and 5-Stars. I flipped a coin ... It came up 5-Stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Winnie and Buck Near Flavors the Buffet Entrance

JOAare3OQPnthwdILh3HiA.text: Came here as part of the 24 hour buffet pass (not worth it btw).  There is barely any service - drinks are self serve too. They did have a variety of stations but the food was like cafeteria food.  If you are just looking to fill up it does the job but nothing was satisfying.  Also ambiance is lacking, not a very classy joint - I guess it is Harrahs...

8BW_6nYOTkG4hp8zfAE34g.text: This was actually the worst buffet I've ever been to in my entire life. The food was prepared with no flavor or care whatsoever, just made to be put out. Let's just say I'd rather eat my elementary cafeteria lunch over anything served here. Absolutely no one around the restaurant looked happy, neither staff nor customers. Pretty sure the dim lighting was to take away from be depressing reality of the fact that we were being robbed by spending our money here. I don't regret many things in life but I regret eating here. This review is to warn others, gamble elsewhere, not here.

jvL33nqUWcIHNuQfeWOwVw.text: A _GREAT_ buffet ! . not cheap but good food well prepared and clean as a whistle every where .  No one told us we were supposed to have reservations (we were comped) so we waited in a line in spite of less than 1/4 filled restaurant .  Believe me, it was well worth the wait ~ ribs done to perfection, prime rib as it should be, sea food of various types, too much variety to detail but if you come away displeased or hungry  _you're_ the problem .  The (apparently in house made) gelato/ice cream was superb, they have several flavors including _COFFEE_ ! .    If you can afford the $30 + price, treat yourself to this at least once .  Yes there was _one_ hostess who has a very bad attitude, she's not happy and needs a different job . everyone else was very nice and helpful .  -Nate

vv0re5xTe7mdsgOiR98PTg.text: We stayed at harrahs so the last morning we went down for breakfast.  Reasonable price.  We also ordered the bottomless mimosas, champagne for an additional 8.00 each.  Boy did we ever get our moneys worth.  Our server was SANTA and she was amazing!  The food was good too for the price, we did not go hungry that's for sure!  Enjoyed our visit!

lX_Mw4mlYw8g4-s65mTUoQ.text: **2.5 stars**  Came here before heading out to the airport since it was right in the hotel we were at (Harrah's). It's located right near the exit of where the Mickey Ds/Panda Express/Chipotle is. It was breakfast time on the border of lunch when we arrived and it was about $19. I think they have a deal where you can get unlimited alcoholic drinks? The customer service from the cashier and our waitress was excellent.   On to the food, it was pretty decent. From the looks of it, I thought it was going to be bad but I enjoyed most of the food I ate.  The hash browns were nice and buttery, which I got thirds of. The other selections were small but I liked it better than Cravings at Mirage...I think anywhere is better than there. For $19, not worth it. Maybe $10?? I'd come back to try the dinner because it sounds like they have some good options. I guess for a cheap buffet like this unlike the one at Caesar's...can't complain too much!

BBKBBn3bU3ff5SNVNgqZbQ.text: Pathetic salad & dessert selection. Crust on fried chicken not crispy...mushy. Not worth $30.99

8G6aWhOJ2AyQuaOHojzyAg.text: Good enough to return. Like most buffets, there are some misses, but such a selection, you can find something. Fill up on crab, shrimp and baked goods
