8vopTjaAivaNI57KY65C5A.text: I read the reviews and was expecting less than great but I was still disappointed. We bought the Buffett of Buffett passes here and the front desk person was very rude. The rate was higher than we expected due to the holiday but there was no signs posted at the front desk or the website saying this. I only asked once and she made me feel like I was dumb. I would like to add it was not just at this point so I wasn't holding up any lines. So I was already a little disappointed by that experience. Then we started eating. It was all so mediocre. Even the basic Mac n cheese and stuffing were bland and soggy. Everything needed salt and pepper. There was a large ish selection but nothing I wanted seconds of.  I would not come back here over other buffets we tried. Hopefully they make some service and quality changes.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ITUcxer3ywBhCsXj320C9Q.text: I purchased a 24 hour Buffet pass and FLAVORS THE BUFFET is one of the many choices you have to select to eat at with this 24 hour pass.  I wasn't sure that it would be good but I tried it. As I approached the line I asked a Young Man in a Bow tie was this location included in the 24 hr PASS, he responded Yes and we are actually Really Good.  I then stood in line which was rather moving kinda slow but I patiently waited my turn at the cashiers. Once I made it to the cashier Ms Carol L ; Great Personailty ; I was immediately welcomed and then seated by Hostess.  When I tell you that the food selection was great and tasty I am not exaggerating. So many great choices. My advice to any one who LoVes to eat or just need a great food budget; PURCHASE THE 24 Hour Pass . Definitely come  to this Buffet you want be disappointed. Located inside Harrah's Casino on the Strip.

ArJKrt41eNP0MG7Ogvtv7Q.text: TO start out with the prices at this buffet are reasonable, so do not have high standards of those high premium buffets on the strip.  Overall it was a wonderful brunch with rolling mimosas and Wonderful crew members while food was above average on some dishes. I can wait to come back.  Positives Found Groupon and the meal was of value server and everyone there friendly and accommodating  No wait  Sparking wine and mimosas were plenty  Food quality on some items was goo   Cons Desserts were not good Not a lot of selection, which can be good since they focus on providing better quality food with small selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GN_ZSpwRe1ie9Y7TFgQp3Q.text: Why 4 stars?? Very simple people. The food is very decent for the price you paid for it. I see people complaining about the quality but if you think about it this buffet is probably one of the cheapest one in Las Vegas. It's a bargain if you purchase the Groupon which I did. You not only get the best deal but you have VIP access. We didn't have to line up to go in. We went through the fast line, the one for premium clients, showed our Groupon and whalaa. Yes, I have to be honest. The customer service was terrible. From the host to the waitress. The interior is kinda old but it was clean. About the food......a little bit of everything. Your best choices are the crab legs and steaks. That was pretty decent. For the price, not bad. Going back? Maybe not.

aSqrpTSzujuybPM223YijQ.text: Came here for lunch on my first day of the BoB pass. Decent selection and a lot of the pasta was delicious! Their staff was very friendly and attentive, from the servers to the cooks. Definitely recommend this place.

XcyUehAmAg_RE8999sUI2A.text: I thought this was pretty good, especially when you take in account the price and that it's not trying to compete with the fancier Vegas buffets. I came for a late lunch, but they started putting out things like the crab and the carving station for dinner, so I was able to enjoy that.  There wasn't a massive amount of variety like other places, but it's priced $25-30, so of course not. I think it had a good variety including seafood options. They had gelatto at the dessert area, which tasted great and there were like 6 flavors, so it was nice to try a few.  It's not the kind of buffet I would come across town for, but if you are staying in Harrah's or a hotel next door, it's a good meal for a comparatively reasonable price. There was no line when I came at like 4 pm but there was a line when I left (probably because it's a cheaper dinner option than other places) so if you do come, come on off-hours or be okay waiting a bit.

TwsAaF0_mXBB2k2Smes34Q.text: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE! We called in advance to make sure they had seafood! They only had a very small variety of it! And they lied over the phone about pricing, over the phone they told us it was $19.00 per person and it ended up being almost $35 witch I think in comparison with other buffets here in n Vegas it's not up to par for the price! I would mind paying $35 if the food was at least good!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other places included

gaCFdPxMn7Euzj_xwo682Q.text: Standard buffet offerings here. If you're looking for uniqueness or huge selections, this isn't the one for you. But if you're looking for a good selection of your expected foods, then Flavors can hit just the right spot. I've been here for both breakfast and dinner and both meals have been fine. Nothing to wow me but also nothing that turned me away. I do definitely find myself gravitating back towards the same areas here since I early on find what is good on that visit and stick to it.   One thing I would say though: if you come here for breakfast, stay away from the orange juice from the dispenser. It's always just water with orange coloring. I doubt there is any juice in there.   Wait staff is always very friendly and attentive. They are definitely the best aspect of the meal experience here. That's for sure. Props to them.

FIGvhEQTFwV4Qpa5uevTQA.text: Great food. The had a Mexican, Asian, Seafood and American cuisine. Enjoyed the self serve pop station - tons of beverages to chose from! Our server was great - took away our dishes by the time we were back to our table. The only negative thing I would say is that there salad bar doesn't have much to chose from. Other than that will back with a groupon :p

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i4YVGnHxqrDKcshNzTrEng.text: This is the best place for buffet lunch- more than 300 items, everything you might think of to eat. Insanely amazing- must try, quality and quantity both are aamzing. Staff is awesome, welcoming. You will tired of eating but they won't be for supplying food.   Strongly recommended for buffet

hgoiTVCjalEZGGHt1yHwPg.text: The value for the money was great. The prime rib was delicious, the shrimp tasted fresh and wonderful, the crab legs were good as well. Large variety of food. The best part of our experience was our waitress Carol. She was fun, witty and extremely nice and helpful. I would definitely come back just to see her again!

jpuUwTXp9NgX9kfSf0E__w.text: Vegas buffets are known for their numerous gourmet food stations. After trying all the stations, I stuck with one station, the gelato. Their six to seven types of gelato/sorbet saved this place from getting the ever rotting one star rating. Also their Brazilian Pork was pretty good. But I only fancied two items in the whole buffet, that's not a very nice percentage.   The sushi's rice was so hard that when I bit into it, the rice crumbled into many individual pieces. The canoli was not fully filled, they stealthily stuffed both ends with cream but left the middle with nothing! Just because I can get as many canolis as I want does not mean that I don't deserve a decent dessert. The pork bao barely had any meat in it, it was kept plump by injecting loads of orange sauce to it.   The food was so plain. There was nothing special to it. They didn't even have cut up fruits such as cantaloupes, watermelons, honeydew, or the such. All they had were green apples, red apples, and bananas. Come on, it's a Vegas buffet! These are the most simple fruits in the world. Even hometown buffet has a better selection. I do feel bad expecting such amazing things out of these buffets but come on, they are the renowned Vegas buffets and they definitely cost more than normal ones, so why not have high expectations?

cvs-D50T4naYAk_EM5sYSA.text: Out of all the buffets in the "Buffet of Buffets" this had to be the poorest in both service and quality.  The wait staff was non-present and getting seating was made to be feel like such a chore it actually made our party feel a tad awkward.  The food while it looked good, it just didn't taste right.  Savory items were bland, soft items were chewy, only the basic stables tasted correctly.  They did have a large selection of sweets but by the time your'e done having salty in search of something good for the palate you're full, so there's no point!

T1kmm-0z6hQAOtRtdrFhCw.text: Can't go wrong with this place.  Cotton Candy for the kids, crab legs for the adults!  VIP gets you straight to the food and bypass the lines.  VIP Lounge is more comfortable and service is more attentive.

UkrVbqHv3ZRYt2JqLghshg.text: This buffet is worth more than The Buffet at Wynn. Most people like to attack crab legs station and it's warm, yummy compare to Wynn's cold, meatless crab legs. Flavors have enough selection to keep me happy. The only down side is the male employee at dessert station was grumpy. He needs to eat more sweets.

9j_EUbYTcQRBI5DH2sm9IA.text: Unlimited champagne refills!  I love this buffet! It wasn't the best food choices but I loved the champagne and how attentive the waitress was. my bf and I both had champagne and I had a big beer which was tasty and made me more drunk than a skunk! We had gotten a two for one special because we had a couple's special so that was hella dope. The desserts were amazing. I'm a big buffet person tho and I love variety. I also loved the pictures that we took outside of the buffet. It was the kind that you stick your face in and the body isn't yours. I was drunk and fell on the floor from laughing so hard. My bf was kinda pissed that I did that but I think he was just mad that he wasn't as drunk as I was haha..  Oh yea, I will be back :)

OFM03q6OFJXqciILmwpmaw.text: I didn't expect it to be this good.   Better than the Bellagio dinner I had.   That's right, I said it!   Everything that was tough at the Bellagio buffet were tender and moist here: steak, fish, etc.   Felt like a diner for seniors, but hey, who doesn't love that gelato bar and cotton candy?!   I do. I do I do I do.

nGl1eWzBGztCfZVM2aLpow.text: Came here with my partner in crime for a quick lunch before we hit the blvd. We've visited the one in Harrah's AC so we were expecting the same long sprawl of fresh, foods on themed stations just like the one we'd been to...Lets say we were highly disappointed. Its small, most foods are low quality, ill prepared (overcooked) and bland or really salty (the small salty pathetic crawfish). Luckily for us we had a Groupon, and it included alcoholic beverages, I would've been really pissed if we were charged the full price. Endless mimosas, champagne and wine helped me make it through without wining and pouting horribly.  I wanna give 1 1/2 stars but that's not possible so its a 2. The service was great, too bad the food wasn't.

KRBIfTFQosP61ercjpPosA.text: I came here once during the time that Buffet of Buffets was only 29.99 for club members and a second time during my last winter break. I have to say that this has to be one of the worst Vegas buffets I've ever been to. I have no idea how they still manage to stay in business.   This place is just as bad as the shadiest Chinese buffets (the ones that try to serve everything) back in Los Angeles.

-B5tS69kOF5eHddmmgtfDA.text: Came here for breakfast on Saturday morning for the mimosa brunch, and happy we did :). They had a lot of breakfast options including a prime rib carving station, which was awesome. They had eggs to order, crispy bacon and juicy sausages. I was also excited they had gelato, the cookies & cream is a must try. Our server was very nice and took very good care of us making sure our mimosas were always filled. I can't really comment on lunch, they only thing I tried was the fried chicken and mac & cheese that they had just put out for the start of lunch dishes, but I enjoyed both.

QslzI7qYENhU3EHiV6u8Ew.text: Not sure if it was the time of day that we went, but nothing was fresh. I thought the pizza would save it, buy even that sucked. I will never go back and regret not going to the Rio.

OGm3l9HnJS9ZRHBV6T_tgg.text: Okay food, quite a lot of variety but abut plain on the taste... Cheap thou with the buffet pass....

A6VLjSNUYwLSHcGeaS2jlw.text: Staying on the strip and being lazy, we were thankful for a BOGO free coupon for the buffet at Harrah's.  We managed to get in right before 3 pm, which meant we paid the lunch price but saw the dinner food.  A decent variety of food, especially for the price.  We were definitely surprised to find stone crab, snow crab legs, and mussels on a weekday for sure!  My favorite was their chocolate fountain with huge strawberries.  Overall, it's a very simple and basic buffet for a strip casino.  We definitely wouldn't be here if we were paying full price though!

flyPBUklbuk1ptCQdeyRdg.text: this place was pretty good! not the worst buffet Ive had in the last three days but also not the best. good selection. great prime rib. i cant eat chocolate so they only had one or two deserts i could have. good american style and chinese food and all of the staff were very friendly!

0A181SpMWmddlgkGkRoxZQ.text: Holy crap! I've died and gone to buffet HEAVEN.  This place has THE best buffet ever. I ate there twice in 4 days. lol They have salad, Italian, seafood, Mexican, Chinese, sushi, meat and an awesome desert arrangement. The servers were all very nice and our dirty plates were promptly removed. My buffet favorites were the meatballs, fried ravioli, crab legs, and shrimp cocktail. And by the way...how many places crack the crab legs open for you??? That's right no fumbling around trying to get the crabmeat out. They've already done it for you. Ahhh....I love this place. Dessert wise there is so much I can't even list it all...although I will say I truly enjoyed dipping my strawberries in the chocolate fountain. :-)

AmAqGBpW-nT3uzOQdZqDmw.text: We went here for lunch because we were staying at Harrah's. we didn't go to any other buffet in Las Vegas so I don't have anything to compare it. I can compare it to an Old Country Buffet. Mediocre, a little expensive. The best part is the dessert section. Go if you're just looking for an a-ok place to eat. If you want a-plus food, go somewhere else.

IVRSkbwob2CtYDY1RN3NzQ.text: One of the worst buffets I've been to. Paid $50 for two adults. The food selections were limited and looked like they had been sitting on the hot plates for a long time.

ukrC48kxTly9aiRqw598kg.text: It has been 4 months since we have eaten here last and let me tell you, this is not the same place. Where to begin...We thought we had struck it rich when we arrived and there was no line and absolutely no wait. Now I know why! The food was the worst I have eaten any where on the strip. The crab legs used to be served steamed and hot, now they are on ice. The price for the buffet has jumped by ten dollars per person. I paid $122.00 for four of us. The service was sub standard at best as we had to ask for plates to be removed and drinks to be filled. I will give the waiter this the plates were going back with lots of food on them that just could not be choked down, so that added to his work load. I give this buffet a 1 star just because I can't give a zero. Shame on you Harrahs for this slop!

wLEgYqnukqnf8vWgBWHNFQ.text: Flavors is not the best buffet in town, but they do seem to be one of the most consistent. The food is not great, but almost all of there dishes are very good on a regular basis. The one thing that does seem to change on when you go is the service. This past visit to Flavors we were taken care of OK. Sometimes it took a while for the empty plates to be removed. Sometime we went without drink refills. But all-in-all not to bad.  Two things that always stand out for me are: The Ice Cream. It is always great, just give me more in a bowl please. Second is that they serve Cotton Candy. Almost no one serves cotton candy. That to me is very innovative.  The only thing I think is completely wrong is the price. It is not to bad at $23.95. I just do think it should be a few dollars less without having to show your Harrah's club card.

QYpIqusEPUSwoFWLJmMf-w.text: I came on yelp to update my review for the Flavors buffet at Harrah's and realized that i had somehow never yelped it?   Well, if I had yelped it before I would have given it a "5" and in my would-be update, I would give it another "5."  The Harrah's buffet has consistently been one of my favorite buffets in Las Vegas.  Not only is there a large selection of food you can get but the quality of the food is extremely high.  I absolutely love the seafood here, the steak, the Asian food, and most of all the ice cream!  I've been going to the Harrah's buffet since I was 10 years old and in the past couple decades it has been consistently amazing!  My family and I stumbled upon it randomly and since then, I try to eat here every time I go to Vegas.  I've had many other buffets - at Rio, Treasure Island, Bellagio, etc., but Harrah's is really the only buffet that does NOT disappoint EVER!  The food is so fresh... the crab legs are already cracked for you, the fish is never dry, the guacamole is fresh, the steaks are succulent.  It's just perfect.  The dessert selection is also very large, which I love about this place. You really cannot go wrong with Harrah's buffet! I don't like the Harrah's hotel very much and have only just passed through there to get to other places or gone there for just the buffet or the Toby Keith's bar upstairs and never actually stayed there, but the buffet at Harrah's is SUPERB!

vVy0zS96G6KV6SBemnzhhw.text: Went for lunch, food was lukewarm and mediocre at best for the price. Try to get a 2 for 1 promo if you want to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9w-2U7ARhNS9TSKS3v_RVw.text: There are four of us who went to the buffet during lunchtime. It cost for four people $116 and I think $.83. We all felt that it was absolutely worth the money! There were so many crab legs there. The new England clam chowder is delicious. Starting from the beginning there are rollers. My nieces preferred the pretzel rolls they said that they were really good. The garden salad was simple and delicious. I'm not a huge steak person, but I did have the steak that was made and it was cooked perfectly very moist and very tasty. The desserts are plentiful. They had creampuffs, eclairs, a custard that looks like creme brulee, Tiramisu, gelato - and the gelato was yummy! Every thing was definitely delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs. Salad. Rolls.

hxiPIXd-U2aknZ4CfZHEIA.text: Purchased the VIP Buffet through Groupon. Only thing that I was interested in was the snow crab legs. The server Cara told us that there were not any crab legs due to the weather, so I asked for the manager who said that the crab legs were for VIP only which was confusing because I purchased the VIP Buffet. He eventually brought us two plates of half frozen snow crabs. I didn't receive a refund from neither Groupon nor Harrah's. This was extremely disappointing to me. The attitude of the staff was decent until I complained. I will definitely not be going back and I suggest that you go elsewhere. Don't waste your money on this place.

95_apEl3MZ4JcNS_KBxv6g.text: Good customer service . Ate breakfast at 8am on Friday no waiting food hot and fresh! Everyone was friendly and I was greeted by chefs and wait staff ! Very nice.... A little pricey but it's on the strip !   Would I eat here again? Yes!

9pzAVUl-yvJ3U0Gtx0hNiw.text: Came here since we're staying at Harrah's. Compare to other buffet it's pretty dismal... It tastes too salty or too bland. Selections don't really complement each other and most entrees are dry.....  I should've gone to Mirage or Baccanal...

2WFj9rrUeYb3JcoFRSeY6A.text: Sad. It took over an hours wait to get a table and boy were we disappointed by the quality of the food, the cleanliness of the counters and the slow replenishment. The carving station had a huge, slow moving line which made it impossible to reach adjacent food and serving areas. There were multiple occasions when they ran out of plates. If you're into buffets that are loaded with low quality, carb heavy foods, you'll love this place. I would highly recommend the Caesars Palace buffet for a few extra bucks and much better food.

PUfYSP0fscUAipxtFv-A4w.text: We ate here the weekend Saturday August 20th.  Arriving for a late brunch and purchased the 24hr pass for two.  Which by the way is marked way up on weekends to a whopping 80 bucks a person.  Paid my bill of about $160.  They told us that the only that we could not use the pass at Ceasars Palace,  but all others in the Ceasars group was fair game.   So we ate our brunch,  and the intent was to come back to another location for a early dinner,  before hitting the strip for the night only to find that the ones we found were all closed until 5pm.   So we went our on strip without dinner and were going to come back around later on the evening only to find once again,  some closed at 8pm,  and by the time we got to another one they had already closed.   So we didn't have dinner at all.  So much for getting value for our 160 bucks.    Woke up the next morning,  barely made it up to Paris location for their brunch before our 24hrs expired.   So all we got was 2 brunches each for 160 bucks.    It's not 24hrs, like they bill it out... More like 10 to 12hrs if you manage to find one open.    RIP OFF RIP OFF RIP OFF  I decided to write a letter to their corporate office.  While they did reply in about 48hrs.  All they offered was 2 additional meals on my next visit.  I replied and said I would be happy if they offered 2 meals per person,  that way I felt like I would be getting full value for my 160 bucks.   They refused.  So much more treating a Platinum Total Reward Member Good...   Highly not recommended to get the pass... Especially on a weekend when they jack up the prices 50 plus percent.

NTEzaKb1ZLB_OgbSqE7__g.text: This was our favorite breakfast buffet for almost 10 years... NO MORE... so sad. We were seated in a booth w totally ripped up upholstery w food in the hole.  The buffet had just opened 15 min b4 Yet The food was cold. The sausage was grissley and inedible (And my husband will usually eat anything)  The churros were already so hard u wondered what day they were from The beverage station was destroyed. No clean glasses, pop and ice everywhere...  We asked for our $ back after a few bites each.  They gave it back.. But I would rather have had a nice brunch as in yrs past.  Add insult to injury, u have to pay for parking every where except the Venetian (which is where we ended up having a coffee and yummy croissant)

3-yWmxqkisAhg0YL9D86zA.text: Incredibly overpriced. Food was sub-par and the wait staff are very inattentive. Highly recommend not coming here if you're looking for a good Vegas buffet.

lFTJcDbpvLwtVwyIQcSf4A.text: I used to enjoy this buffet about 3 years back.  The choices were better. They used to have cotton candy for the kids.  The crablegs used to be pre-cracked in half.  Now the waiter does not take your drink order any more.  The plates were piled on our table the whole time we were there.  And the cooks in the back do not put out quaility food like they used to.  They need new management to turn the place around.

PJHIFRSLEOCT9_SNAxzd-w.text: I will not be back. For $30 a person, this buffet leaves much to be desired. I tried the crab legs, the prime rib, the rib, macaroni & cheese, mashed potatoes, and grilled veggies. The crab legs are kept cold, but at least the drawn butter is hot. Is it too hard to keep the crab legs warm? The prime rib was sliced way to thin, which was about 1/4 inch. The ribs were tasty and tender, but for whatever reason, in the Mexican food section. *scratches head* The Mac & cheese, mashed potatoes, and grilled veggies were alright, I had half a spoonful of each.   I wasn't able to finish my dessert of flan, cream puff, and chocolate cupcake. Neither option had real distinguishable flavor.   The staff was friendly and the service was good.

dYsHNuCMrrvdvyInTGiBEw.text: Food was pretty good. A complaint was the soda machines. Holy crap I clicked diet Pepsi on the new style touchscreen things and it came out clear as water. I was clicking the screen 30 times and was all messy and sticky with soda. So I was like ok, let me try the other machine. Same thing. Not only was I mad at this point, but pissed everyone off around me and had to hurry and get Pepsi. Atleast the guy behind me agreed and I said "Im complaining about this on yelp." I wasted a solid 3 minutes getting a drink and was a clear waste of resources. Another complaint was the plates were scalding hot and I almost dropped the damn plate which wouldve made me flip. Food was pretty good though.

s-Wb_Cg78mRBM0Lk9nV5nw.text: So disappointing, the dessert was better than all there food. Fresh waffle fries came out but they were a mouthful of grease as soon as you bit into it. This buffet is on the 24 hour buffet pass. Skip it! What a waste of time.

TIcErrCKvPBrI0vRr4yUHw.text: Flavors The Buffet...the name should say it all right? Well it does. There are some flavors, although they are not good ones. The food is under seasoned, bland, and old. Most of it looks like it's been sitting out for quite some time. First off the salad bar is in a weird spot, it's on the opposite side of the dessert. I didn't realize this until after we ate. The options are limited, and the options are odd. There isn't a lot of normal buffet foods, and I'm from the Midwest where we know our buffets. We are all around 30 lbs over weight at all times due to them so trust me when I say do not eat here. I know it's listed on the buffet of buffets option but it's not worth it. The sushi is not fresh, the Mexican and Chinese options are limited and sub par at best. The smoked sausage, turkey, and pork are okay but dry. The drink selection is what it is. And the desserts are stale. The only plus is the staff is super friendly.

jbsSlMakDVAP5oFHsKaCIA.text: I was debating if I should review this mug, but decided I gotta keep it 100. Yer boy ain't really bout that buffet life, I know mah gut might make you believe otherwise, but on real I take flavor over all you can eat any day.   Aight now that I got that disclaimer mess out the way, I'm tell you what I did and didn't like. I went for the brunch on Sunday and some of the breakfast food was on point. The corn beef hash and country gravy didn't give yer boy nothing to complain about. But some of the other stuff was too dry, them biscuits and waffles left me wanting, didn't matter how much syrup or gravy I put on them.   My recommendation is if you in Vegas and finna grab a cheaper buffet you could do worse, but if you down to spend a bit extra, they got bomb restaurants everywhere in Vegas.

ye4yIaYQb3BmCuRWsCHfvg.text: In general, I am not big on buffets, but if you charge me what comes to $31, I assume that means the food will be good. I assumed wrong in this case.   This buffet has a variety of types of food stations from seafood to pasta to American grill sort of stuff, etc. But seriously, everything was mediocre at best. The ONLY things I actually enjoyed were the crab stuffed tilapia, the quesadilla, and the little cheesecake cup. The rest of the food I picked at, and I tried nearly everything.   Now I probably would've given them a 3 star rating as befits mediocrity, but added to the lame food was the fact that we waited in line for an hour despite the fact that we could see that an entire side of the restaurant was empty. Perhaps that was a staffing issue, but it still seems like bull.   If I ever come back to Vegas again, I can guarantee that I will not waste my time or money here.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

86iUdA76IrPrPt-PiSH3nA.text: Ate here for the first time yesterday! We came around 11:50am for lunch and the wait was 20 minutes (only one cashier working). We came here on Christmas but our Travelzoo voucher didn't work (on weekends too).   The food was decent. The sushi wasn't good, but I liked the variety of other things, like the Southern food. I enjoyed the shrimp cocktail and white wine clams. The best part though? DESSERT. The ice creams were so pretty, and unlimited cotton candy?! You've got to be kidding me. The guy working there (we came back to look for his name tag but he didn't have one :() was really nice too.  Also, we had an AWESOME server, Rudy (extra star for him). He checked up on us pretty often and was super friendly. He brought us a lot of drinks and we didn't manage to finish it all. There was even hot tea with honey. ^_^   Overall, not the best buffet in Vegas but decent, especially if you love desserts lol. Might come back again???

F0dA9hJJf_QXDB0SW5otxg.text: Terrible service, servers got mad when we asked for our drinks and we paid for all you can drink. The food was dry... terrible experience all together.

v57Wp0cJxw6R63QIaowklQ.text: The place was nice and clean looking. The seats were comfortable and atmosphere relaxing. Service was prompt and friendly. Unfortunately that's about where the good ends. The food was not well. The turkey was very dry and had to eat, the roasted potatoes were dry, same with the breadsticks and corn on the cob. The lemon pound cake was hard as a rock. It just needs to be switched out more and not sit under the warmer for so long. On a good note the Chinese food was good and the sesame balls were fantastic. The bread pudding was good but was almost completely gone and I would have had more but couldn't scrape enough off the bottom. The ice cream was delicious. Seafood was pretty good. All in all just moving the food around and restocking the items that move out fast would make it better but at this time I don't think it was really worth the money.

8aamSq_4JNAcEXEvzEylJw.text: Unfortunately I have nothing good to say about this buffet. We ate there on Tuesday April 17th. About 3:30 pm. We had a flight to fly me back to St. Louis at 7. Started feeling wheezy and sweating about time I boarded plane. Within 1 hour of departure I puked twice and was in the bathroom with diarrhea once on the plane and felt nauseous and dizzy the whole flight. There was four of us that ate and the only thing I ate they didn't was a salad. I must say I will never eat there again.

77clMakLvfTMf05baPdJ6A.text: Beyond the wonderful food (the prime rib and fruit tarts are to die for), the most amazing part of our two dining experiences was a particularly sweet and kind server named Adrian.   His joyful demeanor, beatific smile, and darling personality was one of the highlights of our trip! We were blessed to have someone so thoughtful take care of us. If you are lucky enough to be seated in his section, tell him Jodi the Birthday Girl says hi. Enjoy!!!

TlJR8ILhuY72lRBPQA_HMw.text: No no no no. Try another buffet, like Cravings at the Mirage.  I thought this buffet would be worthwhile but the food did not hit the mark at all! The lo-mein was sitting out and got hard - it opened around 3pm I believe and I arrived around 4pm! How does that happen?  The crab legs tasted like salt water. Yes they were cold crab legs but they weren't anything special. Comparing to the warm crab legs at the Mirage, they don't even!  The only good thing was the cookies and cream ice cream but I could've gotten that anywhere else for under $10! I wish I picked a different buffet or restaurant; I was basically out $40.

rMmXCYlwoJufOnMIhvQ1Tw.text: Tough call on a budget buffet  Food 2* Budget 3* Service ?  Are you in for an AYCE buffet in Vegas? Sure!  Will you get quality food compared to a full price meal? No.  Is it a "budget friendly" option? Well, it's cheap.  I was comp't but would not have been $34.99 for dinner. Not worth it.   Let's go with basic buffet rules (as we should all know), MEAT only! Crab claws: Ick! Soft, mushy and...just no.  Prime rib: filling but nothing "prime" about this. Tried a few cuts on a few roasts. Not what I want my prime rib to taste like. Even the salty ends were meh.   There was some other meats like fajita chicken and Italian meatballs that were equally edible but not worth returning to.   The sushi was HEAVILY riced but the seaweed salad was a nice shot.   I don't know what you're looking for.  If it's a cheap meal, sure. You could do worse. I guess.  You could do allot better though from a buffet in Las Vegas.

a7OqXu7YUXcFek5x95vt5g.text: People be careful not to get reaped off in Flavors buffet. While they had posted $31.99 for adult dinner and $21.99 for children, we were a party of 9 adults and 1 child and for a  Friday dinner (06/28/2019) I was charged $380. After reviewing the bill in my room I realized they had overcharged me by $46.00. After calling them and a long wait they explained that they charge %15 extra for parties of 8 or more while nothing was posted on their signs in restaurant in this regard. Usually they should honor you with discounts when you have a large party!!! A total reap off. I will never go there again. Be careful people

saaCalEPE3aouAaYEZxEjg.text: The food was very good. The people that waited on us were very nice. Especially the people at the desk. I would definitely go eat there again. The only downfall is the dirty benches would you need to be cleaned or replaced.

nAY-gtpYX0DztowKCOPSLw.text: One of the better buffets within the ok buffets.  A good amount of variety with an acceptable level of quality. A more acceptable place to overtake your appetite.

3FfkozH3hDjlS2XfqA08yw.text: Adrian, our server, was a really nice guy. He even gave the kid in our group a deck of cards.  Crab is not sliced in half-lengthwise, which is better.   After a while, all the buffets in the 24 hour pass start tasting the same. I'm still glad we tried this Harrah's buffet though. There was a very short wait on the day we went. It's definitely not as impressive looking as Bacchanal. But it has enough of a variety. I wouldn't go here as my only Vegas buffet, but as one of four it was alright.  I think the bathroom was outside of the restaurant area :( Ask for directions before you leave the buffet area. I like to wash my hands intermittently and walk is far.

PPqnrKTHSs538LRwUTrvhQ.text: After a long night of drinking you're probably hungry? This breakfast buffet isn't a bad choice, located in Harrah's the buffet has a lot of choices food-wise. Everything from eggs to bacon and waffles to bagels they pretty much have it all. The food itself wasn't bad, some items were greasy and bland but could be fixed with a little salt and pepper. It seemed clean and not dirty or run down. The server we had was great, she went out of her way to ensure we were ok. It's not a bad place to stop if you're not sure what you want and maybe just want a bunch of different foods.

M41deTPLyCMk2zUrLpCglg.text: For the price you can not go wrong! We come here when Rob wants crawfish! He notifies he's on his way and boom...there they are...platefuls! The service is excellent! The staff is always friendly and trying to please! The crab legs are on the small side so I usually come here for the prime rib. Always seasoned perfectly, tender, and cooked medium rare the way I like it! I highly recommend it! So many other dishes to choose from including fish (often too dry) chicken and pork. There is a nice pizza area too. The desserts are plentiful and ice cream bar is nice to pick from many flavors. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Crawfish

4RQqAVjSfSI0LGFgbDSNqg.text: Visited again last week due to the long wait at Bacchanal Buffet. Moderately priced compared to most buffets. Smaller than most buffets on the strip.  Dinner fare was typical and what you'd expect (fish, fried chicken, grilled offerings, mexican offerings, italian offerings).  The ice cream was the star of this trip.

2jg93di4uQJNrrybPy8CWg.text: It was OK I would not have gone to this buffet if it was not part of the buffet at buffet passes the customer service was also OK but this place is so outdated and the selection is just so small I can't recommend that you go out of your way to come visit this location and even if you're on the strip so many other birthdays around you that are way way more better

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MfUz5kh8FAP8tIJ2xz2opQ.text: Best buffet on the Strip and certainly, the best service (in the Diamond section) of any Caesar's properties. Tip. Between the fruit and the desserts are the lightest waffles. Drizzle some vanilla cream, some strawberries, and to with whipping cream. Make sure to accompany this treat with their superior coffee. Thanks #2: drizzle the sweet Thai chili sauce (in the Asian section) over the popcorn shrimp (seafood section), for a yummy combo.

PBofOFbK-x9M74E6bXj53w.text: Better than average Buffet. With so many places to eat here in Vegas, I would definitely return to this place. What I was so impressed with was the presentation of all the different food stations throughout the Buffet line, most of all the taste and quality of the food. One of my favorite's was of course the craving station and the omelet station, made to order. Cannot forget the Sweets with so many to choose from. The meal would not be complete without mentioning the service I received from all of the employees. Your Hospitality was sincere, Thank you. The taste, quality,and most of all the cleaningness throughout the Buffet line was exceptional. Keep up the Good work. 30/100 Yelp challenge.(2018)

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pricey and no Beef until 4 pm
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s0g8oCYGlDQheicQXdzrlg.text: We had 2 complimentary buffets through Caesars Rewards program.   After reviewing Yelp reviews of other buffets to decide which one to go to, a very close friend recommended Flavors.    Our Platinum tier status allowed the opportunity to enter a special line which was nice.   We were shown to a booth  which displayed a "Platinum" sign.   I don't know what purpose that served.   The person who served beverages and removed plates and such came to our table twice so refilled beverage once and removed plates once!   She was not visible to call or flag down.   In fact, very minimal dining area staff seen.     Food offerings were of good variety .., Asian, Italian, American and Cajun ... Clam chowder, Cioppino warm but ok.  Crab legs & cocktail shrimp very good.   Fried chicken breast dry under warmer, Mac & cheese & mashed potato were good.   The prime rib w/ au jus was very good.  Could possibly return for another try .... overall the 3 stars were for the food.   Dining area service would be 0-1 star.

hzZygLemTVDePvr68L4p3A.text: I have a few of my favorite things and I can find them here at the Flavors Buffet nestled inside the Harrahs Hotel and Casino. I love me some tasty crawfish, delicious crab and claws and if i'm really lucky a tender piece of juicy, flavorful prime rib.    Chef Manny, Chef Robert and a huge thanks to Chef John for a fantastic meal every time I swing in. This place was really hopping and we got there early to avoid a huge crowd that entailed after we left.   Everything was spot on and always enjoy the tasty food here at Flavors Buffet.  I have my favorites for sure and usually pile on for just those, but a. ice bowl of ice cream at the end ways seems to hit the spot with some hot fudge and delicious sprinkles and oreo cookie pieces on top.   Keep on trucking Chef's and looking forward to my next return to the Flavors Buffet.

yGqT6XJFo0klL6nSsK6-jQ.text: Can't complain for a Sunday dinner visit. I wish the Harrah's in Valley Center in California would take pointers from here when it comes to service and food prep. I specifically enjoyed a number of dishes, the one that stands out is the Ox Tail Soup and array of sea food options from oysters to crab legs.  Enjoyed the diamond perks of one free alcohol drink and served drinks.  Flavors hits your Las Vegas staples from Mexican to Asian. What makes it a five star review is their consistency and reliability of satisfying your desire for over abundance fantasy of over eating.

Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QxqybUa-ihRAhRLBvhSVBA.text: I'm sad that I didn't have the great experience some of the other reviewers had, but I was pretty disappointed when I visited Saturday morning. The good was there was no line, the bad was... the food. I'm convinced everything I ate was frozen, prepackaged food. Started feeling a sore throat after eating here, too...

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kind of seemed like they bought a bunch of frozen premade food and reheated everything. Regrets.

XaB_-jth-W5LWK674lisuw.text: OK this place would get a higher rating if not for the somewhat disorganized set up. Other than that the food was very good. I think I ate my body weight in crab legs. Again, it's good but there are better buffets out there that are cheaper. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZXXqm9NJ3DQ8U1PnLPVLIQ.text: I've tried a few buffets while in Vegas and this is personally my favorite. There's so much variety to choose from. We usually go to Vegas every year, and this is where we eat lunch every day. I do a crash diet a week before to make sure I can eat whatever I want. "What happens in Vegas"... (is you gain weight from all the food!). It's totally worth it, though!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZreBgxrHvt_8yDy-SRoCxQ.text: Went on a Saturday around 6. It wasn't busy at all, only about 2 couples ahead of us in line. The food was decently priced. We chose this place for the variety and also the price.   They had a huge variety of food so you're bound to find something that you like. I went back to get more prime rib a few times. The sushi was alright, the rice was a little dry.   Definitely got $30 worth in just the amount of prime rib and mashed potatoes that I ate.

nRi87ExiD3NvVOrXh7hcjg.text: Used a groupon of course for dinner Thursday night September 12 including unlimited beverages as they are among the best deals in Vegas (except for the breakfast or lunch buffets with more limited selections.) First time experience at this buffet was very good & I can't understand some of the negative reviews here about the food.  Food: Snow Crab legs offered both hot & cold & they were much larger than the Rio sister property which touts Rio buffet. Delicious crab meat.  Peel & eat shrimp also excellent as were crab or shrimp gazpachos & mussels . Didn't sample the crawfish as I not a fan but they have that too. My dining companion loved the prime rib but I just rate it an OK as the small rare slice I had was a little tough & the carver who did not speak English well kept motioning for me to do something with my plate which I finally figured out was take it out of the way. Anyway, a small distraction! Desserts good. Liked the caramel brulee & hand scooped ice cream though skip the cotton candy unless you in need of a sugar fix. Ordered unlimited chardonnay with dinner but when served we tasted & remarked how sparkly & sweet this chardonnay tasted compared to others until we realized server had misread order & was bringing champagne instead. OK, just went with the flow but had to keep asking server for refills.

cLBt0zJWOJcPUVJ5dTQPSg.text: My family and now my boyfriend...LOVE THIS BUFFET! The service is great and the food is yummy. We think the price is perfect! You get what you pay for...

Ec64yuv7CIbKsZ-11gj0Rg.text: This is definitely one of the very good buffets in Vegas (I have sampled a few myself and considering the price it is probably the top one on my list).  Their food is very fresh and they carry a great selection of items from various cuisines.  I have been there for breakfast and brunch I warmly recommend the smoked salmon, the sausages and also the skewered pork (Brazilian style). For brunch they even have sushi (not too bad) and even kimchi.  Also, the place has a large selection of delicious desserts.  The reason I did not give them 5* is the somewhat high price ($20 for brunch and $15 for breakfast), but totally worth the money.

86woqPYw4RtUbhmaPVZwyg.text: I wanted a buffet with prime rib. My mom wanted crab legs. This dinner buffet served both. Its stations include salad, seafood, Italian, Asian, Mexican, pizza, pasta, and desserts - complete with gelato, tiny tarts, and a chocolate fountain. I'm probably forgetting some type of food, but I hope you get the picture - an amazingly vast array of choices - even for a buffet.  For my first plate, I marched right up to the prime rib station and asked for a slice. I got it with the horseradish sauce - strong but in a good way - along with broccoli, a couple of red potatoes, and a piece of maki sushi from the Asian station nearby for my walk back to the table.    The service was great. Our waiter was very experienced, once holding a tray of dirty dishes, probably amounting to almost 20. He joked with my mom denying her a change in beverage choice from iced tea to coffee, and we almost fell for it. When my Oma asked for a wet nap, he brought a small handful and knowingly said she could take them in her purse. Of course, the man serving the prime rib was friendly. The second time I came up and got less horseradish sauce, he jokingly gave me a hard time about not taking more. Even one of the other diners encouraged me to take more food at the seafood section. Hesitant about how many crab legs or shrimp to take, I got his support in thinking that I could finish it.  Not even out of fear of judgment but more to save you the details, I'm not going to attempt to list everything I ate at this buffet. Basically, the variety and service impressed me.

4k0HXfFmXsLZbNPKr-AnNA.text: Save your money.  The crab legs were very mushy, and lacked flavor. The steamed vegetables were soggy. The sodas were flat. And rest of the food was just so so.  The only positive thing was, they had cotton candy that you could take with you. For $5 more you can go to a better dinner buffet.

zXodtB-HGcUPJHhj8NC1xA.text: Great selection. Above average dessert selections including cotton candy, hand scooped ice cream, and mini cupcakes. Huge selection of seafood too! And don't forget the all you can drink beer and wine! Our waitress just brought us the bottle when we ordered one glass of Chardonnay!

rSR_khpzrOZmGFct7rLA8g.text: We got this as a groupon and went for lunch. My fiance loved the carving station! I enjoyed the shrimp. But the service totally sucked the lady acted like it was an issue we wanted water and booze? In all it was ok I would give it a 2.5 star but figured I would be nice and go three for what we paid it was good.

uXzrT_xfQ4iq1JxV11b5mQ.text: Perfectly acceptable, simple, mid-strip buffet.    I started my marathon buffet of buffets with a champagne brunch here and was disappointed that champagne was extra (it isn't at the Flamingo's buffet) but was OK with $6 for unlimited refills...  and unlimited refills I had!  Seven glasses later I think they probably could have served me soggy Wheaties and I would have been OK with it.  The brunch fare was standard, but I was impressed with their having gelato and also a bagel and lox station.  I will certainly dine here again.. lacks the lines of the other Harrah's buffets, but offers the same reliably mid-grade food.

KAHS9XEe4gjaECOY88OSSg.text: Yet another hotel buffet.  Nothing really special, but at least it was clean and the servers were friendly and attentive.  I think a buffet is good if you don't get sick afterwards, so there's a plus.  They had cotton candy, which is unusual.  I love cotton candy.  Their carving station was pretty good, but there is nothing else that really stands out here.  I'd rather go to some better buffets that are slightly off the strip.

SX2CUJWjVF78Yk7wH-BQWQ.text: As far as buffet food goes, this place is pretty good.  I eat here for three meals and never ate the same thing twice.  Good selection, great service.  Be careful if you go in groups though.  You have to have everyone who you expect to dine with at the time you sit down or they get really mean with you.

QV1Kc2AbnZzg7YJOGYYbzg.text: Obviously Vegas buffets are totally hit or miss but not only was the Flavors set up very modern and HUGE, their array of food was impressive from Mexican to Middle Eastern, which I promptly loaded up on. In most buffets you could hit every section of food a couple of times but this one was so big that you really had to just narrow down to choosing a couple. One of which MUST be the dessert area. Omg...tiny little carrot cakes, apple crumbles, frozen yogurt, chocolate brownies....I really wish I could have taken a doggie bag home.   Service was great too. Be warned though--they close at 10 and stop putting fresh food out at 10:30 so if you want ample time to eat get there earlier. They were really nice and accommodating to our big group and let us in right before 10. (Hey, Vegas--why does everything CLOSE before you've even had lunch?!)   I'd recommend this buffet if you're right smack in the middle of the strip. You'll have an awesome time stuffing your face.

bz50lyEmnY-AHD0aKq8zDw.text: Our first buffet in Vegas, and my favorite.  We went here for Thanksgiving and were not disapointed.  Turkey, stuffing AND crab legs??? Yes please.  The wait for our drinks was long, and I did not like how close the tables were to each other (some couple sat next to us and talked about us like we were on the other side of the room when I could have bounced my straw wrapper against their head without any effort.) Overall, great food, great time. Do it.

Dia8HGZLWnJG97Irdw5bmA.text: This is the buffet I was looking for.    Decades ago I learned to gamble at Harrah's, and the experience has colored all my views of Nevada.  High payout slots, yes!  And a buffet I can count on.  I find the food excellent, the variety incredible.  The era of $5 buffets seems to be over, but this place still draws me.  Keno in the dining area.  Waitstaff that genuinely wants me to have a nice day.  Food that I can understand.  $47.54 for 2 people wasn't the bargain that it used to  be, but it didn't hurt the experience at all.

0xEfJjasx6gXMEYRyl4SFQ.text: Ok so my five stars go to the bananas foster. Maybe it's because I'd never tried them before or maybe it's because they were amazing!!! I'm going to stick with AMAZING! They have cotton candy at the buffet which I thought was a super cute idea but with all the awesome desserts who has time for cotton candy. I swear I wanted to try the ice cream and all the other good junk, after all, my sole motivation for going to Vegas was to eat at buffets but I couldn't get enough of those bananas! I think at one point I burnt myself because I didn't have the patience to let it cool down before shoveling it down my piehole. It was well worth the third degree tongue burns! Yes, that good! I wish I could comment on what the rest of the food was like and whatnot but I'm pretty sure I then slipped into a heaven banana foster comma and forgot all about my life prior to having these bananas.  Now I will say that sadly it was a year and a half ago that I went, therefore I don't know if they still have them or if they're just as good. I pray to jeeves that one day I will be lucky enough to experience heaven in my mouth again!

90FZWK2Ndk48V29E_NbyIg.text: This was the 2nd stop on our buffet of buffets tour, and I must say it was a pleasant surprise! My expectations were kinda low after reading the reviews on here, and the intent was to only grab a snack. That turned into 2 plates. Their sushi was really good, my brother and I made 2 big plates of nachos and split them, the other Asian selections were tasty, and it was a pretty good variety overall. I stayed away from the crab and heavy meats since this was only supposed to be a snack before hitting the Rio a few hours later, but my appetite ended up getting hijacked here. I am curious to try their brunch, especially knowing it can't be worse than Planet Hollywood's. There was also no line here at like 5pm on Saturday evening. The service wasn't bad, especially since the staff displayed a sense of humor joking around with us several times during our meal. Overall, I'd say this is still 3rd of the 4 we went to, but I would definitely come back.

fOBwaMf0TfLegSGYgNrsHw.text: Food was pretty much below average.   Everything was loaded with excess carbs to try to fill you up.    The sushi had too much rice.   The BBQ pork bun had too much bun The cornbread was stale. Fruit wasn't ripe.  Ok, heres another thing.  We came here 3/21 BUT they had GREEN CHEESECAKE.  Is it just me, or did I consume leftover cheesecake from St. Patty's Day?!!? I mean, comn....who normally serves green cheesecake?!  The champagne was awful.

PXXeEyKqdBZ0qDIPr07s9Q.text: When we were going to Vegas, everyone said: The buffet's are a ripoff, don't do it, you get more for your money when you eat at a restaurant... Okay, maybe.  But the buffets have their draws. First of all, Harrah's has great promotions. If you sign up for a Total Rewards club, you save on the buffet price, and you get a coupon book for $5 off the buffet, so it doesn't end up being too bad of a deal.  Anyway... the food at Flavors: We actually ended up here twice. Once for dinner, once for brunch. Both were excellent. I completely disagree with statements about typical buffets when it comes to this place. Everything was good. A full, fresh, full of options salad bar, a seafood bar, an omelet station, prime rib carved, pasta, pizza, mexican bar (make tacos, enchiladas, anything you want), GELATO, and many flavors of it. I didn't even make it to the dessert bar, but they had sooooo much there as well.   I thought everything was extremely fresh and even the display was nicer than I expected. It was CLEAN. Refreshed. Nothing spilled all over the place. Really, it was a great place, and I think if you're trying to please a group of people - it's perfect. They have everything. I think it was around $25 a person with our coupon for dinner, and a little less for brunch.

-NHweh2V-eSnrqwolpTXRw.text: This place gets a 4 star strictly for the crab legs and the chocalate fondu. Go to this buffet friday for dinner for warm crab legs that are already broken for you and chocolate covered strawberrys.  Everything else if avarage.

f08p6NOfqrwbzqgDos5Kdw.text: about 1.5 stars is right here. Went 5 years ago was pretty good. It has gone downhill bigtime. only highlight- hot split crab legs, easy to pull meat out. Besides this, nothing worth waiting 1 hour in line for. (I had a diamond card and didnt wait or else serious waste of time and money.) Its like they are insulting you, teasing you with bad food and making fun of you for being a jack-ass in line to come eat here and pay 25-30 bucks. I would break down food-by-food, but serioously, every item sucks ass except those legs. Pretend its a red lobster all you can eat crab leg special, and you will be happy. Crab claws suck, stick to the legs, and enjoy your beverage

kXuie0UyVwsN9XJCzYmdnw.text: I stayed the harrah's room and i decide to try their brunch buffet. The place is not so big but all food looks yammy. They have toast, coffee, packed milk, smoked salmon, desserts and  very good deal too. If u want to get best quality food in Vegas hotel, dont stay. There are many buffet nearby, if you are ready to spend money for brunch.

PsM1VmBM9MdE0OdWRZQvaw.text: This buffet was by far the worst I have ever had. The food tasted like it came from a commercial kitchen that provided quantity and not quality. It was flavorless and sometimes cold. The fact that there is little to no line should be a clue to the quality of fare they are putting out.  It is my hope that they spend a few extra dollars to hire a trained Executive Chef.  It is well worth the few dollars more to eat at the M Life Buffet or Backchannel Buffet. My advice if you find yourself at Flavors Buffet turn around and find another place to eat. I know for certain that we will never go back.

cr9kimeHGN5ZKyr8w_0deA.text: This buffet used to be really good. One of our favorites in Vegas. All I have to say is do not come in near closing time. None of the sushi or seafood was edible and everything was developing a thick crust over the top of it from sitting out under the heat lamp for so long. Definitely not worth the money that we paid and I'll think twice about coming back next time. I understand that we were coming in near closing time, but shouldn't there be a discount for that if the food isn't going to be up to par? I don't mind paying full price, but the food has to be fresh and appealing.

VxdoMHTlmdU0NsZrscsUEQ.text: Nothing really good to report here, very low quality food, low quality service and not a very good value.  All of the food is highly salted and tasteless.  For what it is, there are a ton of better options on the strip and off the strip, check out Caesar's Buffet, Wynn's Buffet or Bellagio's Buffet, but please don't waste your time here, place is quite below average.

w0a201c6GrRp3XlFGrUSZg.text: My wife and I ate here as we stayed in Harrah's and they offered us $5 off each for the buffet. The two good things we remember were the omelets and the coffee. Both of those were good. Everything else was just alright. They seem to focus on individual mini baskets with egg rolls and other fried foods. Flavors is a little on the small side with selection compared to other hotel's buffets. The seating was typical yet clean. The waiter was somewhat attentive. We wouldn't go again without the $5 off each coupon. It isn't worth the full price.

fERgXAheb06gilCkGWJiAw.text: This place was a complete joke, if it wasn't for the fact I got it off a Groupon and only paid half price I'd be pissed asking for a refund. So to start the reason for the two stars and not one was simply they have grab legs and prime rib at a half decent price.  Now to start the details of this horrible experience.  The service: Ok to start 4 of us went to dinner this evening, my wife and my friends wife are full Mexican however they look white and are fluent in both English and Spanish. We ordered a round of Coors light's and bloody marry's. The drinks came and the beers were seriously room temperature and the bloody marry's were so spicy they were undrinkable. The waiter overheard my wife and my friends wife speaking Spanish, and started conversating, we later found out through conversation in Spanish only now that the waiter saw "us white people" and kept poring in Tabasco and grabbed the warmest beers he could find. This was just so him and his fellow staff could have a laugh. As soon as he found out we were Mexican and spoke Spanish the quality of service took a 180. Without asking the waiter brought us 4 ice cold beers, new bloody marry's and wine for our wives. Our drinks always got filled and he even brought all of us beers and drinks to go plus two decks of playing cards. I found this to be a complete joke and no wonder why tourism is down.  The food: The food was of a typical buffet, the crab legs were ok, the prime rib was ok as well, although in my opinion it was over cooked. I did feel the buffet was a bit smaller then the ones I had been to at the other casinos. The deserts were horrible, and some of the worst I had ever seen at a buffet. I tried every single one and not one was I able to muster a 2nd bight and this wasn't just me all four of us at the table felt the same way. The ice cream was the only desert I was able to eat and it wasn't to bad either I think it may have been made in house.   In summary I will never go back to this buffet unless I hear that it gets revamped, nore do I recommend this buffet to anyone. If you get a groupon give it a try otherwise try a different buffet such as the M resort, green valley ranch....

-le46mOI7QWOGVk83RxwnQ.text: 3 plates of crab legs! I'm not even kidding but that was all I ate at this buffet! I can't explain it but my lust for crab legs escalated significantly in the last 5 weeks or so. It's all I want, it's all I think about and at The  Flavors Buffet at Harrah's, it was all I got. =)))  Of course I consulted Yelp before heading to the Flavors buffet! It had good reviews and decent pricing so we checked it out! My friend knew of my crab legs addiction so when he saw one diner with crab legs on his plate, he told me about it and I made a beeline for my precious crab legs.  I cracked my first one and dipped it in the butter sauce and I was in heaven! It was so huge, so juice and soooo yummy!  Prolly the task of getting the meat out in one big piece and actually being successful at it adds up to my enjoyment.  If the rest of the buffet was good, I'd never know but I still give them 4 stars because of the reaction of everybody else on my table and mainly my happy crab leg-filled tummy.  As I sat there devouring my crab legs, they've gone on at least 2-3 trips back to the buffet and they made really good comments on the ribs, grilled meat and sausages.  For roughly $24 a person, it was hella worth it, wide selection and scrumptious dishes, it was a winner! Can't wait to go back! Bookmarked! =)

KMEwmkZLtZxWRqCtQ_WTTQ.text: Mostly excellent food with a fair price for being located on The Strip.  Found the decor personally very pleasing.  The staff including the cashier, server, and station staff were courteous and  helpful.  So many great food choices in a relaxed atmosphere.    We are locals and will be back to plate up more tasty food.

A3lLxBTERDWAF1PC-jgTxA.text: The chicken was overlooked. The soup was too thick. The cannoli and Creme caramel were bland and even my soda was lacking flavor. This buffet was included in a 24 hour special and it wasn't worth the special. I'll choose another buffet next time for sure.

8OJtkxKW_hxvsd_Iqu0T8w.text: This buffet is decent and well priced for a Vegas buffet experience. I personally enjoy Wynn, Planet Hollywood, and Rio for a really great buffet BUT the prices are not cheap. Flavors is $23.77 and if you have a club member card they will shave off $2...hey, that goes far on the penny slots! :)  They have salad, sea food (crab legs are pretty good), Italian, Chinese, Mexican, and other random American food. The desserts are okay, nothing spectacular. They have a large variety of French pastries but they are disappointing. The Creme Brulee taste more like flan, and the cheesecake is mushy. The best is their ice cream/gelato and cotton candy bar so stick to that.   I like this buffet but I don't love it and it's definitely not the best on the strip.

6o1fnKdiDyLWXms0tqf6ng.text: Me and my boyfriend came here with a groupon (all you can eat and drink-alcohol- for $40). For this price, we rate the overall restaurant a 4 star. I had read some of the other reviews before going and I was just a little worried with how our experience would go but for the price, we figured we could give it a shot.   When we first arrived, we were not very impressed- the ladies at the front were not the nicest and certainly not welcoming (almost felt unwelcome) so I was kinda worried we were going to have a bad experience. However, Abba took us to our seats and she was very nice. Our server was Phoung: she was INCREDIBLE! We were so impressed with her service, we NEVER ran out of drinks and she was so attentive.    The food is not bad, especially for a buffet but that's what you have to realize, it's a buffet (quantity vs. quality), I have definitely had worse for buffets. I would probably give the food 3.5 stars overall (but the mexican food was pretty good-especially the quesadillas) and they have a pretty good selection. For the price we paid, we really just couldn't complain, but I don't think I would pay $70 to go there again. If i was going to spend that kind of money, I would probably pay more and try one of the higher end buffets I've heard about.

01-Q5PO9NekvSrzUG5oYyA.text: This was my final stop of the buffet of buffets. Honestly? There is nothing special about this buffet. It has all the standard Vegas buffet choices and does not excel in anything. The gelato flavors were lacking in exactly that. Flavor. It was very difficult to flag down our servers for plate service and drink refills.   We were seated adjacent to the casino floor, so the cigarette smoke from the floor kept sailing in making our dining experience less enjoyable.  What was really annoying was that they had no restrooms inside the buffet. Being that I didn't know the Harrah's floor layout, it took me about 10 minutes to find a bathroom. I'm surprised I didn't already pee my pants.   Again, the buffet is nothing special and excels in nothing. Majority of the food looked like it had been sitting under the heating lamp or on the steam tray for a long time. I'm glad I didn't pay full price for the buffet. I won't ever come back if I don't have to.

lZzvPg_vJ4SjsLgWUl75hA.text: We came in for lunch and we were absolutely delighted, Flavors was outstanding at lunchtime. Rudy kept our drinks full and the Churrasco Pork was to die for, and the $9.99 all you can drink beer/wine was worth every penny. I would rate it 6 stars if I could.  It was so good, we thought we would come back for dinner. But when we did, it was like we had come to an entirely different establishment. The entire mood and attitude was changed. Trying to get a drink refill was like pulling teeth, eventually the original lady that was supposed to be our server disappeared entirely and another guy pretty much adopted our table since we were calling out to him so often. The cooks were lazier at dinner than at lunch and didn't get anything refilled in a timely manner (particularly the Churrasco pork) and one of them was just plain rude. The 9.99 all you can drink was not as worth it this time as my companions barely got four drinks out of it with all the trouble they had getting served.  Between my six-star lunch experience and my two-star dinner experience, Flavors averages a 4 for on the whole.  I suggest you go for lunch, and if you see Rudy, tip big. He's the man.

UiwDiR_PL4VqNX7wwdgO6w.text: Surprisingly this was one of the better buffets that I went to. The selection was pretty good and the prime rib they had there was cooked to perfection unlike other buffets that are usually dry and flavorless.   They have plenty of food to pick and choose from. Like cotten candy...yes cotten candy and prime rib, a match made in heaven.  Take an apple or a bananna from the buffet and put it in a bag to take with you. Last thing you want to do is be charged $50 for an apple at the Bellagio.   I would stay away from the clam chowder. It was really thick and I'm sure if you stuck a fork in it and turn the bowl upside down it wouldn't drop. It has the consistancy of paper mache, in fact it might be paper mache.  **We bought the Buffet of Buffet passes for $44.95. We purchased this at 8 PM. I think it's best to have this if you are going to be in town for a while. Get it late so you can get your breakfast, lunch and dinner all in 24 hours**

PZDMLzzmQeC7SxQ47JrVOA.text: Wow this buffet is so empty and Its not the best but heyy its pretty cheap.   So we were seated right by the dessert station. It's like the waitress knows me or something! Haha. The server was so amazingly nice, always joking around with us and compliment us. He's old and he looks like the man from UP. Hehe  Food:  1. Primed ribs: wow super rare... I didn't bother touching it  2. No wine or champaign means no mimosa :( so I just got cranberry juice  3. A lot of Cajun food , which I love. Delicious sausages, chicken, veggies, and mashed potatoes. Corn bread was so bomb! Lots of carbs. Corn was kinda burnt tho.  4.BBQ ribs were mediocre. Someone told me that the meat only falls off the bone if it's over cooked but I guess I like it overcooked. This ribs was yummy and saucey but it didn't come off the bone easily  6.cheesecake was light and creamy. Comes in a really small bowl so you can have self control  7. Free cotton candy that you can take out. Comes in purple, pink, and blue 8. Crab legs were fresh but small. Just grab a bunch so you don't have to keep going back and forth  9.Alfredo and marinara pasta and thai noodles are so good!! The pasta was cheesy and hot. Thai noodles was kinda plain but I'm fine with it  10. Gelatto: mint, chocolate chip, passionfruit, vanilla flavors: yes I have tried them all in one sitting...shhh   The only thing I don't like about this place is that there's no restroom! You'll have to go all the way out to the casino to do your thang.   Ill come back again ... Next time.

Ah4JDINxFGxCHsKziD4f_g.text: I am not embarrassed to say I LOVE buffets. I am, however, embarrassed to write the review of this one.  I saw this buffet on a few top ten lists, all of which praised it for being far more affordable than the other top-notch Vegas buffets.   My experience was laughably bad. First, it's only $10 cheaper than some of the best buffets in Vegas (Bellagio may be my fave) at $27, and the experience is night and day. Much of the food was mislabeled or had no name cards at all, and when I'd mention that fact to the cooks behind the counter, they literally shrugged.  I asked to move to a table near an outlet so I could charge my phone, and the waiter told me "no one will help you there", so I sat 15 feet from where they sat me... He walked past me 10 times and never got me a drink or said another word to me. The food was just OK. Not as big a selection as the Rio or Wynn, and while I'm not big on shellfish and sea food, I'd say that was the strength of this buffet. The dessert selection was huge, but much lower-quality than any of the top-notch buffets. I ended up eating a make-your-own fajita, which is a bad sign. There are so many better choices, avoid this one.

gE_cWNsPyuhNeA5kKLXHXw.text: The food was kinda bland. However, to be able to sit and eat crab legs all night was totally worth it. I will never pay full price for this buffet, I got the Groupon and even that seemed overpriced for their selection.y advice, stay off the strip better bang for your buck at the Station Casino's buffets.

j-5CTT_j3ZsXi84_5EKWzQ.text: Just recently we got the 24 hour pass.  Make sure you know your 24 hour clock and get there way before time since they will reject you if you are late..  We were 15mins late.  NO GRACE PERIOD..  Otherwise we love the food and have been there plenty of times before helps when your a Diamond or Platinum card holder.  Like we are.

ZnwUK5Hm96TI-8FzRR7K8g.text: This place was just not good. It smelled of fish - indicating that the seafood wasn't the freshest. This was unfortunately my greeting walking in. The menu selections were varied which was good but everything I had was no better than 'okay'. Actually, the ice cream was amazing but not worth coming back for dinner (but I would buy it from a nice cream parlor). Green beans were mealy and old. Carrots were covered in a weird thick glaze. Even with a buy one get one free this place was not nearly worth the $27 price we paid.

lK5S0WTxDGXQhxT3bMDf_w.text: I used to go this buffet every time I went to Las Vegas.  Over the past year, it has not only went down, but crashed a horribly.  The food now tastes processed, not fresh and they have apparently started using left-overs a lot.  It is just not good.  For $23-27 it a very bad deal.  I ate at Palace Station buffet for $6.99, and that was better than Flavors.  If you want a good buffet for about the same price, definitely go to Planet Hollywood or Rio Buffet.  This place just is bad, now.  It is a real shame, too, because it used to be one of the highlights of our trip to Las Vegas.

FaoQzabTlIKVU3JSno-0yQ.text: We went to Wicked Spoon Buffet, Carnival World Buffet, Le Village Buffet and this buffet. This is the one I like more than the other three.  We bought the buffet of buffets for a day when we arrived in Vegas at 1 pm on Sunday.   What I like from this buffet were the crab legs, shrimps, prime rib and the galeto with waffle cone. Actually, this buffet has more taste than Wicked Spoon and Carnival World.  The crab legs were bigger and more meatier here and they actually scored them so you don't have to crack it open with the cracker yourself, how thoughtful of them. The chowmein actually had taste and siu mei was pretty good and warm considering this is Vegas not LA, the prime rib was tasty also. The waffle cone had a little sweetness in it and it was pretty fresh.  So overall it has more taste than the other three buffets I have afore mentioned.  Actually, we went back for lunch before we left Vegas on Wednesday afternoon, but this time they didn't have the crab, so not sure if they only served crab on the weekends or Sunday only.  Although this hotel and buffet might not be as new or fancier than the other hotels and buffets, will I come back to this buffet the next time I visit Vegas? We might actually.

uKg89u8qkocUg-jR4QDm0w.text: An ok buffet.  Only reason we came here was because Bacchanal at Caesar's was busy and this was the nearest walk.  =(  I mean, there are MANY buffets in Vegas.  At least now I can say I've tried it here.  Would I come back?  Maybe.  I don't know.  Try it out.  To each their own I say.

99ZSXiFHu74O1jNu23Sk6Q.text: Nothing bad about this buffet!! The food and service is wonderful! I love the dessert isle

hMQOv1bCnoieHfm6HVBNqg.text: All the meat things were over cooked. I was there at the start of dinner time. I think it was lunch food put back out. I had an upset stomach an hour after eating. You get what you pay for.

CBpd7w6UDEar-9PjK5XTGA.text: Every time I go to Vegas, I literally demand to eat here. If I don't get the chance to eat here, I will probably go from a 5 foot 2 inch girl to a 10 foot hulk-monster-type creature (w/ pink lipstick).  First things first: The crab legs here are to die for. Die for! I mean where else can you get crab legs that are already sliced down the middle and warmed? The meat is juicy and salty with a hint of sweetness, such perfection should be a hell-sent sin. This is the only place I go to satisfy my urge for crab legs. All the other foods are just great, they have different sections for the different ethnic foods (because racial grouping is only natural even in foods) and I don't remember putting something in my mouth that I didn't like. Prime rib and aus jus was juicy and full of flavor, the perfect combination. The line is never sickeningly long, it's always a moderate length.  Oh, If I could describe every single thing I ate at this buffet I could publish it into a book but for your sake I won't. Just trust me and try this buffet. You'll get your money's worth.  BTW: They have unlimited Gelato! And cotton candy to take home! (faint!)

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. i had 2 more plates of these..

rth927MaTAVfBMkMzvYrag.text: The last one on the dance card...   So, this was the last buffet on our Buffet of Buffets ride. We opted for this one because our friends were staying in this hotel and would not be joining us at the pool at Caesars. We read about this one, but only about dinner... so no rodizio?  No line at 8:30... woo hoo! The restaurant was about 1/3 full when we got there. They sat us near the end of the line (or the beginning... opposite of the desserts). Our server seemed the angry type... She brought us our coffee and juice... My friend was joking that they should have dim sum carts so we didn't have to stand. Then a cart filled with juice and sparkling wine rolled by. Ask and ye shall receive.  I got yogurt again, but this time with cottage cheese and canned peaches. There were fresh strawberries with whipped cream. I got some fried bananas and mexican beans... I got a pancake... I got a crepe filled with sweet cheese... I got a biscuit with gravy... some bacon... I didn't have any desserts because get this, I was too full!   This place was good... I would have eaten here three times. The food was really good...

R9Doxaq26fVivO-0svXF5w.text: This was a big buffet, the breakfast was bland, the lunch was great, the dessert was awesome. Very clean, great service. The price is 20.00 a person. They offer all types of food

R93CIZ67-vdDaTL93HGtoA.text: Yayyy, finally Harrahs remodeled there buffet and I'm impressed. Job well done.   You will find your typical buffet stations here, asian, mexican, italian, seafood (crab and shrimp), and dessert (gelato and cotton candy included..woohoo)!  The food is very tasty!!! And the prices are just right for a buffet at Harrahs. The whole place is clean and the service employees keep your table clean and your drinks filled!  If youve tried the buffets at the wynn or the bellagio, this is not in comparison..so try this buffet first then start your upgrades cause if you do the wynn or bellagio then come here, you will be disappointed!  Will come here again, and would definitely recommend.  Tip: You can go to the half tickets booths throughout the strip and buy the buffet for almost half the price!!! The nearest booth will be at the mall across from the wynn, right next to starbucks!! Worth the walk, especially for large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. find this coupon at  http://www.lasvegasfun.us/image/Paradise_Garden_Buffet_Coupon_Las_Vegas_Harrahs_Las_Vegas_Buffet_Coupon.png

CR4I9a8OlcdXz5bogym82A.text: Knowing that Flavors didn't get as good of reviews as the other buffets in the Buffet of Buffets.... we came here for breakfast for a light meal.   I got the typical breakfast foods (sausage, eggs, bacon, cinnamon rolls, etc), but even that wasn't very tasty. There was no line at all when we came, and there were only a few people eating at the buffet.

fwTkH5iC0Ci6-LVyzegWyQ.text: Good food. Fried rice is moist. Shrimp plentiful. Staff pleasant and friendly. Weekend brunch is $20.99 but a bounty.
