02T0nruihFLR-HQuaOP70w.text: It was terrible. My made to order egg omlette was not fully cooked. Raw runny eggs were all over my plate. The Ham was unedible, rubbery and gross. I took 3 bites and had to get up and ask for a refund, which they didn't even bat an eye...I have a feeling, lots of people leave. It was that bad. Spend a little extra and head over to the Mirage. Go to Ceasars if you can afford it.

vH3dWS9aYifnlK9x6o4meQ.text: If I lived any closer, I would be 500 pounds.   Is it weird to get five slices of pie at one time? because that definitely went down.

N3YH3DFDuLds2K95JO-SFg.text: One ServSafe sanitation class and a person swears off buffets for life. That is, until you get to Las Vegas and specifically, until you get to Flavors.   First off, the "Ultimate Buffet" applies to about eight of them in various hotels. Sort of a stuff-your-face day pass, if you will. If all you want is one meal, you pay a much more reasonable fee. On that particular Sunday I think we paid less than $20 each - and I easily ate twice that in crab (the point of the whole thing).  There is something for everyone. Salads, seafood, pasta, pizza, carved meats (which we witnessed them smoking in-house), Chinese, sushi, Mexican, Italian and desserts for days. Almost every single thing we ate was delicious, definitely worth the money and the wait.

yI4DI7T27mqKkGfxCsyMAw.text: I ate here for lunch on New Years Day. While every other buffet was charging a special holiday price of ridiculous proportions, harrah's was staying with the normal price point. A little over $20 for lunch. There was a lot to choose from and I chose it all! Very good! Great deal.

yK10P30t5VqoWOMWGkZ5yA.text: We went to Flavors for breakfast as a part of 24hr buffet of buffet deal.  The service definitely lacks comparing with other participating buffets.  The only good thing they had was the Spanish rice and Chinese sesame balls.  I did not like anything else.  I would definitely not recommend going to this place, even if you have the 24hr buffet thing.

1_jnHSpV3LvfzMF8CmDCoQ.text: Blah, this buffet is okay, nothing fancy but it didn't suck either.  If I were the FOB that I was over 30 years ago then this place would've rocked my world but, alas, I am not, thus only 3 stars.  I bought the Groupon deal.  It sounded like a good deal at the time but it really isn't.  Oh well, live and learn.

aFBnADV3sq2sNjpxUWylvA.text: Expensive, and just not very good.  It all looked appetizing, just tasted like they have opted to use fake butter and other cooking ingredients.  I have no idea if this is True, just can't think of another reason for the lack of flavor (except for salt...and there was plenty of salt).  The service was good, but they weren't very busy and it was dinner time on a Friday night.  Mot having to wait in line at a buffet on a Friday night should have told us to go somewhere else! We used to buy the 24 hour pass for $48.  It was nice to have dinner and come back in an hour or two for desert, instead of stuffing yourself all at once.  The price has gone up to $78, making it way to expensive for the small amount of food we eat.  We didn't buy the passes this time, just paid for dinner.  After eating dinner, we were glad we had passed on the passes!

yFAgNichA2CQoeMSTpW1Tg.text: Look, you've got a couple kinds of buffets in Vegas, some are very fancy, expensive and all that. Flavors isn't that kind of place. Flavors is a straight up buffet for the average Joe and Jane. With tip dinner costs about $30. That's pretty dang reasonable for what you get. By the way, they make some pretty creative items, especially desserts! They even had 5 flavors of cotton candy one of the times I've eaten there! I'd argue that this is one of the best kept secrets of Caesar's entertainment. Make it a part of your next visit to Vegas.

NFmguKb6D5r8JM1xmsq7pQ.text: Worst service ever! I had the most rude waiter you could ask for. He talked back and gossiped with other customers and ignored the ones he didn't like. The food was pretty good and even though the quantity was not as large as the other buffets it was pretty good for the price. Even though the waiting staff sucked the food wasn't bad.

YTOGW_Rn4vDhTdUZLZftQA.text: A bit disappointing. Service was blah. We went here because of a coupon which was good for breakfast, lunch or dinner. They couldn't take it because it was Sunday and they were serving "BRUNCH"! I get it now! The people there could care less if you eat there or not or if you like it. I did have an extensive amount of crab legs which were just OK. Certainly not the best around the area for sure.

g-OHBlirDJQk88add06NaA.text: I was invited because my friend loves the crab legs. The buffet was a little expensive but also paid an additional $10 for unlimited wine and beer. We asked for so much wine, they poured a whole bottle into 2 cups and gave it to us. The buffet itself was great. I explored the entire buffet and it was all really tasty. The dessert is to die for and they even give you cotton candy to take home with you. I recommend.

JIf0oBb_YCaHB89_QN1BOA.text: Good variety of choices makes this a 2 star. Otherwise, it'd be struggling to keep me interested. Went here for a weekday lunch. No line so that was awesome. Rarely do you not find a line at a Vegas buffet.  After we were seated, took our waitress 10 min to realize we were there. She served the tables on both sides of us but somehow we were magically invisible.  According to Buffet of Buffets brochure, Flavors is known for their Brazilian BBQ & Prime Rib. The Brazilian BBQ was burnt and hard. After struggling to finish the 1st cut and taste it, I was done. The prime rib was so red and undercooked that I couldn't even cut it. Next entree.  The taco bar was reasonable. Had nearly every imaginable topping available with shredded pork and beef.  Red new potatoes were good as well as the corn on the cob. Mac and cheese was alright. The make-your-own-salad bar was average at best. Most of the ingredients came from the fridge - nothing was fresh.  Lots of desserts to choose from - Gelato ice cream, various pies, fresh fruit. This was one of the most enjoyable things about the entire buffet except most are so heavy that you want to sit and rest afterwards. I sat at a blackjack table.

PcfrLT80bWPfXo9jQ8MOrw.text: One of the better buffet varieties we saw on the strip. Great lunch prices at 15.99. I loved the fact they offer Mexican, Italian, Asian, Seafood and fresh salad areas in addition to dessert. The servers were polite and quiet, it was very clean and large.

rvEjYTY5ezuMSYtpbSoorw.text: Food was great....Service was another story, my friend did not refilled in the five times our waiter came by to refill our mimosas. Furthermore, most of us had to wait 15 min just to get a refill

789l1QzSJIHkVicLJN4omw.text: Ridiculous!! The food was not very good. The dessert was the saving grace but was not enough to remedy the horrible service and subpar food. The cooks/servers were rude and just looked menacing. The waitress was poorly groomed and looked worse for wear. Terrible place!!! Never, for the love of God, never come here!! As I'm writing this, the waitress just spilled Pepsi on me!!

_XS4LYsVG4qR2kvecRAPeg.text: This place is great no complaints... Has lots of variety.. But i usually get shrimp, an crab legs. The kids loved this place an they lobe the desserts... An me an my family really enjoyed ourselves. If u want more upscale buffets this isnt the place but for the family it is great.

mHoqsijtXJRWn1srXiZ7CQ.text: I happen to really enjoy this buffet!  Came here for breakfast and dinner and used the buffet pass. For breakfast, they have an omelet station and it was really tasty!  For dinner they have hot crab legs and crawfish!   The server are all really nice here too.  The dessert bar was great, love the gelato!

zMVBcVG2RvoFCSPJdiLR6g.text: It really is a "Meh. I've experienced better." situation at Flavors..  It smells funny. And the service is a bit off. Mostly though, the food is a bit off. Many of the stations have the same mediocre food repeated, and I was unimpressed - even with it's reasonable price.  Even the desserts were well below par. Blegh, don't go - I have nothing else to say, unfortunately.

ET6FqRPy67dtzR-QCxyjEQ.text: Flavors Buffet is still my Favorite Buffet... A Nice Salad Bar to Start. Im a big Crab Leg Fan and The Crab is Delicious. I usually do a Large Plate of Crab, then over to the Carved meat Section for Prime Rib and Sausage with mashed Potatoes. and I Always have room for their Dessert Section with Real Ice Cream and Moose. I Highly Recommend this for a Buffet. Definitely my Favorite

UJ-vIO7rphzSpK18q0UK0w.text: Good quality for a buffet and the choices are excellent. Really enjoyed their ice cream. Service was good and I was able to get in and out in a reasonable amount of time, which was important to me after attending an all day trade show.

2WnA0ok5l1bYr4PZ_cc9pw.text: As part of the Buffet of Buffets, we came here for lunch.  I definitely would not pay to eat here if it wasn't for the BoB.  The variety was miniscule and the food was just mediocre.  There was a burrito bar where you can make your own burrito with either carne asada or chicken asada.  Both meats tasted like crap so I didn't have a burrito.  The guacamole didn't taste like real avocados.  The prime rib was ok and all that special.  The service was also pretty slow.  Our waitress disappeared for a period of time and was a real disappointment here.  Overall, not one of the buffets I would choose to go to next time around for the BoB.

cS-qODBv-RA2Nv484ZffRg.text: Food poisoning. Projectile vomiting et al.   Is that enough detail for you? I hope so. But it was a miserable 36 hours after eating here on Jan 12, 2011. And the food was not nearly tasty enough to be worth the misery. Avoid it.  I wonder if Harrah's realizes that they lose money by making us sick so that we were stuck in the room rather than on the floors gambling and having a good time?

6zZ5QUF97FdOqm9HpOTdEg.text: My group got the "Buffet of Buffets" and I highly recommend it if you're going to go to the any buffet at Paris, Planet Hollywood, the Rio, Caesars, Ballys, Imperial Palace, Flamingo or Harrahs (here). It's $40 bucks for unlimited access to all those buffets for 24 hours. If you time it right, you can catch two dinners and a lunch so it'd totally be worth it. Check it out: harrahs.com/buffets/inde... As a buffet in general, this place is pretty good. There's enough variety.. even gelato. Granted, the dishes, decor and desserts are not as extravagant as other buffets (ahem, bellagio), but it's not too bad and isn't too expensive. I would recommend dropping by if you have the "Buffet of Buffets" pass.

qJSXRmM4NGA5Oy3gb5803A.text: The food at Flavor's was pretty good, as was the selection of food! I was impressed with some of their desserts. We had a good waitress, which we were pleased about because our last buffet experience prior to this one was very unsatisfactory. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, with so many other amazing options in Las Vegas that I still want to try, but I certainly wouldn't be against it if we were already in Harrah's & decided we were hungry.

K7XB6Bhz-6qH1if77fJ8cA.text: I  always check Yelp before I go to a restaurant i like to think the reviews are good. I went to this place and the food was horrible. The only thing that tasted like anything was the crab legs. Then, I had a thought why not give someone a idea, compare the restaurants with something  else so people will really know what is what. I could find better food at a Golden Corral, do  I think their food is bad no, I just think their food is better  and you can spend less money than what I spent in this place. If you are a foodie this is not for you.   One thing must say the staff is nice.

WdYae6pSQP-besl2jY5dWg.text: This is one of the best buffets for the value in Vegas.  I have been to many and this one offers just about the same as more expensive options like Mandalay's, MGM or RIO.    This is the best one for taking kids or a lot of people.  They have an omelette station, big desert bar & many types of cuisine (Mexican, Italian, Japanese, Asian, Salads, French, Brazilian, Pastries, Seafood).    The only thing I do not like is that the weekend version of Brunch does not have a very big selection of fruit.  -Provecho!

QW9_F3yO0v-CaMZH_tjppw.text: H.E. DOUBLE HOCKEY STICKS! during luchtime.. if i want to get second hand while i eat sure why not. But NO...i can't not will not ever do that again. Its old and matronly and nothing here was good.

CDYpNlAM9HVPe0BnAcJxKA.text: I wish I could go back in time and skip going to this buffet. It wasn't the most expensive dinner buffet on the strip but we did pay $35 each. I think the awful waitress we had may have skewed our opinion a bit but the food was barely average at best. The waitress greeted us to take our drink order and we both ordered a Coke. She asked us how thirsty we were because if we were thirsty, she wanted to bring us each two glasses because she didn't want to have to make extra trips back to our table just to bring us another drink. I could possibly understand if the restaurant was slammed but there was so many empty tables and she had plenty of time to lean against the waitress station to chat with other waiters and text on her phone. I can't think of any one thing we tried that was worth raving about. As I said earlier, it was average at best but there were several things the we tried that remained on our plate as we went to try something else. We do love Vegas buffets but there are far more to choose from at this price or less that make Flavors not worth the time or money. The only benefit that came from visiting here was the Carnival Court just outside the casino that we went to after dinner. I'm going to have to find a place to review that. Excellent place to spend a Saturday night!

bO4oelYOG1A1voPQF9xrGw.text: Run. Far away. Just get away from here.  This place seems to believe that all tourists in LV are too hungover to know what they're eating or actually have taste buds in working order.   Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of options here, just nothing edible, or not golden-y brown. Even the dessert looked golden brown.   I think that's why they make you pay in a walled-off cashier area before stepping into the buffet. So no one can take a look at the food and make a run for it.   I made the mistake of eating here so you don't have to. Just run.

2Mdv7a2kOYEmukepEx6SEg.text: I've had better buffets, but Flavors is decent. The waiter was attentive which is always good. The food was okay, some of the highlights were the fried oysters, prime rib (a bit on the rare side but I liked it), king crab legs, and cotton candy! There's an okay selection at this buffet.

quRkG_Bcz6GeNVfqIotArA.text: I was impressed by the ice cream station here. It was very good. The food was very flavorful and I like shumai and shrimp hai gow here. There was not as much selection here like the Spice Market at Planet Hollywood but the food was tastier here.  The service was not as good though.

tH3ZnbgWwPiqD-EkzoTSdA.text: Awful experience. We went on a Monday night and had to wait over 45 minutes to get in. After we got in, we were sat and never saw another waiter. I'm not sure why we had to wait so long when everything, including drinks, were self serve. Our plates were not cleared until after we left. Overall a very disappointing visit, don't plan on returning.

cipKgmWOSWMxDL3AwZVFFg.text: There's a reason there was no line to get into this buffet, yet Caesars had a line a mile long for theirs!  They advertise unlimited crab, though the crab legs were dry and not fresh tasting at all.  The peel and eat shrimp were better, but nothing special.  The roast turkey was dry and didn't have much flavor.  The veggie sushi roll had a very odd taste to it.  After being shown to our table, we never saw a server again and were not offered any drinks.  Soft drinks/juice/water/coffee/tea were self serve, but if you want a glass of wine with dinner, forget about it!  The only things we really enjoyed were the salad bar, shrimp & the coconut macaroons.  Defnintely not worth $34 per person!!  If you're craving a buffet while in Vegas, do yourself a favor and pay the extra money for one of the more quality ones!

oKbiNgO7D1a8aZWVpwl-6Q.text: Bad. Bad. Bad. Stay away. Food was cold. Bland. The buffet was so messy. Food mixed in with all the other food. Staff was rude. Seafood I ate I'm hoping doesn't get me sick later. And to top it off. $60 bucks for two people with the groupon. We could have eaten somewhere so much better for that cost. A Gordon Ramsey place. In & Out would have been more amazing than this. Stay away guys.

OAbtxQftd0lTeoUY8bcmag.text: Some buffets you can go wrong with and some are great. This one was towards the great side with an average of 85% which is extremely high for a buffet.  You never know what you are getting with a buffet such as how long the good has been out for or who has sneezed on what or who has touched what and put it back, etc.  I love how they have divided up the sections into different cultures of food such as seafood, Mexican and Japanese. I stayed away from the Japanese section with the sushi because you never know with the raw fish how long it has been out there and if it has been stored properly. I was also disappointed with the Chinese food section. All they really had was dim-sum, dumplings and fried rice. Where was the sweet and sour pork or the ginger beef especially?  The dessert section was definitely the best with all the ice cream you could imagine. However I was surprised that the salad bar was hidden and that the dessert section was at the front rather than at the end as dessert usually happens at the end of the meal but they had the dessert section first.

AkjMh3NZ1cEMPMp2XlKzhg.text: Really bad service i order a mimosa and i took 35min for me to ask the waitress and reminded her of my order also didn't come back for any plates or to ask if need it something else it took another hour for us to go looking for her to ask for another mimosa. We've had our dirty plates on the table the whole time we've been here. All the tables have dirty dishes on them. The worst part is that they're fully staffed. They're just REALLY slow

Z-nZ7-hoEwkz8Si5l--hKA.text: This was our next destination for our "Buffets of Buffets" pass. We went around 8pm and there was no line here as well.  Service was really good once again. Our waitress was sweet and checked up on us from time to time.   This buffet was much smaller than Rio's and the food was just decent. We came here for their Brazilian BBQ and was disappointed to not find it. Nothing stood out for us and the variety wasn't much. We did enjoy the take out cotton candy though!  In the future, I would not visit this buffet again because there are better options available.  My ranking of the buffets 1. Le Village Buffet (Paris) 2. Carnival World Buffet (Rio) 3. Spice Market Buffet (Planet Hollywood) 4. Flavors the Buffet (Harrah's)  Didn't get to try the Paradise Garden Buffet at the Flamingo because we were too full!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot of shrimp!
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

891AuEKdQc8syj6Cud6NdQ.text: Reminded me of a Chuck A Rama or Golden Corral.  We got there supposedly as dinner time started. The gravy looked like it had been there all day.  The guys behind the counter was not paying attention to the customers.  Waited for cuts of meat and the crab legs to be warmed.  I was very disappointed in the quality for the price

j_Jb1VVFyL-5FWWaIRw1XA.text: One noteworthy element in liking for a restaurant is to look and see how many people are in there at the key times.   I ignored that rule.  Shame on me.  I went there to eat with my girlfriend and should have notice there were more employees than customers during lunchtime.  It was over $60.00 for the two of us and it was probably the worst food I've eaten in a long time.  We started out at the salad bar area and there were only about three things that could be added to the lettuce.  Then we went to the meat and got food section.  Really-for $60.00 you offer turkey (dried to the point of being considered almost like jerky), some sausage and some pork on a stick that was smoked from a wood fire.   Actually that wasn't too bad.  There were no fresh vegetables.  Have you ever been to a buffet and the food just looked stale!   Yep.  That's what I mean.  I absolutely love mashed potatoes and gravy.   Oh my.  The gravy tasted sour and the potatoes..... can't even think of a word to describe this texture and flavor.  It was horrible.   So, before you step into the buffet, just sit for a minute outside and watch the people that go in and come out.   And, if you're so inclined, ask to take a peek at the buffet before you pay.   Whatever you decide....good luck and have fun in Vegas!

BCsZVgVS1mLfFlQsAp7png.text: From the guy at the carving station guarding an over cooked unmarbled piece of meat like he had to feed  500 people on it, to the sickly, unpeeled mini shrimp, you would think the bathroom would be closer than 50+ yards away. 1 star for descent dessert bar, but the savory selection of mishandled mess should shut this place down soon.   Came to see Ralphie May. The saving grace for this otherwise entirely mismanaged property.

TDJiH0PztqqdfnOaKQWjEw.text: I want to say first of all the staff is very kind and helpful. I have no complaints on that. But I wish they had more of a selection

lCMVOp-tIGURyzLC_g_zxw.text: We got the groupon for unlimited drinks and the buffet. The food was good, well seasoned and great variety. The drinks were not filled as much as we would hope. I'm not sure if they serve less when you use groupon, but it felt limited. Friendly staff and good food outweighed the unlimited drinks...but I feel it would be a complete package if you were not having to chase a server and ask for a refill when you were running low on your drink.

avRyyiNa-pENRF1wqxah5w.text: You lose all sense of time in Vegas, so when we decided it was probably time for dinner, it turned out it was only about 4pm and we were nearly the only ones in the place for dinner which was great. We walked by about 2 hours later and the line was a mile long - so that was definitely a benefit of going off-hours if you can.   Overall it was a hit and miss buffet, as I'm assuming many of the standard casino buffets are. I actually really enjoyed most of my dinner, but that is because I just cast aside all the things I tried and didn't like. It seems really wasteful to me, but some of it was just that bad. Among the things that were that bad were the ribs, the chicken, and some of the vegetables I tried. And the hushpuppies were among the worst things I've ever ingested - I'm not sure they weren't meant to be dog food instead.   However, the seafood selection was fantastic, and I indulged myself on many oysters, crab legs, crawfish (I was ecstatic someone from New Orleans!), shrimp, and salmon. I had an overflowing plate of each before I threw in the towel and called it a successful buffet.   I was too stuffed to go for any of the desserts at that point, but there didn't seem to be too many that looked that great anyways.   The staff was also very friendly and available, but again we were some of the only patrons at the time.   If you're a seafood fan, this buffet hits the mark. If not, you might want to look elsewhere.

Mz_hqkzONaKu_E9vhPK9HQ.text: Overpriced and not a good selection. They were still serving breakfast items after noon to fill in the gaps on the buffet. I was not at all pleased for the price I paid. My advice is look elsewhere for the same cost.

DxFUSj0cVmcf4QIU_ulWGQ.text: SLOT WINNINGS TO BUY BREAKFAST   On Thursday night, which was my final night at Vegas, I won $574 in a slot machine at Flamingo. I wasn't planning to have breakfast the following day when I checked out. However I decided to get breakfast for the following reasons: 1) I got a coupon for $5 off for breakfast as a Total Rewards Member 2) Instead of gambling I still can get points by eating here.  After the first plate I lost my appetite. Here's why. The first plate included scrambled eggs. I like my scrambled eggs wet but something was wrong with these eggs. They left a bad taste in my mouth and stomach. Gordon Ramsay said he could tell if a person can cook well if it knows how to cook scrambled eggs. Well someone should've vetted the person or people who cooked theses scrambled eggs. I ended only have three plates of dishes because of the scrambled eggs. The rest of the items were pretty good like ham, sausages, hash brown, and blue berry pancakes. But I always felt to determine how good a breakfast buffet is by how well cooked are the scrambled eggs.   My advice is if you won big money from the slot machine I suggest skip this place and treat yourself to a higher quality restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3rd plate: sesame balls, cheese blitz, churros
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd plate: blueberry pancakes, breakfast stromboli, country fried steak
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st plate: ham, scrambled eggs, hash brown, sausages

vATLdlgNB6pIFe488yIUQg.text: Had better.  Smallish salad bar.  Roast Beef was ok.  Chowder not tasty .  Snow Crab.  Ham good.  Ribs good.  It was ok.  Cherry  Pie good.  We had 2 for 1 coupons.

9_MBC9LRprOls3g4lD44xA.text: Food was bland and dry.   I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who has great taste buds.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yx-7GPuRVQVCAvq8B5pf2Q.text: My husband took me there for a day before Valentine's Day celebration to beat the crowds...It was ok, I've had better, not worth the Groupon $56 dollars he spent, we know a lot of people that are visiting the Strip area go in there because it is cheaper to eat there compared to other places in the strip...Now the desserts choices were good, the gelato was the best and the ladies behind the dessert counter were really nice...I for sure will never eat there again.

Q_qUPPKmPl7X7wPdn7EyQQ.text: This is a good buffet that is located in Harrah's casino. I went to eat here with my family for dinner on New Year's Eve 2016. Of course, the crab legs are a big hit and it is served on ice. There are other cuisines to choose from too. I liked the crawfish and oysters. They also serve scalloped potatoes , shrimp on ice, pastas such as lasagna, ravioli, spaghetti, etc. There is fried chicken, sushi, Mexican food and desserts. I liked the creme brulee.

zjMt9ElslnxteiDGuLG74Q.text: 2 stars for cleanliness.  otherwise waste of money. food assortments were sparse. not many choices other than pizza, some Italian pasta dishes, a few Chinese dishes, tacos,  ect. nothing that stuck out as worth $24. quite a disappointment

Q63Q0TMAc1nwFe-4YYI70A.text: I came here for breakfast buffet when I found out that the Venetian closed their buffet for renovations.  For $20 during the week, you get a great selection.  The omelet was mediocre but there was a big sweets selection and there was a mixture of non-traditional breakfast foods for you to try (prime rib, several ethnic options).  You had to get your own drinks but you don't have to wait for service.  I wish I had come here at least once more.

k8tdlulyC63bquFwaPTfUg.text: Went to this buffet for dinner on Saturday night. We bought the Buffet of Buffets wristband and this was our first stop. Since we were going to the Improv at Harrah's afterwards, it made sense to have dinner there. Wish we hadn't. The food was terrible. The crab legs were still frozen and tasteless. I let them sit there for a while hoping they would thaw, but even then the flavor was awful. There is too much meat and not a lot of side dishes. The dessert table sucked. I'd go to Caesars over this place anytime!

20fLk1G6-nqb1M1suYdMAQ.text: came here for the dinner buffet snow crab legs: thin pieces of legs and kinda dry... i just filled up a plate to get enough meat... prime rib: it was aiite new york steak: the chopped pieces were pretty good  oh yeah come with group of 8+, means you pay 15% tip also, for not helpful service... :P

EpGcxGwgj8lQ3Thqt823Uw.text: The line was short and both the service and staff were excellent, however the selection at Flavors, The Buffet at Harrah's seem to be only limited to the usual selections you find at other buffet chain. Both my girlfriend and I were very disappointed considering that we would always eat at both the Fresh Market Square Buffet at Harrah's in Laughlin, NV and The Buffet at Harrah's Rincon in Valley Center, CA. We also ate Eat Up buffet at Harrah's in St. Louis, Mi. All three of these buffets of Harrah's in Laughlin, Rincon, and St. Louis were always known for their variety of food and deserts. Come on Harrah's Las Vegas can do better than that, their sister locations have better buffets than Flavors, The buffet at Harrah's.

KVUqjAg61DFlkknBVqT5cg.text: This buffet was really long! (That's what she said.) It doesn't seem like most people liked this place but I thought it was just fine. They had oysters and crab legs at sunday brunch, a full pastry case and everything else you can think of. Even gelato.

TtqPOFGnuu5iN87DiLu8Hw.text: This buffet is only "alright" for what you pay for.  The price doesn't matter between weekend and weekdays.  For a weekday, we actually had to wait in line for a good 15 minutes since we went with the dinner rush. Our server or rather, the busboy was courteous and fast with clearing up the tables.  As for food, I aimed for the more expensive stuff such as steak, shrimp, oyster, and lobster (didn't want to fill up on cheap carbs).  I wasn't too disappointed, but I got tired with my food choices eventually.  Their dessert section is huge and they even served sugarless cakes!  I was hoping for some tiramisu cake but was disappointed that they didn't serve any.  The clam chowder was too "thick" and salty; even pouring it made it look all gooey.  They also have a selection of Asian food but that didn't appeal much to me, but they also had small sesame balls that made me miss dim sum.  Given the variety of food choices in Vegas, I don't think I would come by again unless it is because I'm staying at Harrahs.

MmfjQ3bdeC6QVR6X2vEOVw.text: Had Sunday bruch here.  Got free champagne.  Through it was going to be better per all the online reviews.  Worth your time to eat here.

tjOrUcDCjgVVF4y2_wPRVg.text: Another run of the mill buffet in Vegas but they do have an extensive selection including a tricked out dessert station with lots of ice cream flavors.  We hit Flavors pretty early so we had breakfast and lunch options even though we were only charged the breakfast price.  Hey, you never know, you might need those few extra bucks in Vegas.

S6W00eDiVFfkalrt29Q9-Q.text: Standard buffet. I'm glad we had coupons for $5 off from our IP fun book because there's no way I'd want to pay full price here. We were fairly hungry when we went here so I assumed we'd go to town on everything, but it wasn't anything worth going back for seconds. There was a nice variety of foods, from Mexican and Asian to Amerian and a salad bar (with the bucket of shrimp on ice...literally, there was ice in with the shrimp that I didn't know about until I looked at my plate and had to "fish" [haha] for my shrimp around the ice cubes.) The food wasn't horrible, but I expected more from a name like 'Harrah's.'

VTBRpuOVWRwa9axTHbSPsw.text: Don't waste your time and money by going to this place.  The food was very old and dry.  Even the "fresh" fruits looked that they were getting ready to rotten.  I am never coming back even if the meal is free.

m0avg4uQEXLBV8n6rilM_A.text: I thought this buffet was pretty good. We had a table of 8 and the waiter was pretty good on remembering our drink orders. The food was pretty good, not the best. But good enough to go back for seconds and thirds. Loved the cotton candy!

7hvJcuBDfK95cFJOTZsJWQ.text: The wife and I ate dinner here, as we had read that they had Argentinian BBQ. We never saw any of that, but they did have their food separated by cultural identities. The staff really didn't seem to be enjoying their jobs, which was probably because of customer complaints regarding the food. The salmon was grey, the salad bar had 20 dressings but 4 toppings,  much of the food looked like it had been out for days (I've seen better corn on the cob in a farm animal feed bin). The prime rib was very good, though, and some things, while looking sad, tasted all right. I've definitely had better. My rating: Staff = C, Decor = B,Food = C

t5NyTInnf6QBgaUcsTATqA.text: Paid for breakfast, and stayed til lunch.  Got to enjoy both meals.  Not a bad deal.  The downside is that the quality and service lacked.

5f6CoAAisKtrFDZJ1chYTQ.text: Evidently I completely blocked this place from my memory the first time I ate here. We booked this from tix4dinner saving about $2 per person. This is a perfect example of what's wrong with most buffets. The food was bland hotel food at it's best (sic). The meats were all low grade cuts and the buffet was clearly designed for quantity not quality. The redeeming part was the Chocolate fountain and the Cotton Candy. If a buffet is a must for your trip, try the Le Village Buffet at Paris. I went last year and it was several steps ahead of this one.

xSBYyAzstgDBhRNCOlSD5A.text: Ate at Flavors for breakfast and lunch recently while visiting Las Vegas.  In years past, I enjoyed this buffet, but no more after two tries.  Breakfast:  A complete rip-off at $18.  The $5 breakfast buffet (with card) at Palace Station had more tastier selections.  While everything I had was meh to mediocre, the bacon stood out as being particularly bad.  It was served in a bin in bits and crumbly pieces instead of strips.  The waitress never came over to serve us our drinks - I had to get the manager,  Lunch:  Again, at $24 a complete rip-off for very limited selections and an almost non-existent salad bar.  None of the food is what one would consider premium, and was on par (if not as good) as a Golden Corral buffet.  Belileve me, if you must eat a buffet on the Strip or near Strip with similar or slightly higher prices, you will do much better at Le Village in Paris, Spice Market in Planet Hollywood, or Carnival World in Rio.

8n9A6hVn9H0_TLHs0Aly_A.text: overpriced for the quality.  You can definitely get worse.  $15 for breakfast, I expect fresh donuts and bagels.  If it is convenient for you, go ahead.

vLn7EPnnCehxUi6EfPGFkQ.text: This was one of the best buffets for the price on the strip. The place was very clean and the food was all good. I ate a lot of meat and this place did not disappoint. It was all fresh and cooked well. Of course I had the prime rib. It was nice and juicey. The only problem I had was getting a refill.

0L0m1twa7KCttgk49knThQ.text: I had the lunch buffet and I was not really blown away. The price is on the low side as far as buffet goes but I was not really that satisfied. The service was good but the food was not memorable. Typical buffet food.

Bxa3nTCKaKGoxOG2xv9NSw.text: All I have to say is the only prime rib they had was well-done - that's sacrilege - all the other food was the same - over cooked, under the heat lamp too long, or dry - the only thing that was good at this buffet was the clam chowder soup...

z2VGdjuhshDKO_xjDgEKzw.text: Preeeetty preeetty good ( if you don't watch curb your enthusiasm you will not get that). I liked it, we ate here as we were about to peace out of Vegas and I hooked it up with some fried chicken, cause I'm from the south and naturally I gravitated towards it. I ate some shrimp and the salad bar was banging. All others I was with ate some breakfast items and said they were really good as well. Lost of desserts as well, though I'm not really into those. I just thought it funny that they had the crab legs next to the pancakes with a big pan of melted butter between the two. I never feel like I eat enough to warrant a buffet though and I didn't here. I think it's somewhat nasty to literally gorge yourself on all you can eat crap. But it's ten times better than golden corals crap.

V_fnPhT6LnPadfvjvWoxew.text: We were there on a Monday- in for lunch, stayed for dinner. The food was good. It was standard Vegas buffet fare- prime rib, fried chicken, pizza, pasta of assorted varieties, desserts, salad, etc. I tried alot of different things, and each was decent, enjoyable. The stuffed shells were especially rich. The biggest point in my visit here were the crab legs, which complemented nicely with the warm chemical butter. All-in-all, for the price and location, a solid buffet,

QKW8AWSnqX3-P2ZA2CYgIw.text: We paid for the all day buffet at rio and it was terrible.  We ended up leaving rio and headed to harrahs to try their buffet.  It was three times as good as rio but still not worth the money.  They had the basics like chicken wings, carved turkey, vegetables, etc.  Nothing that stood out though.  The dessert area was ok as well.  Not bad but again not worth 30 bucks and not nearly as good as the buffet at the paris.

ATlNr8vsL_7oyej73qlJgg.text: They had snow crab legs, both hot and cold. The prime rib was actually quite good. Other than that, the rest of the food was barely edible. If you stick to these two items you'll have a good meal. If you venture out and try other things, you may regret it. The desserts are ok. Lots to choose from. They also had sugar free desserts. Probably a place I wouldn't go back to, but the meal wasn't awful.

rxe4rpOzYeb6p6siAquAMA.text: For a buffet the options were amazing the food was beyond okay not five star dining but very very worth eating and very reasonable price for what you get I would recommend it.

Q8xWa_6R4joGzdJ7prz6WA.text: Loved this buffet!!  This was our last buffet that we tried on our Total Rewards Buffet of Buffets "tour" (we got four meals out of that deal).  It's a shame we didn't come here first!  As far as a breakfast buffet goes it was awesome for the price!!!! Such a large breakfast spread compared to others.  The fruit was to die for, just the right amount of ripeness, strawberries were soooo good!  Pancakes, waffles, cereal, tons of different ways potatoes were prepared, good selection of fruit for this time of the year, oatmeal, GRITS (I was sooooo happy about this), tons of pastries, our drinks were always kept full. Just thinking about this places I wish I was still in Vegas and could go to it for Breakfast tomorrow.   For the price it is a very, very reasonable selection and quality.  You won't leave breakfast from here anything less than stuffed!  After all breakfast is the most important meal of the day!      Will definitely be eating here again the next time we roll in to Vegas!!

JcUviKaRPdQESPt3PgGjCQ.text: Good, we got a deal through Groupon ($36 for 2 with alcohol) and although I've had MUCH better buffets in my time it was just ok.  The desserts and the service were the highlights, not much else stands out. I do wish there were more variety but all in all this was the definition of JUST AVERAGE.

8ftOtRGVqjdTbyZzxQYL6w.text: Flavor was a pretty legit buffet for the price we paid. We found a groupon coupon which was $30.98 for two people with unlimited beer and wine :) That's a steal Download Groupon   I was sick with a head cold so my eating was limited but if I wasn't sick then you'd probably have to carry me out haha  Anywho for my dishes, I had Prime Rib which was super yummy, shrimp with cocktail sauce which was also very good, corn on the cob (can't go wrong with that), and a shrimp scampi which I kinda thought was going to be bad but it was good :)  For dessert I had hot tea and a chocolate mousse cake which totally just hit the spot  The servers and cooks were very friendly and love feeding people   I would visit this buffet again and would expect the same great quality

tRagpvdeVeHxt9ljHq8uLg.text: This had to be one of the better buffets I experienced while in Vegas over the weekend. The fact they were serving Brazilian style cooked pork earned it an extra star.  The sheer variety of food was better than a few I'd experienced and our server was great in ensuring our glasses stayed filled.  Oh, and Brazilian style cooked pork was bomb. Yah, I know I already mentioned that but it was soooo good!

t4OLvCoxrYTgaV2CJP1CkQ.text: This was our 1 and only buffet stop on our most recent Vegas Trip... I wont do buffets any where BUT Vegas.. And I have to say this one was really worth it... I did manage to find a great groupon deal for 2 with unlimited drinks (alcohol) for $38.00 Cant beat that....   We came on a Sunday Evening for dinner - I started with salad - No complaints , fresh lettuce and spinach - fresh and sweet tomatoes, fresh croutons ... fresh fresh fresh !  We are off to a good start... Then loaded up on Crab Legs and Shrimp - ! Yum!   Perfectly chilled ! Sauces were great... Fried Shrimp was hot and crispy - best way to have it!   Next onto meat !   Prime Rib was great, Chicken wings great,Korean BBQ Ribs great - Everything was delish!!!!  So full after all that that we didnt do much on the desert, but I did snag a bag of Cotton Candy !!!!     Overall a good experience.. I have to think this is one of the better Buffet's in Vegas, if you get a groupon - Its a must try!

VYqkwq52IJkdWuzFQ2ovaA.text: Really nice & helpful waiter/waitresses. My fave during breakfast is Siu Mai, mini samosas & the French toast. They have lots of selected flavors of ice cream too. One thing I don't like is their scrambled eggs. (Ew) I still recommend this place to people. Especially, when this buffet place is Groupon friendly. :)

D3MWPG0IMA3Y83MWR0623Q.text: Pretty good selection of food. They got nice desserts and seafood. Their Mexican food was dissapointing, though. I would recommend to try their Argentinian crab legs and creme brule. This place is a good choise, especially if you get some good deal.

REu1UYuyFnjaHdYliOCkxA.text: Over charged my dad. The lady that sat us threw our receipt out while we were getting food, our waiter was not helpful in resolving the situation, as if that wasn't bad enough the food was inedible. My dad had to settle for prime rib and potato and I tried to eat a salad but the tomatoes were rotten. This is the first time we have ever spent less than 20 mins at a buffet and left without tipping. So gross definitely not coming back. I suggest no one else does either it isn't worth it. You are better off going to the Rio, Paris, Cosmo, etc. do not waste your money or time here.

qjYfe7CUWl9Wpq3iPkuPlQ.text: Argh! Why did I come here again less than a year after my initial two star review? Well, my wife and I were tired with glazed-over eyes from jet lag and too much slot play, and seeing we were playing at Harrah's we decided what the hey, let's go! Yet again we were underwhelmed by this buffet. I do like the fact that they ask you when you pay what you want to drink as it means you don't have to sit down and wait for the waitress to come before heading up to grab your first plate of slop, but that's where the compliments end. The rolls were hard, the salad bar doesn't offer a whole heck of a lot, the shrimp is peel and eat (come on!), and...and...ok their fried chicken was pretty decent.  Service still stunk like the last time...our waitress would run away for 5-10 minutes at a time (where she went nobody knows...was she at the craps table?). I left nary a dollar for her as her apathetic attitude made me sad inside.   If you're hungry and want to eat quantity over quality, this is your place. Or if you like fried chicken as it wasn't half-bad. Maybe they should rename the buffet to "Flavors, our service stinks but our fried chicken isn't half-bad!"

xl8GXMIyJTbuyyD8KKzv-A.text: The buffet was average most of the food was sitting  for a while . A fair amount of selection

kDr4tUjbGQQokT3cl-DRLg.text: Eat here early like around 5. At 6-7 it gets way busy. Club card members get to the cashier first and they come in a big group. We went 2 nights the food was great. On busy nights the seafood goes fast. I think they should have more drink machines around the place or allow us to get our own beverages because I think that all of the wait staff has to go to the same place to fill our drinks and the place is so big our drink cups would be empty for quiet a while. Everyone is friendly the food is great and the dessert bar was amazing. They had sugar free options too.

5mGaPZ_ukWUoVg2GttnHZA.text: Buffet of Buffets Marathon - Stop #4 of 7 1:30 PM Our 4th stop in the Buffet of Buffets day long marathon.....Flavors was a pleasant surprise. We were seated quickly and the 1st thing our group did was rest for a few minutes to build up our appetite....ha! The weight of 3 Buffets in 4.5 hours was beginning to hit us hard. After a few minutes, I got up and took a walk around the buffet. There were so many great looking items. I went for some Chow Mein, Fried Rice, and some Pizza. All of it was outstanding! The Pizza was especially good....I went back for seconds. yelp.com/biz_photos/dYMh... If I wasn't on my Veggie Fast, I'd have some of the Meat at the carving station....it looked really good. yelp.com/biz_photos/dYMh... Overall, it was a great experience and a pleasant surprise. Everyone in the group enjoyed their food and mentioned how it was one of the top buffets out of the 7 in the Buffet of Buffets. Return Factor - 90%

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8wm9pNiapPT1-1G37Xgmkw.text: Awful. We got a Groupon with extras - like vip seating and line and they didn't know what to do. Food was mediocre at best and small selection. VERY disappointing.

gYRHM2JaVxuHgUJCacGVew.text: I was very pleasantly surprised with the food choices and artistry in presentation of many of the dishes at such a low price compared to other buffets. Great choice selection (not so big you spend you time walking around for 10 minutes trying to figure out what to have).  I loved the comfort food options, like bread stuffing and sweet potatoes and of course prime rib.

DI3Zl8X5t5S52m2JuHvktQ.text: A to go to Buffet in Las Vegas, they serve the classics and the buffet is located at the Harrahs hotel. Service is okay we spent $75 for two adults and one child. The food was tasty and well cooked this buffet would be a hit if they included unlimited spirits in the price to get in.

9OoaTCtDvsgVz3C335ljwQ.text: Really wasn't expecting anything spectacular as we got the buffet as part of a dinner/show package. But the quality of the food was excellent.  The prime rib was really well done.  All you can eat crab legs alone made it worthwhile. The desserts were of a better quality than what we saw at the Paris buffet this morning.  Service was good.  At $20 apiece this was a great deal.

lh3Ao1M4sKELwAjqnAwRgw.text: So far best buffet compared to Paris and Treasure Island. Huge assortment of very fresh food! Tried most and everything was good. The place is very clean. They are always cleaning around the stations. Service is excellent and you can drink all the beer wine etc. you can drink. The price is very reasonable. Loved the seafood and fajitas. Paris on the other hand is overpriced and food stations not kept up. I had to ask many times to have the food filled. The food did not seem fresh. Food stations at disarray. As for Treasure Island the food was good place clean but very few selections.

UqxMAk4oAqTsq2JxvMHUxw.text: I like Harrah's Buffet for two reasons.  First and foremost, this is one of the best dessert buffets around.  Not only do they have ice cream and all the toppings (Including hot toppings!), but they also have a great selection of mini cupcakes (let me recommend the lemon... yum!) AND cotton candy to go!  So, if you just want to get your dessert on, I would check this out.  They have huge slices of pies and cookies and other little bites, but a really nice selection of GOOD stuff.  Although, they have swapped out doing Creme Brulee for a flan style custard.  Dummy heads.  The second reason is while they don't have 500 tastes, the ones they do have are pretty darn good.  The prime Rib was PERFECT.  They have containers for your condiments.  The service is good and it felt like an overall value.  We were doing the Buffet of Buffets so I didn't look at what the price was when we went for lunch, but I'm sure it was over $20.  The only negative was they made you take a picture before you went in and hand you this giant fork and spoon, which kind of grossed me out since I had just washed up in preparation for eating!  When did taking your picture before entering a buffet become a thing???  No thanks.  I'd eat here again.

fSOiNzpAtqdInN5ffRMqPA.text: I try to give an honest review and give the business the benefit of a doubt, but our experience was pretty horrid. I expected a little more considering Las Vegas has a lot of great buffets. I checked the reviews on Flavors and although their were mixed reviews, most recent reviews were positive so we took a risk anyways. I did try a little of everything, but found that I was only able to have 1 bite before moving it off to my discard plate. Only thing that was positive was the desert bar gives the option of a Ice cream cone. The Cookies and cream was good. We had a fantastic meal the following night at a steakhouse at Excalibur that was only $20 more than Flavors, so wished we had saved the money and spent it someplace else. I'd go to In-N-Out before going back to this Buffet.

bqeASdB8H03fKeRMY0XyAw.text: Love it! They have everything you can think off and they love it when you come and choose their buffet! Everything is self serve so you get full really fast and your taste buds won't know what to expect! From sushi to honey ham to pies! Come hungry! They also have and all you can drink option if you are daring!

KDehAh52hldbgEZ5mF3pxQ.text: We went for breakfast. The food was not good... service was good.... I'd keep looking for better options if you're even thinking about this place.... unless you wanna throw money away for awful food.

L4VX8gj8LxblTPHi1qxpZA.text: I used to like Flavors buffet alot, but my view has definitely changed with our last visit.  They recently put in new self service drink machines. I think that is great. But, if the only other service you are going to provide is to barely pick up our plates, you should have put the drink machines everywhere so people don't get so irriated with having to get up and get everything else.  No napkins, a cracker for our crab, no one asked if we needed anything. Service was just non existent. I had no problem with not leaving a tip, because no one deserved it.  I also noticed there weren't many hot meat choices either. Since last year, they have gone downhill.  I had my wedding reception here. I hate to say I won't return, but I hope they improve.

ils57V0Z1aO2l2hn3kW7zQ.text: Hahaha, funny how my cousins and I purchased the 24-buffet, and yet this was the only buffet we went to...three times lol...  Seems like a waste of money, but it really isn't...it was so effin' hot and we were busy doing other things that we got lazy to walk/take taxi's to the other buffets that weren't adjacent to our hotel lol...  Not much to say about the buffet...there's a lot to choose from, but that's not to say that all their food tastes delicious b/c they don't...and they pretty much serve the same food from breakfast (well of course there are breakfast items included)  til dinner lol...so that's why we got tired of it by the second time we went...  Overall it's just ok...

S7L29X0eAhBPEPzaC-cuQw.text: In contrast to some disappointing buffets at the Mirage, Treasure Island, and the MGM Grand, we were extremely pleased with the quality of food and service at Flavors in Harrah's Hotel and Casino. We had five people in our party ranging from ages 50 to 80, and we were all extremely satisfied with the prime rib, shrimp, pasta, salad and dessert bars, as well as an assortment of other dishes that were offered. They were freshly prepared and delicious. We highly recommend Flavors for Las Vegas buffet dining.

vzfpGCZf-QmPVtPyKhCOkg.text: Came by for dinner with our 24-hour Buffet of Buffets wristbands.  There was no line entering the buffet and once you reach the front of the line, photographers take photos of your group while you hold a giant fork and spoon. The photographers come by your table later to try and sell you the photos prints for $20.  The food was left much to be desired. The crab legs were small, and unlike Le Village Buffet, they weren't sliced in half, making it a challenge to eat. The highlight of the meal was probably the meatballs or sausages, which weren't even that great.  And what's up with the lack of restrooms in the buffet? I had to walk out to the casino during my meal to use the loo...

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u6G0EP6YKWNU2BXYzBiJ0A.text: This is my second time here and I have to say compare to all other buffets on BOB(Buffet of Buffets) this is the best in flavors. Yes Bacchanal  has billion items but where is the flavor, just by giving you variety it doesn't justify the price. I encourage all to try Harrahs buffet and judge for yourself. Their crab legs are amazing and delicious. This is place is on top of my list every time I will go to Vegas. Price is great and so is the food.

CpYVUan2nfFzt5i_BHVsZg.text: Breakfast was  nothing fancy but hot breakfast basics. Fresh made to order eggs was great. Chef and all other employees were friendly and helpful. Would recommend this as option for a cheaper buffet. We also had dinner there because we had the 24 hour pass. Would not recommend the 24 hour pass, as it takes 4 meals to make it worth it. They state 4 different buffets but spice market was horrible and the garden at flamingo was closed.  Dinner included 3 types potato, maccheese, fried chicken, basic chinese and desserts were few but good.

NrwveS-_-5UY1pGRZcE0Kw.text: Super slow check in service during dinner hours. Only 1 person working at check in counter and only one hostess taking people to their tables! Seriously?!?

m-38hhFhS5yJgoaTeI1SOQ.text: I think the price was pretty average for buffets on the strip. I loved all the fish dishes. Lots of crab legs. I will go again. I didn't like that the server had to bring your drink and refills. I guess i wouldn't have minded if she could keep up but she couldn't.

6_CKCB-9Xgu_PkMWqOkkUw.text: One of if not the worst dinner buffets I've been to. Stay away not worth the money. Instead spend your money at the Fulton Street Grill

WVYhc0EIlnRS-83hE7X60w.text: It was a buffet. All you can eat crab legs. Enjoy them hot or cold. Not a whole lot I can eat do to being gluten free. Little expensive but ok. Can't get your own beverage. Server was old lady and she kept forgetting to refill my drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat crab legs. Yum!

4Q8MQTSgRng3RJU1d9strw.text: This buffet in the past has been a huge let down... This time the quality of food seemed to be improved. Better selection. Staff was friendly. Sat in the diamond section tonight would of given a 5 star if Shania had visited my table!   Best dish was large hot easy to crack crab legs and stuffed salmon.   Average sushi...

yIjjpON48CcDxe0I1T-fsA.text: Overpriced!  I was very surprised at the expensive buffet price.  Around $80 for three of us on a Wednesday night.  Same price for a weekday night as a Friday or Saturday. It was late and we were hungry, and couldn't decide on what we wanted so we gave it a go.  Terrible! Let's start with the salad. It was a little wilted and browning on the edges. (not terrible if you cover with dressing and cheese) There was a cold turkey or chicken (can't remember) dish near the salads that was pretty tender and good. Next stop my favorite Crab Legs! They were terrible! Decent sized, I guess. But they tasted as if they had been slightly opened and submerged in water for several days.  Soggy and tasteless. I've never had soggy crab legs. It was disgusting. Even drowning in butter didn't help this mess.   Prime Rib was ok. No real complaints there.  However, I was really disappointed that they didn't have Banana Cream Pie, that's like a buffet staple. Instead I had a fruit torte and a carrot cup cake.  Both were pretty good. The dessert station definitely looked the best.  They do have a $10 add on for all you can drink. If you eat here, I think you should go for the all you can drink, because maybe being drunk will help the food taste better.  Also, the soda was terrible. It seemed like the carbonation was out, but they changed it and it was still not good. They also wouldn't give us bottled water "because we weren't Diamond Plus  members"  Ridiculous!

YDFn4HQ_6mzKnnFFYu7MdQ.text: Only reason to be here [if you really want one]: - You have the 24 hr BUFFET pass...and are (a) craving fruits OR (b) want to drink until you drop on bottomless cheap beers [Coors/Miller Light] or house wine [ask] for a price of $10...without hitting the casino/clubs/pubs/7-11  As for all else: - the food is SUB-PAR...and as expected [ie: clams & mussels are...UGH, a disaster; prime rib is at its RUBBER prime...and the New York strip...is as hard as the New York Brick that makes up Wall Street; Mexican food section looks and tastes like it was rummaged out of a trashcan - SERIOUSLY] - can't say much about service when you're a platinum/diamond holder; but by observing other tables...they are pretty nice! - OH YEAH, while normal guests have the cold crab legs, Platinum/Diamond section gets STEAMED crab legs, which, IMHO, are a LOT better  Ambiance: - lots and lots and LOTS of elderly people (I'd say that's a good thing if the food was GREAT because the lines to any great items would be SHORT)...BUT as mentioned earlier, the food is pretty much sub-par.

QgJJnN8fUG4gSbhOIr8xUg.text: For a weekend Buffett price it was a great experience!!! Smoked salmon with cream cheese, capers and red onions for starters. Omelet station, carvings, dessert. GOOD FOOD, GREAT SERVICE...  Kids 10 yrs and below

3D4JIG2TMgi9aRxc636Wkw.text: This buffet is cheap for a reason!  When in Vegas my friends and I make it a point to check out one of the buffets.   The hotel we were staying at offered a coupon for this place making this less than $20 a person so we ended up going to two buffets this trip (highly NOT recommended unless you can control your portions).  The food is extremely dry (even their pasta?!) and very lacking in flavor. It tasted like everything had been sitting out for hours. Not fresh at all...and it was lunch time! My friends always joke about coming here, that's how terrible it was...to me food is no joke so I don't even =p  The only good thing was that they had a big ice cream selection that was actually pretty good... but maybe that's the desperation talking.  If you're only going to one buffet go to cesars or bellagio!

Dwl1sS4L-dKRb7yaZWZbMA.text: Still the food is not to bad for the price. I liked the baked beans, grilled veggies, and their buffalo chicken for dinner. Not too shabby!

pkMSqjRWL8mts6JbZKUnXA.text: This was soooo good ! The fish was delicious. Make sure you give them your total rewards card for more points. Everything taste really good. If you're Platinum and up you're drinks are included (alcoholic) but you might as well grab drinks off the casino floor  The ice cream is made in house it's NOT soft serve. There are comfortable booths and tv screens in there. The bathrooms are located OUTSIDE. Ask for directions. It was good. For the 3 of us it was $81 just to give you an idea  I was too busy stuffing my face to take photos. Sorry !

vur3sAXBZHXM3jB0mCxx-g.text: Although this isn't the fanciest of the Vegas buffets it's still awesome. It's even on the dining card which rocks. Never a line to get in. Very pleasant and less crowded than most.

308o9RH3E2o31IS4f6adww.text: As buffets go, this one is perfectly competent. The self-serve drink situation kind of makes it feel more like a college dining hall than anything else, and none of the food stood out as particularly noteworthy, but nothing was bad, either. No surprises either way.

7ynX8C_PmyTtLx71dxjXvA.text: For a low end buffet it's pretty good! We came for Sunday brunch which included unlimited mimosa or champagne for about $27 each.   We found that Harrahs buffet is better than the Wynn (which claims to be high quality). Harrahs definitely beat the Wynn on their offerings. But I must admit Harrahs didn't have a good dessert offering like the Wynn. But get this, Harrahs serves crab legs and shrimp and a lot of seafood for brunch! The Wynn did not!   So you can guest what we ate. 3 plates of crab legs, shrimp and mussels each, 2 plates of prime rib. And then some other fillers. Dessert wasn't that great but it decent. No lines!   Also the drinks came coming. I like it when low end buffets tries to lure people in by offering better things than the high end ones. We would be happy to come back to Flavors for lunch! Also you get discount if you have a players card.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib, ham, turkey
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cupxakes
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabs

auBf_bFG17p_f2sEN29VSA.text: Been to almost half the buffets in Las Vegas and decided to give this one try for the first time and I have to tell you that it's a MUST! Came in for lunch and they still had some of there breakfast entrees out and honestly just those topped the other buffets breakfasts that I have tried. I would have to definitely say this is the most underrated buffet due to the fact that I haven't heard much about it but after experiencing it it is now one of my top locations to go! Very clean, many options, good quality, and good service! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cupcakes Galore! Only a partial of a dessert section for you to choose from.
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First plate with just a few things they had to offer. Plus the clam chowder!

nYAg6N_7Y-B_6A57bvrgRw.text: I am absolutely beyond disappointed. Aside from the endless crab this place was the biggest disaster. To start off when we were sat the server didn't take our drink order so it took 10 minutes to get drinks we paid extra for. Next whenever we needed something we would try to get the attention of the servers and they wouldn't just walk past as quickly as possible without even acknowledging us. We also had to move all of our empty plates ourselves. No one ever came over to pick up a single empty plate. We had to move them onto a server station which became too full as well. I also witness employees moving dirty dishes from one table to another table with dirty dishes and then seating guests in the tables and not wiping them down! I honestly hope the management can get this place together. It has great potential with the most lazy employees I've ever seen.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BK6HuSAGuCTYhrAlmeEdYw.text: Way too expensive for the quality of service and food. If you are going to spend $40 p/p do it at Aria or Bellagio. Way nicer hotels, ambiance, food and level of service

ZV_EyW69nct63J6vaBsTiw.text: Went because we won a buy one get one free buffet.  I was not impressed.  Salad was hidden on the other side of desert and for that reason there wasn't many salad toppings very basic.  Very basic buffer nothing special.  I would have been upset if I paid full price.  The waitresses are pulling your plates out from you before you finish your last bite.  It would have been nice if they were refilling water and coffee glasses since the drinks are at the other end of the buffet.  I would not visit again.

aePs3xfNS9Qmb1dRICK1oA.text: What made this worth my while was the groupon I purchased. It gave me VIP line access, there was a long line and unlimited alcoholic beverages (beer and wine) for the same price as the regular buffet. We had a lovely waitress, which is a other reason they got a good review. The crab legs and prime rib  were tasty. I can't say much about anything else.

HsL5mBhMiq86uyY_ks3OLQ.text: Worst buffet ever  I want to give negative 5 stars W.O.R.S.T Worst Negative 5 stars Waste money Do not go

vZ9qw2HIDB1_ZLOqMCWbNw.text: I would not have given this a one if I could possibly. All of the food was disgusting barely edible. It seems as if they served us the food from the night before. The prime rib was gray the Dungeness crabs were cold  and soggy in the middle if you can imagine that.  The  service was terrible and we waited for 40 minutes and the place was empty. I swear I would go hungry for the day then to eat this food. Not even if it were free. Please save your money the food is inedible.

vEV_ZMQTdy7UCXPAPNdViA.text: First off, let me say, that I don't really like buffets for so many reasons that are irrelevant to this review lol, but everyone says you have to go to Vegas and hit the buffets.  We didn't know which one was the best and were glad to have Flavors because it did not disappoint.   Our server Adrian was awesome! He was very nice and quick to clear the table and refill our mimosas without having to ask.  The ladies that greeted us were all wearing football jerseys and that was a plus for me regardless of their teams...even though on was wearing a Colts jersey!!! Yes! Represent!! Lol.   Now on to the good part, the food.  I was full and did not ear the rest of the day because the food was so good and I ate so much.  I shouldn't be happy about that part lol.  I had fried chicken, mac n cheese, sweet potatoes that were sliced lengthwise and thin (I wasn't ready and got too much lol) and dressing!  There were also Mexican and Asian to choose from.  To top it all off, I got a scoop of cookies and cream ice cream.  Not that nasty soft serve machine that only gives vanilla and chocolate.  There were so many choices for entrees and desserts.  I think everyone will find something that they like.

x1PtwVC8xdUDPqxBSVp56Q.text: I CANNOT BELIEVE THE DISRESPECT AND AUDACITY OF THIS PLACE!! I NEVER GIVE THIS BAD OF A REVIEW AND I NEVER HAVE BEEN AS OFFENDED AS I HAVE BEEN HERE. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. SHAME ON YOU FLAVORS, SHAME.  My partner and I had bought a groupon for the brunch buffet here, which we were excited for. We went around noon, or a little after, when we were stopped by the cashier lady. She told us our groupon was not valid because it was a breakfast option ONLY available Sunday through Thursday (it was Sunday). We clarified that the groupon said it was valid for Sunday, and considering they only offer Brunch and no breakfast option, it must have been valid during Brunch hours, or else why would it be valid on a Sunday....riiiight?!   She started to get annoyed and telling us to leave and come back on a day that served breakfast. She also said "YOU WILL NOT FIND ANY BREAKFAST OPTIONS HERE AT THIS HOUR. WHAT TIME IS IT?! DO YOU THINK THERE'S BREAKFAST BEING SERVED HERE? GO AND COME BACK SOME OTHER TIME WHEN ITS BREAKFAST. WHAT YOU PAID ISNT WORTH WHAT WE SERVE FOR OUR BRUNCH BUFFET" Though there is breakfast becuase its brunch.... right? that's what brunch is.. breakfast and lunch. Also, if they didn't want people to purchase groupons and use them for their buffet, why put them on the website?!  She kept yelling at us and waving her hands as if to slap my partner. She got so angry, waving her hands at my partners face, that I decided it was time we left.  NEVER AGAIN. IF THIS IS HOW YOU TREAT YOUR PATRONS, THEN YOU DONT DESERVE MY MONEY.   I SUGGEST EVERYONE AVOID THIS PLACE. GO SOMEWHERE WITH GOOD SERVICE.

zRIjaXwhCrlqV3QbfLPSvg.text: Came here last night 30 minuets before closing. No line, but took at least 5 mins to be seated.  Not a lot of people at this time. Everything was clean. Food was just ok. Lots of different kind of food to choose from.

RXSNMXp5soXaRBdmiSltyQ.text: This is the worst buffet I have ever been too. The crab was cold, the wait time was unbelievably long( the buffet wasn't even busy), and the food was gross. Waste of money and time.

rpjjGB6lTZR1fNGPbOT2Ng.text: Lot of cold seafood, none of the fancy ones like lobsters. decent assortment of desserts...mostly all pastries and cookies. Italian, Mexican, Asian and American styled preparations.

U-lG1EMvaiPqe1uehq3GXQ.text: We came in hungry and left hungry! Horrible cafeteria food and not a good service overall.  Wish I could get my money back.  UPDATE: My stomach is now hurting, hopefully its not food poisoning.

zSc-arylOh2TR3wieYog9Q.text: We ended up here because we got a deal that offered a BOGO buffet when we upgraded show tickets.  Flavors was a good buffet.  I feel like all the food we tried was good quality, and I enjoyed mostly everything I tried.  They informed us that they recently installed drink machines in the back, so you served yourself drinks, eliminating the need for a wait staff to do that for you.  This is not a huge inconvenience, but it is just a little less service than you get other places.  What is unique about this place is that they had a wood burning grill, so some of the selections available have a real smokey flavor to them, if you enjoy that.  I did for some items, but not others.   Other than the wood fire, you could probably exchange this buffet with any other average buffet and not notice a huge difference.     One other interesting thing my wife and I noticed was that the same exact song played on loop the entire time we were there.  I'm not sure if this is normal but, after noticing it, it became a funny obsession to us, and then ultimately began to drive us crazy.

otR0T202oKEgsWoBkCETEQ.text: Still one of the most affordable buffets on the strip and with a great selection to choose from.  The quality is great and a nice variety of food to choose from.  I have been coming to this buffet for the past 20 years and it has never disappointed.

LelgB1TfE8r1elxL-TKXCA.text: This is one of the less expensive buffets on the strip. If you're looking for the usual brunch options this is a great place to go. They have sushi prime rib station and a splash area where you can get an assortment of seafood. I think the desserts are the best and there are homemade pastries!

NgNyQME3BV7KsnVA0xOXTQ.text: Had an amazing time, we had the best server ever. Adrian thank you for the amazing service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had an amazing time, we had the best server ever. Adrian thank you for the amazing service!!!

k_xa-70j3Y7HgZCil3-a7w.text: This is a low-end buffet. Went for breakfast and no carving station, picked over items, omelette that was cooked with wrong items. Atmosphere is ok. They were not busy and it took a while to get seated. I would recommend skipping this place and going anywhere else as it equals any low quality buffet offering off the strip.

2zU7sgojOz7tSkQhAnh9uA.text: This Buffet is AMAZING. My husband and I are doing the 5 buffets for 24 hours and it is well worth it. We paid $108 and some change for two passes as total rewards members. You can choose food from, Salads, crab legs, Chinese food, Italian food, to Mexican food. The service was amazing also. I'll make sure we eat here again today!

D_Wd42VFhXbOAagQv5TZng.text: I will definitely be looking to come back to Flavors the next time I'm in Vegas even if they don't have a Groupon deal. This was a good brunch spot, and I feel like we definitely got our money's worth out of it.  Pros: -The food was pretty darn good. Buffets are so hit or miss, but this one had good food and one of those soda machines of the future so you could make whatever flavored soda you wanted. -They have bottomless drink specials. I mean, how can you go wrong with that? -The staff was AMAZING! Everyone there had a great personality and were so hospitable, especially our waiter who had to bring me more mimosas than any one person should consume on a Tuesday.  Pros/Con: -They start switching out breakfast for lunch around 1ish, so we were able to get a plate of good breakfast food and try some of the lunch fair. That can be a good thing, and I appreciated that I got more flavors out of the experience, but I usually prefer to stick with breakfast during a brunch date.  Overall, I definitely recommend looking for a Groupon deal for this as it will be 100% worth it. Heck, it'd be worth it even without one.

10CuOtW4iP4gvGkbDSgCWQ.text: We really enjoyed this buffet. They have a good selection of food and dessert options. We ate so much we skipped a couple of meals lol. They had crab legs that are on ice. The cooks will gladly take them and heat them up for you. Definitely a buffet that I'll come back to.

PPMgYKmD-jVur0qClJrD2w.text: Went here for lunch on a whim. What happened to this place? Only drinks selection, fried chicken and fries are acceptable. The rest are dried and crusty looking; sushi with hardened yellow looking rice, dried chow mein noodles, hot soups are salty. Definitely lacking food presentation and tastefulness. So sad.

l55H1hCTt86ZoFuT9C7exA.text: Its a nice restaurant for buffet style dining . Food was good with lots of seafood options.   They had lots of desserts too.  Good value for the price.  The only thing was that we had to pay for alcohol separately . Rest everything was good.

MCzxFzbiS6Y-j5x1QBe5Ag.text: After walking several miles on the strip enjoying the views... and trying to check out the highest rating buffets ( MGM, Mirage, and the Wynn ) we stopped at a small seating area to rest from all the walking and we agreed instead of walking another mile to The Wynn that we would go to the closest and least expensive 4 star buffet from where we were and decided on Harrahs ( based on my high opinion of Harrahs in Atlantic City). HUGE MISTAKE!!! Very disappointing... Not many food stations to choose from... and from what there was to choose from, didn't look as appetizing as the other buffets we checked out, not even close, shrimp was small and soggy, no clams , no oysters , and the crab legs were not snow crab, but dungeness and very hard to eat. I looked for Chinese , pork fried rice, the only thing I found was vegetable fried rice, which was tasteless. I could go on and on....  I strongly advice you to ask them if you can go in first and preview before deciding.. to eat there!

Kpo_0OAj4M5tEqbQnQM_Rw.text: Aww the food and dessert was good didn't like any of the seafood because it was watered down and the mussels was salty I asked the man to steam he gave it back barely even lukewarm. The chicken tortilla soup was awesome lots of chicken good broth!

turksyZolEBl65OAxRARXw.text: It took over a half hour to be seated after we paid, no explanation and a completely empty section visible from the front. This buffet is overpriced for the quality and selection; the food is mostly over cooked and the vegetables are indistinguishable. Our first and last time at this outdated buffet.

MrX5Vqz0gcO0v59m0CuVPA.text: Flavors is probably one of the better budget buffets out there. It is on  where you get your own drinks etc.  There was NO service so don't expect to get any help  lolThe selection is pretty good. The food was fresh. The dessert bar was interesting because there was a portion of fancier desserts that were behind a glass and you had to be served it. I liked this option. If you are money conscious this is a good option.   The environment is casual. Nothing special to look at. It's a good in and out.   I went for late lunch and there was no line.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zanjW_CVD8rt8uKVUCYVwg.text: If I could give it zero stars, Then I would have. This is the absolute worst buffet of all Vegas. We went there this morning for the brunch for $27.99 a person.   I called before going to ask if they had seafood. He told me they have lots of different seafood choices. The shrimp were smaller than the all you can eat shrimp that you get at Outback. The breakfast foods were all dried out and inedible. The buffet also has self service drinks. For $60 for 2 of us, it is a complete ripoff.  The manager, Matt, gave us our money back and we left to go get a burger. Totally gross.  The manager told me that he didn't think it was worth $60 for the 2 of us as well.

FRC4aM4Yt6iEF7hkGATaGA.text: Disappointed. We paid for a Corona at the front before entering. It's now been 20 minutes and we're still waiting to even be acknowledged. We need napkins and silverware. At a platinum table but no service close to copper or gold. Asked to speak to a manager and still waiting for that....... a person came up from the oyster bar. Watched Carol take care of all five other tables while we waited....not sure we're coming back. So, we were given some champagne and finally some silverware and napkins. It turned out Carol was our waitress. She works so hard, it seems like they are severely short staffed here.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TZ7jICmlenUZJOVryIMDmw.text: It was okay here. Food was alright. Cant really complain since we ate for free. However, we observed dirty dishes remaining too long on occupied and empty tables. I rank this buffet #3. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here unless it was free again.

HhOFRJTSdqSFgTx3S3HpLg.text: This place is very poorly managed! The horrendous service will keep me away, and I would advise you to stay away as well.  This buffet has very long lines even on weekdays. That was the case for me in experiencing the worst service on my entire four day vacation in Las Vegas. Flavors has separate lines and decided to ignore the stand by line in favor of the VIP line for 10-15 minutes! Everyone in stand by was getting extremely pissed. The couple in front started shouting for a manager, and I don't blame them. How bad was it? Read on  There was a lull in the VIP line for a few minutes. The cashier (only one stationed) just looked down at her register and ignored the huge stand by until a VIP strolled in. Suddenly she was available and helped VIP waiting time 0! This upset even those that had already checked I and we're waiting to be seated. Absolutely ridiculous! The best part is that these VIPs didn't even spend more for preferential treatment. They had a Groupon deal and spent less than stand by!  It gets better, I was surrounded by empty tables for over 1/2 hour.
