They were eventually cleared but the staff did not give a crap that there was a huge line of hungry people wanting to be seated. I'm not even sure how much longer it took to get people at those tables since they remained empty when I headed out and passed a lot of angry customers at the entrance.  Stay away! Do yourself a favor and avoid the unpleasant experience

xB4LCXpoIH4I-D612ZmHvw.text: This was by far the best buffet we experienced in Vegas & we tried several. Highly, highly recommend. Best price for the value. I think we paid around $50 for 2 adults. Great food & more variety than any other buffet. Just to name a few: eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes, oatmeal, cereals, muffins, toast, omelette station, fruit, all beverage options, chorizo, rice etc. They refresh frequently so food is not old & dry. Gets busy in late morning but before 10am pretty quiet. We had an excellent beverage server, Spanish gentleman w/long hair. Sorry i didnt take any photos.

ZHtIWu4q4rwd1Aa-igofxQ.text: The food was excellent. The choices are somewhat limited, but our food was very good. The turkey was moist and tasty,  prime rib tender and flavorful. The deserts were superb, but the good ones are hidden behind the case and you have to ask for them. We got excellent service and will return soon.

pbugw3ReGJUkzDmqtnQsjA.text: The food selection is pretty decent for the price point. Crab legs, seafood (?), prime rib etc. Food is bland and really has no flavor. Holes in booths, sat in corner next to three screaming kids with strollers parked behind us l, kinda hard to get out. I was glad I left no gratuity on the receipt when we had absolutely no one stop at table. Lesson learned. Golden Corral is better than this place

m5NAKx1ceQI656oOz2OJ_A.text: The nonsense started with our waitress.  The cashier did not take our drink orders when we paid for our meal.  We were seated fairly quick for a Sunday night, waited for several minutes for our waitress to make her way over to our table.  She picks up the receipt and starts to complain to me that there is nothing written down for our drinks.  And with that takes off to clean tables across the room.  I got fed up and just yelled at her from across the tables, but she just continued to clean tables.  Luckily another diner told us that they had self serve machines around the corner.  But as other people sat down to have dinner, they had the same issue with her.  And all she would say, I sorry and just walk away.  Plus the tables were starting to fill up with dirty dishes.  I forget the exact price, but it was somewhere between thirty and forty dollars a person to eat there that night.  The problem was no one in my family actually enjoyed the meal at all.  Should have walked next door to White Castle.

6jVmKqwiHYB7DtyMYo9q3g.text: I was saddened that there was no gelato - was hyped by the reviews on here. Overall only an okay buffet. Sushi rice is def too starchy and unless u love stone crab this place doesn't feel as great for its price. For those who say desserts are great, I do think Paris has better desserts. Plus fresh made crepes at Paris!

CbBXHBKXscrS7EKxElLyXg.text: All the buffets in town seem to have gone up in price and down in variety and quality. This was better than buffet at TI, but two things caught my attention- the wasabi was a strange pale green - seemed to diluted with something, though not sure what. The other was the tzakiki sauce for the gyros - it was clearly made with miracle whip instead of yogurt- was very sweet and shiny looking. If I'm going to spend $30 on lunch, I'll go to one of the star restaurants in town and get a really good meal instead of fillers.

GPIgwYT4IT_01KNo5ssesg.text: Overpriced and didn't have a giant selection and the crab was super thin and didn't have a lot of meat but luckily it was unlimited! And it was pretty empty inside. Might come back again!

Og449bEghOYe3mhllu0sfw.text: Snow crab leg is too salty and seems not to be fresh...  Clam chowder and vegetable soup are among several good things about the buffet, and the prime rib and the penne pasta with meat sauce are also pretty good...  It is okay to make it one of the buffet choices when you stay in Las Vegas since the price is not too bad...

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

or_1fgRTOryGZJeGfI82Kg.text: So today we started the Buffet of Buffet pass. Our first start was at Harrah because it was closest to the mirage and we wanted to stop to see the tigers and dolphins. The food wasn't bad, there was a good selection. But as far as quality...not top notch. I was more so impressed by the dessert. Kept on getting up to try some desserts such as gelato or the raspberry mousse.  Other than those I found myself indulging in crawfish. First time ever that I tried cold crawfish, not too bad.

Xe5viECJHBLWePft4ukzrg.text: This buffet was so so on a Saturday evening. I can't even recall the food I ate because none of it was impressive.   This buffet is cheaper than a lot of buffets in Vegas. There's a good amount of selection here - someone for everyone almost.   The cocktail shrimp is peel yourself and the beef ribs are ginourmous! The dessert was watery and lacking taste - it's usually my favorite part of the meal! Ice cream was good though.   I would only recommend this buffet if you have a coupon, want a quick bite to eat (there's no line), or you have the 24 hour pass and this is the closest place to go.

TJfIaucmwGoKL815l4MsKw.text: Really enjoyed the breakfast here out of all the other casinos. 20 bucks all you can eat during breakfast hours. Line wasn't too long, and everything was fast. The lady accommodated to where we wanted to seat and was really welcoming and funny. The food itself was amazing, and you have tons of opinions with the drink which is self served. Would come back again.

GWV4dJRCOHVFM5p5ysRfcw.text: Awful. Only getting 2 stars cause its cheap. Should've known better. Better cheaper buffets at home at the Indian casinos and that's saying something.   Crab legs are cooked in SALTY Salty water and just sit in it and absorb all that salt and get mushy. Salty mushy crabs legs - so gross.  Prime rib was upwards of medium well,  cut your loss and switch it out, ugh.  Virtually everything just felt like it had been sitting in the window way too long.  Finally I went for the creme brulee, pretty hard to mess that up...  And they did....  It had no caramelized sugar on top and sat in a cold case...   I thought to my self;  "Oh how neat they caramelize the sugar in front of you and make it all fresh!"  No, they don't. There is no caramelized sugar to CRACK on your freakin creme brullee, they told me "well there is caramel on the bottom"  It's not flaun, it's creme brulee damnit.  Not to mention it was totally instant mix from a box.  So nasty.   This place SUCKS. Way better buffets on the strip for a much better value, sure it's 27 bucks, but the food quality is about par with fast food that sit in a window forever.  And yes I still left the waiter 20% cause the only thing I can say good about this place is at least the service was good.  Don't waste your time or money.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disgusting.  If you can&#39;t do it right just take it off.

p1UXmVwBuWZ14nSbLjoIVA.text: The food here was AMAZING! Very flavorful, so the restaurant is aptly named. The service was also incredible. I got bottomless mimosas and the waitress never let me see the bottom of that glass! I would definitely come here again and recommend to all of my friends and family.

vFeEK2aascDFzZZ3PShNbA.text: It will never be a good review when a place gives you food poisoning.   Went for late brunch on the Sunday of a holiday weekend. Champagne was offered, but as I looked around people were taking a sip, putting it down, and not asking for re-fills so it must have been less than fabulous.  Food wasn't great, but the after-effects were even worse. Service wasn't bad at all, but the complete lack of any line, after we walked away from Paris due to a wait of over an hour, should have been a clue.   I will never darken their doorway again!

yHopfzajVCioqX0osVi-Ww.text: I had the lunch buffet on Christmas Eve so it was a little higher than normal price but it was one of the worst buffets I had on the strip. The carved turkey was dry, most of the food items were just left when they got low or emptied and no one behind the counter seemed to care. Only my server and the guy at the dessert counter had a smile. It was sad since I had been here a few years ago and all the food was great and cooked well. It has down hill and I do not recommend it.

2n-lKk6gjyeo37ZNTfclfQ.text: We came her on a Groupon tonight.  What a great deal for 2 people.  It was $40 for both of us for dinner.  And that included 2 alcoholic beverages per person (beer, wine).    The buffet isn't super fancy.  But we thought that the food tasted much better than it looked!  Usually it's the other way around, so we were pleasantly surprised.  Maybe it was the time of day.  We got here around 5:30pm, so it was early for dinner. There were only 2 couples ahead of us in line.  We were prepared to be disappointed but were quite surprised by everything.    The crab legs were nice and hot and fresh.  Peel-and-eat shrimp was nicely chilled and tasted fresh.  Spring rolls were fresh and lightly crispy.  I got the pizza when it must have just come out of the oven, so I got to take the first slice.  It had a lightly crispy crust with plenty of cheese and pepperoni.  It was only my last plate, so I was pretty stuffed by then.  But  it was so good that I couldn't stop eating it!   The desserts were kind of hit or miss.  One cupcake was dry and stale, but the red velvet cupcake was nice and moist.  The chocolate ice cream tasted a little off though, like carob.  It didn't have much of a chocolate-y flavor.    Overall, we were quite happy with our meal and are looking forward to going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried shrimp was so good I had to go back for more.  Best buffet pizza ever!
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream tasted off and not very chocolate-y
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef stir fry was great, spring rolls were fresh and crispy, chicken wings were bland, but juicy.

x8EeVntrfIRQigbarINN1A.text: Save your money and go else where.  We tried to use the group-on that was available for this place and the cashier got snappy at my wife and told us we couldnt use it on weekends and only use it on weekdays and to read the fine print.  Lots of space in the buffet but not a lot of variety to the food. The food itself was terrible and no flavor to anything.   The only thing positive I can say is they had Pepsi. Dont Bother with this Buffet.

QZ2p93XfBmiAK7ScS4RZJA.text: We only ate here once for breakfast while we were here this time. But last time we ate here a few times for breakfast and lunch.  This place is pretty good for breakfast.  They have a huge selection and a good carving station.  The desserts/pastries are slightly below average - some even tasting freezer burnt.  The waitress was right on top of keeping our table clean and our cups full.

BlvSts3PVd1lltX-pU8YBw.text: I chose the Harrah's buffet since it is near to where I was headed on the strip.  After waiting in line briefly, I was surprised by the price of $23.99 per person for breakfast.  Everywhere I read online or in periodicals stated the price as 19.99.  The manager said it was a recent price change that was not reflected online or anywhere else.  This price is higher than many other local buffets.  Unfortunately the higher price did not reflect in the quality of the buffet - the selection of food was average, service was average, and quality of the food was average.  An average buffet price would have been acceptable but the mediocre experience is not reflected in the higher price.    There are many good to great buffets; this is not one of them.

H-08r34jUPAgJhlYonB4vg.text: Good variety, but expected a lot higher quality. With the total rewards card, it's $21 weekday lunch. Of the 10-ish meats I tried, I liked the 4 from the carving station best. Avoided the sushi, but enjoyed the seaweed salad. Cornbread is nice and sweet. Bread rolls didn't look appetizing. Dessert array is massive, but the quality just was not there. Tried almost all of them and my faves were bread pudding, strawberry cheesecake, and cherry pie. This is a good deal if you have that $55 buffet of buffets 24-hr pass, but I'd pass on it otherwise.

jbZ9Rs2CkUIbULgriAoNRA.text: Pretty good selection and freshness. We liked the the small portions that made it easier to taste many things. Has a $9.99 add on for all you can drink beer/wine.   No crab legs. Great cornbread. Great selection of dessert! Use real ice cream including chocolate, vanilla, mint, cookies n cream, strawberry.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavors of ice cream.

EiVHWO7U44TBIMQ-uYA8Bg.text: My uncle has a lot of points and comps at Harrahs so he wanted to take us to the Harrahs' buffet for lunch.  None of the food was very good.  We got to go in the special door since my uncle has a high level in the club.  Of course, there were other people in the line in front of us who should have gone to the regular line but the cashier took care of them anyway.  I guess that is good customer service.  We got a table right by the buffet which was nice.  There are tons of options available on the buffet but nothing was superb.  Clam chowder was really the only thing that I thought was really good.  Everything else was just ok.  Crab legs were old and hard to break open.  Salad bar options were lacking.  Hot stuff was just okay.  Desserts were just okay too.  Gelato was good but cupcakes were boring.   Definitely not some place I will go back to unless we are eating on points.

byXyf9W4eaPuFeywmLf0Cw.text: Perfectly adequate for a solid dinner. Prime rib was delicious. Most of the other offerings were of the typical hot-plate variety, like fajitas, fried chicken, pizza, and what they tried to pass off as chow mein. The desserts helped to make up for it though. Overall, I was quite pleased with the food for the price ($27 for dinner). Add in the fact that it was only a 10 minute wait at prime time dinner time (7pm) when Caesars Buffet had an hour and a half wait, and I was perfectly happy at Harrah's.   It's not mind-blowing.  But if you're hungry, you'll likely be satisfied.

nZkdTR3z7MoKT2evtRxdiw.text: The Worst food I've ever had! Very disappointed for throwing away my $30 and to top it off I tipped at the register, not knowing they don't even bring you water. I gave the two stars because of the pizza only thing warm on this buffet. The soda machine was not working I had to tell my waiter twice. The dessert was good but the person serving it was rude very unhappy and unfriendly. Overall very disappointed Never again.

egqrplNORFkVVhq2_VkuTg.text: We had the wristbands to go to several buffets, but staying in the Palazzo we got a little lazy the second day and went here instead of walking further down. The food here is pretty much the same as other buffets but the service was super slow.  My husband I ate breakfast here twice and both times the refills never came. We watched our waitress talking to another table about fashion. I stopped a different waitress and she said I had to wait for our waitress. okay.   Finally, she came back for refills about the time we were leaving. I don't think I'd go back here just based on the slow refills, call me picky, but those buffets are not cheap. If you don't opt in for the wrist band, which pays for itself in basically two meals, then show your Harrah's card and get a discount.   They were cool enough the morning our wristbands were expired to give us lunch at breakfast pricing because it was about five minutes after they stopped serving it.

qpejQVUF_w1f9iKJH3pzNw.text: I used to DIE to come to this buffet. The food was amazing: great selection, hot and fresh and just plain delicious. I'm not sure what happened....  The food now is awful! The selection is basic, the food is barely mediocre and the quality just went down the rain. I will not be back to this buffet that was once my must have.   I will say this buffet is much cheaper than the others, but by no means is it any good.

uh6ayEwufBbddipP3qB5DA.text: this buffet is more on the pricey side and with the players card you only get $1 off but it is so worth it they have prime rib and crab legs and shrimp every day every section  has a huge selection  everything that we tried looked extremely fresh and was hot and the desert counter oMG it was one of the biggest I've ever seen out in Las Vegas they had probably 15 different kinds of just cupcakes  so if you're looking for an amazing experience with crab legs cotton candy homemade gelato and prime rib this is your place to go

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs every day hot or cold idgaf
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hhhmmm
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmhhhhmmmmm

gUhzMxwuxfJ19T9jv5Pa9Q.text: Impressive!  By far one of my favorite buffet places in Las Vegas (right under the Rio).  For starters, if you are spoiled and have high expectations of fine dining at a buffet...you might as well forget even going, because its not going to happen!  This buffet has a whole variety of yummy goodness.  The dessert area is incredible...I have never seen such a great variety before...complete with 3 different kinds of cotton candy (have you ever seen that before).  The food is better than your average run-in-the-mill buffet.  My favorite food item was the creamy clam chowder soup...some of the best clam chowder I have ever had in my life.

PG-1YLlBA9wxJIGgYyl2Vg.text: I have been to this buffet twice now. The first time was this past summer but I forgot to write a review.  I remembered the buffet being yummy with lots of options and most importantly AFFORDABLE.  So when my brother and I ventured over to Vegas for a turn-around trip, I suggested we hit up this buffet to stuff our faces so full that we wouldn't even consider spending money on food for the rest of the trip.   The food wasn't as good as I remembered but it still did what it was supposed to do... fill us to the brim.  We only made it 3 plates in before noticing a new addition to the buffet service... the option for unlimited alcoholic drinks for only $9.99 per person!  The unlimited drinks option includes domestic bottled beer, mimosas, bloody mary's and wine. It is available all day. So really, if you committed, you could buy it for lunch and sit there drinking for 5-6 hours.   I only wish this deal was available without the purchase of the buffet because OH MY GOD... we were sooooooo full after eating and then drinking 6 mimosas each in 45 minutes.  We had stopped into the buffet with 1.5 hours until it closed. The first half hour was spent getting food, eating food, losing our table in the sea of tables, arguing with the waitress because I thought our table had disappeared, getting food, eating food. The final 45 minutes of our time in the restaurant was spent chugging mimosas.  I'm not sure if you have ever tried to chug mimosas, but it is not easy. The carbonation really starts to catch up to you. The first two went down easily. The second two took a little more effort. We started stirring the mimosas before drinking them to make them a little less filling and bubbly. The fifth was a challenge and required some inappropriate pre-drink belching to clear space. The final drink was downright painful. Our bellies were full of food, alcohol and carbonation. I was very surprised that the final mimosa didn't shoot right back out of my mouth for lack of space.   Our discomfort and over-consumption would not have been possible without a very attentive server who completely understood our goal. The mimosas were stronger each time and he was beating us to the punch by delivering our next mimosa as soon as we finished the previous. He even gave us two final mimosas that we just couldn't finish so we gave them to the neighboring table.  We left the buffet clutching our stomachs and waddling a little. But we were happy and a little buzzed.  So long story short; if you go to this buffet, are of legal drinking age and want to challenge yourself with unlimited drinks... show up earlier so you can take your sweet time. The food is good and isn't expensive but the unlimited drink deal is even better. Go Harrah's!  Food part of buffet: 3 stars Service part of buffet: 4 stars Drinks part of buffet: 5 stars Average: 4 stars... hence my rating.

jsNCpXPzeXVMi0A2D_r0hg.text: We came here on a Tuesday for lunch and had 2AYCE ($22) and 2AYCD ($10) for the price of the Groupon for $30.98  - In Harrah's - Usually you have to pay for the tax , but the cashier included it with the Groupon. Score! - We took 2 pictures with a spoon and a fork, funny and normal. Pix come out to $25 if you wanna buy it.  - We came around 2-3pm, so the presentation of the food did not look as appetizing, not fresh. The sushi rice was hard and shrimp cocktail was running low.  - The carved steak was fresh and delicious. I helped myself to a couple more slices.  - The variety of the food was standard: Mexican, Chinese, Italian, American, soups and salad, and dessert.  - I enjoyed the hard tacos, always a solid choice for me. As long as there is sour creme a guacamole, its all good. Similar to Feast buffet.  - The Italian food was tasty. I recommend the  clam linguini.  - I usually don't get fried food, but I did try the fried fish fillet and it was good.  - For dessert, the cupcakes are small, so you can help yourself to a variety of flavors.  - Save room for ice cream, especially their mint, so you can sprinkle oreo cookies on top! - For drinks, I helped myself to hot tea, coors light, and a couple mimosas.  - Before you leave, grab some cotton candy to eat while walking on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QMEZ45HaxBG6rBf5NUrFsw.text: We spent a good two weeks in Vegas trying all of the starred buffets.  I am a crab fiend and usually end up consuming nothing but crab legs and alcohol.  Of ALL the buffets we tried (Mirage, Bacchanal, Wicked Spoon, Flamingo, etc), Flavors was the only buffet which offered WHOLE, not sliced, crab legs.  How wonderful.

TRUP97CqqA_MRFPVMD-ZGg.text: I felt that the quality of the food went down from the previous time I ate here two years ago. However, they still have amazing service. Before, a waiter would bring/refill drinks for you, but now it is self-serve. Joel was very quick & kind with helping us clear our plates. Billy(?) who was behind the ice cream counter was very friendly with everyone.

DqBA-8ODtM0l7oG_C0xRRg.text: Service =  meh.  Not exactly friendly folks.   The only person who was friendly was the hostess.  The cashier, server, and people behind the counter were all grumpy.  Food = hit or miss.  Their pastas were delicious.... desserts were blah.  Ice cream/gelato = blah  They had decent seafood.    Best part of this visit though, was the drunk lady and her husband.  Drunk lady was arguing with the hostess about seating, then saying no tip for you, and then told husband, if you tip, we're getting divorced.  I'm sure he's missing out on a lot. She still had a drink in her hand, btw.  LOL

GHuAecsn7YeAKfvZmNqm1A.text: I'm more of a comfort food kinda person. So crab legs, and all the fancy steaks aren't for me. Their mac and cheese: bomb. Asian section is like Panda Express. Assorted fresh sushi rolls: vegetable and crab meat. Their sausage is perfect, not too salty. I mainly came here because of the buy one get one free coupon for lunch. And I can definitely say it's worth it if you love simple genuine food. Sadly my fork wasn't cleaned and was stuck to the napkin. But the waitress kindly gave me a new pair. Delicious desserts: variety of ice cream, cupcakes, rolls, and cakes. Also, they have fresh grapefruit and orange juices! YASYASYAS. This buffet serves Mexican, American, Chinese, and seafood. Oh and their cinnamon buns are  some spectacular shit.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I&#39;m yes please cinnamon roll.
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese
Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious sausages

QYBPqHEeE95jxZBkCJ0SaA.text: Food was great. My favorite part was the homemade ice cream. Delicious. I'm not ashamed to say I walked away after eating 2 cones of the vanilla ice cream. I was at one point mistreated by the steak guy who scoffed at me when I politely asked to have a medium well piece made. He laughed and said all they had was the pieces on display, which were all rare and bloody. I know he was discriminating against me because my dad had his made to order from him like 20 minutes before I walked up to him. No thanks. The seafood selection was great. My dad loves the crab legs. I loved the macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, and shrimp. The selection could definitely be better though.   To be honest we might not go back unless we get the generous coupons our hotel gave us. Buy one get one free. The plates cost $30/person The drink is included "complimentary" with this price.   The service was below average. We unfortunately had an older waitress who came by like every 30 minutes and we had to flag her down for drinks.   So yeah all of the food was good, but like I said I won't go back unless I get those coupons.

nqRrluXgFhmh-75CZkk-Nw.text: Omg the most horrible buffet I have ever had in LV, first of all lack of a variety of food. Second, the Chinese food has a weird of taste, especially the sweet and sour soup was tasting bitter. But the good thing is that they have crab and craw fish during lunch time. I would never give it a try next time.

fb_sajbW7vwANfOgHOr-Dg.text: Horrible Buffet! One of the worst places to eat at in Las Vegas! The food was cold, old and tasted as if it was leftovers from last night. Not to mention the staff is horrible! Very rude, and very little attention to detail. I guess you get what you pay for.. I don't recommend this place at all' the selection is poor and very old. DON'T WAIST YOUR MONEY HERE, pay a little extra and go somewhere else.

IYl1CaW-G-0ELHeulhjRfg.text: Cute.   This used to be our go-to buffet when Yelp wasn't so popular, and when I was too lazy to try anything other than what I was comfortable with.   The food is pretty good. My aunt took us here for brunch recently. The main thing that I loved the most was the smoked salmon. Other than that, the food wasn't particularly outstanding. There are buffets in LV around the same price point with better food. It's all good though. Come here if you don't want to leave the hotel room or if you're on a quest to try every single buffet in LV. Who knows, you might love it, if you're into the whole "Little bit less than luxury" thing and aren't too picky.

lR4yn6mNnDLTBvCs50ddmQ.text: Breakfast was above average. A lot of options to choose from. Fruit station was great..very fresh. If you can get a discount using your hotel key card or a Groupon or other deal, it's definitely worth the value.

Dyqxw9qJUwe2VoOIEgGV9Q.text: Best place I've ever eaten at. It has a gelato bar which is way better than any basic place in Vegas. Not only that but it has food from around the world. Overall this place beats any place you might be thinking about eating in, in Vegas

JYGcQY0mlWmdpamrH8IatA.text: Horrible horrible horrible I would not recommend this buffet to anybody the food tasted bad. All the meats they had were very dry. Seems like serve you old meat. The sushi the crab legs and shrimp were also horrible. The sushi had a very bad taste to it and was also very dry. I spent over $180 on my family just a waste of money could've gone to a high-end restaurant and have had a nice meal with the family!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors The Buffet - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old shrimp and crab legs

jTNCwgeUe2trB68P5gmAVA.text: Food was very good, hot n fresh but we left feeling like we highly over paid. Nothing was THAT amazing to pay 23.99 per person when we both only ate 1 plate a piece..

Zp-l8McpSaNiJDu2kU8vNA.text: Don't. Unless you're looking for a hometown buffet like experience and a bad upset stomach, just don't.   Of all the Vegas buffets, I don't know how we landed here. After looking at a couple different buffets and getting frustrated with high prices, I really wish we had just splurged and gone some place more expensive. While flavors is one of the better "deals," you get what you pay for. We should have taken clues from the empty dining room but we still went for it.   I stared in disgust at the subpar day old sushi, picked at the macaroni and cheese and found some barely palatable chicken wings. The desert selection was wide and all included some form of gelatin.  The staff was all wonderful, friendly and attentive made the scary culinary experience slightly more pleasant.

J227NdRR0GurJGGl0EjDgw.text: This is easily the worst place I've ever eaten in my life.  I'm a human dumpster, I'll fucking eat anything, and I ate NOTHING here. I spit out more food here than I've ever spit out in one sitting.  My previous highscore was 0 spit outs. I got up to 3 at this place.  Granted I didn't get the crab legs. The ONLY reason to come here is for the crab legs, which is not a steal if you think about the fact that you have to surround yourself with retards who are mobbing them.  Other than that this place is a dump.  I paid for the $10 all you can drink thing, and said fuck it. I drank my dinner...2 bottles of champagne and 4 bud lights.  Some of you may be jizzing all over your keyboard right now thinking: WTF DUDE 1 STAR and YOU GOT ALL YOU CAN DRINK FOR $10.  No, dickweeds, I paid $25 for the buffet and then I had to pay $10 more. So I paid $35 for drinks, and I had to drink them in the presence of an annoying buffet and shit pants children.  PS: Who the fuck brings toddlers to Vegas. GET YOUR FUCKING STROLLER OUT OF HERE.  Everyone here hates you, most of all your kids, who are in a nightmare scenario where they are surrounded by video games that they can't play.  Think it through fuckers.

yaHexSjqN5OSdkAYZImMFw.text: Flavors is decent but nothing to rave about despite earlier reviews! I enjoyed the seafood bar and sushi. It was good but not great. Overall, everything else was pretty mediocre, bland, and just about flavorless. However, our server was pretty attentive and sweet! It's the average price of a buffet in Vegas. I seriously doubt I'll come back the next time I'm in town other than for the great service. The food is decent at best and there's not much else to say about "Flavors".

s-LoNLsPDJiB37gqtwkVaw.text: We been waiting for about 20 minutes,  went inside to check out the place,  big surprise... place has plenty of available tables,  I guess they do this so they can force you to buy the DIAMOND pass,  another $20.00 extra, and you don't have to wait in line... food is ok

J7r90DU8UVGaT2p4NzYDDQ.text: Decent buffet for the price. Wasn't crazy about the Chinese selections. Except for the orange chicken. But the American food was pretty good. The fried chicken and vegetable lasagna was tasty. Lunch and dinner are very similar. Not much of a difference in food but a serious difference in price. Okay buffet if your looking to get full fast

DwPOlqWVw-0QWIBDC8bAGw.text: This was an excellent choice for breakfast. My husband and I purchased a "Buffet of Buffets " bracelet and decided to do breakfast at this Harrahs buffet based on other Yelp reviews. It was an excellent choice for breakfast and they had a great spread. I am a big of an egg snob and will only eat perfectly cooked scrambled eggs. Their eggs were spot on and the bacon was crunchy. Recommend this for breakfast based on my experiences.

l1MCbKoIjGcCXebPxkJSGA.text: Buffets may be in every hotel in Vegas, but they don't come any worse than this one.  Overpriced, horrendously rude service, lousy atmosphere, and inedible food.  Go somewhere else or do without.  Don't waste your time or money.  Your stomach will thank you for it.

QLatukG0JBAZ2vBxFMZvdw.text: Was pretty tasty overall. I like how they divide the buffet up into different types of food (Italian, Asian, Mexican, Fresh Seafood, Steak, Desserts).  Most of the food I got was really good. The pastas are awesome, the prime rib with au jus and creamy horse radish sauce is comparable to a middle-end steak house, and the Asian foods (mostly Chinese) taste just like panda express, which is a plus in my book.  I was somewhat disappointed with the fresh seafood selection since much of it didn't taste as fresh as I would have hoped, and the crab legs that everyone always goes crazy over were mediocre at best. Also the dessert selection is rather limited, but tasty none the less.  I've been to many buffets on the strip, and for the price you can't really beat this one.

47OdJZ44xATteYhsAiWr7w.text: Went for breakfast - I remember this place being much better several years ago. Waiter was kinda a dick (until I tipped him!), the food was mostly cold (I'd say over 60% of the food was at room temperature). The bonus - no wait. Blackberries are good.

4jTfty48Fq4bX4Y0_-LI_Q.text: Id rather go to a Chinese buffet in NY. The steak is like chewing gummy bears without flavor.

Jm-5h5iFOSgqsY9JpyKztw.text: I can't give it four stars but it is indeed worthy of three.  Falls in the middle of the pack when it comes to Vegas Buffets.

uqQaLUxAspP_D6Prgl9_cA.text: Dined here for breakfast as our 2nd stop on the buffet of buffets adventure. I was still full from the buffet at Paris the night before but I did my best to try many things.   I was very impressed with the large # of options available during breakfast. They had the typical breakfast fare as well as taco/mexican items, gelato and dessert.   I liked that our drink order was on the ticket so that our server knew what to bring without us having to sit an wait. Our service here was was very good.   I felt the biscuits and gravy were decent for a buffet. The bacon was cooked just right and I am very picky. The grits were not very good. The oatmeal looked good and had self-serve toppings but I did not try it. The fresh fruit, especially the strawberries was very good. They had a nice yogurt bar with various toppings. I really enjoyed the vanilla yogurt with blueberries and granola. I had a mini brownie to cap off the meal. One of the better brownies I have every tried. I could not get over how moist it was and how flavorful the chocolate was. I really wanted to try another. I also wish I would've had room and the nerve to try the gelato for breakfast.   Note they also had a cappuccino machine which was a nice touch (I did not try).   Will definitely return for the breakfast buffet.

N971F7r6gI2j-Qfd2IuE-A.text: Had dinner here last week because i had a coupon for $20.00 I was pretty hungry, but to my surprise the food wasn't even good. I didn't eat much because the quality of the food didn't taste good to me at al. I just wasted my money eating here. I wouldn't eat here again.

2S-hRy6gP_La0oHMYE4Xwg.text: Overall an ok buffet. Not anything better or different than what you can find in LA.  I enjoyed the mashed potatoes and chow mien. Their dessert section is large and they have cotton candy that they allow you to walk out with so that  was cool. I came because I purchased the buffets of buffets and this was the closest to our hotel.

Cwglds8Jqt6aHCY-YUDL1A.text: No point in spending twenty bucks at this buffet, when you can walk across the street and go to a much better one. Poor quality and poor selection.

N20No8CMo6MQ9eEfi0HdYQ.text: So worth the price!   So much better than the $30 I paid for at the Mandalay bay buffet the night before.  Loved their dessert options!

by5deJiUcBaUJkF1NQH-Zw.text: Gross.  I knew it would not be the best, but I was here for a cheap table game, and I settled.  The waiters were surly and unprofessional, dropping off two of my sodas and leaving forever, arguing within earshot, not looking you in the eye.  The selection was terrible, salty, and of low quality.  The only thing I enjoyed here was the cotton candy, and guess what, TI has that too!  And somehow, it is a better quality cotton candy.  Keep walking!

UWKDQDe25zC6lvmqkBpyZg.text: Deserts are really good as is crab shrimp and Brazilian pork with chimichurro sauce.  We got a two for one dinner deal because we saw the afternoon show.  Both the show and the buffet at half price were worth it.  Save room for dessert, especially gelato.

3uroLhy4xZ4rer-iXztgBQ.text: we had a coupon, which is the initial reason for our farewell dinner. saved a couple bucks for a decent filling meal. not much to complain about.  typical selection when it came down to the variety of dishes. quality wasn't out of this world. honestly, after a couple bites i was already on to the next. the taco station was probably the only venue that had me returning. oh, and the gelato too of course. it could use a few more flavors though. unfortunately we had a late dinner so by the time we were ready for dessert, cotton candy was over! boohoo to the one thing that seemed interesting!  our waitress was really sweet and super efficient as well. which is more that i can say for the hostess who practically chewed my head off for not wearing shoes! that is until i pointed down and she realized i was in flats and carrying my heels...

hJNJJOoi3uj8ckYZLo5DCg.text: Still one of my favorite buffets on the strip.  Good variety of food and good quality.  Be sure to get the $39.99 24hour deal.

wAN1Fk3jI-uOxJsL3GkN6g.text: Yeah I do not get all the buffet bashing. I loved this place and they had pretty much anything your belly desired. I will not go into what I got, since it was pretty much one of everything. But it was a short wait, all things considered, since most buffets make long lines. The price was decent, around $20 which includes your drink and soft served ice cream machine. Great way to recover from an extreme hangover.

i0q65lhNqT8T_NRnIZo5qQ.text: Totally avoid this place. Spend a few more $$s and go to the one at Bellagio but do so after 12noon as the Japenese and Italian stations do not open until then. The food at Flavor lacked flavor completely. It must take some effort to make simple dishes taste so bad!

qdyUnCK_wiLxX82ESoA83Q.text: Been here almost every time I have been to Vegas (too many to count) and the food is good. There is a very large selection of different types of food and they always have crab legs and shrimp (YUM!). By far the best part of it is the dessert section. There is every kind of pie or cake you could think of. They also had a chocolate fountain where you could dip strawberries, rice crispy treats, marshmallows, bananas....anything really! It was so good I ate a whole plate of desserts with things stacked on top of other things! I will always come back to this buffet =)
